1.verse: BOOK I Psalms 1–41 Psalm 1 - Blessed is the person who obeys the law of the LORD. They don’t follow the advice of evil people. They don’t make a habit of doing what sinners do. They don’t join those who make fun of the LORD and his law.

2.verse: Instead, the law of the LORD gives them joy. They think about his law day and night.

3.verse: That kind of person is like a tree that is planted near a stream of water. It always bears its fruit at the right time. Its leaves don’t dry up. Everything godly people do turns out well.

4.verse: Sinful people are not like that at all. They are like straw that the wind blows away.

5.verse: When the LORD judges them, their life will come to an end. Sinners won’t have any place among those who are godly.

6.verse: The LORD watches over the lives of godly people. But the lives of sinful people will lead to their death.

1.verse: Why do the nations plan evil together? Why do they make useless plans?

2.verse: The kings of the earth rise up against the LORD. The rulers of the earth join together against his anointed king.

3.verse: “Let us break free from their chains,” they say. “Let us throw off their ropes.”

4.verse: The God who sits on his throne in heaven laughs. The Lord makes fun of those rulers and their plans.

5.verse: When he is angry, he warns them. When his anger blazes out, he terrifies them.

6.verse: He says to them, “I have placed my king on my holy mountain of Zion.”

7.verse: I will announce what the LORD has promised. He said to me, “You are my son. Today I have become your father.

8.verse: Ask me, and I will give the nations to you. All nations on earth will belong to you.

9.verse: You will break them with an iron scepter. You will smash them to pieces like clay pots.”

10.verse: Kings, be wise! Rulers of the earth, be warned!

11.verse: Serve the LORD and have respect for him. Celebrate his rule with trembling.

12.verse: Obey the son completely, or he will be angry. Your way of life will lead to your death. His anger can blaze out at any moment. Blessed are all those who go to him for safety.

1.verse: A psalm of David when he ran away from his son Absalom. LORD, I have so many enemies! So many people are rising up against me!

2.verse: Many are saying about me, “God will not save him.”

3.verse: LORD, you are like a shield that keeps me safe. You bring me honor. You help me win the battle.

4.verse: I call out to the LORD. He answers me from his holy mountain.

5.verse: I lie down and sleep. I wake up again, because the LORD takes care of me.

6.verse: I won’t be afraid even though tens of thousands attack me on every side.

7.verse: LORD, rise up! My God, save me! Strike all my enemies in the face. Break the teeth of sinful people.

8.verse: LORD, you are the one who saves. May your blessing be on your people.

1.verse: For the director of music. A psalm of David to be played on stringed instruments. My faithful God, answer me when I call out to you. Give me rest from my trouble. Have mercy on me. Hear my prayer.

2.verse: How long will you people turn my glory into shame? How long will you love what will certainly fail you? How long will you pray to statues of gods?

3.verse: Remember that the LORD has set apart his faithful servant for himself. The LORD hears me when I call out to him.

4.verse: Tremble and do not sin. When you are in bed, look deep down inside yourself and be silent.

5.verse: Offer to the LORD the sacrifices that godly people offer. Trust in him.

6.verse: LORD, many are asking, “Who will make us successful?” LORD, may you do good things for us.

7.verse: Fill my heart with joy when the people have lots of grain and fresh wine.

8.verse: In peace I will lie down and sleep. LORD, you alone keep me safe.

1.verse: For the director of music. A psalm of David to be played on flutes. LORD, listen to my words. Pay attention when I mourn.

2.verse: My King and my God, hear me when I cry for help. I pray to you.

3.verse: LORD, in the morning you hear my voice. In the morning I pray to you. I wait for you in hope.

4.verse: For you, God, aren’t happy with anything that is evil. Those who do what is wrong can’t live where you are.

5.verse: Those who are proud can’t stand in front of you. You hate everyone who does what is evil.

6.verse: You destroy those who tell lies. LORD, you hate murderers and those who cheat others.

7.verse: Because of your great love I can come into your house. With deep respect I bow down toward your holy temple.

8.verse: LORD, I have many enemies. Lead me in your right path. Make your way smooth and straight for me.

9.verse: Not a word from their mouths can be trusted. Their hearts are filled with a desire to hurt others. Their throats are like open graves. With their tongues they tell lies.

10.verse: God, show that they are guilty. Let their evil plans bring them down. Send them away because of their many sins. They have refused to obey you.

11.verse: But let all those who go to you for safety be glad. Let them always sing for joy. Spread your cover over them and keep them safe. Then those who love you will be glad because of you.

12.verse: Surely, LORD, you bless those who do what is right. Like a shield, your loving care keeps them safe.

1.verse: For the director of music. According to sheminith. A psalm of David to be played on stringed instruments. LORD, don’t correct me when you are angry. Don’t punish me when you are very angry.

2.verse: LORD, have mercy on me. I’m so weak. LORD, heal me. My body is full of pain.

3.verse: My soul is very troubled. LORD, how long will it be until you save me?

4.verse: LORD, turn to me and help me. Save me. Your love never fails.

5.verse: Dead people can’t call out your name. How can they praise you when they are in the grave?

6.verse: My groaning has worn me out. All night long my tears flood my bed. My bed is wet because of my crying.

7.verse: I’m so sad I can’t see very well. My eyesight gets worse because of all my enemies.

8.verse: Get away from me, all you who do evil. The LORD has heard my weeping.

9.verse: The LORD has heard my cry for his mercy. The LORD accepts my prayer.

10.verse: All my enemies will be covered with shame and trouble. They will turn back in shame. It will happen suddenly.

1.verse: A shiggaion of David. He sang it to the LORD about Cush, who was from the tribe of Benjamin. LORD my God, I go to you for safety. Help me. Save me from all those who are chasing me.

2.verse: If you don’t, they will tear me apart as if they were lions. They will rip me to pieces so that no one can save me.

3.verse: LORD my God, suppose I have done something wrong. Suppose I am guilty.

4.verse: Or I have done evil to my friend. Or I have robbed my enemy without any reason.

5.verse: Then let my enemy chase me and catch me. Let him stomp me into the ground. Let him bury me in the dust.

6.verse: LORD, rise up in your anger. Rise up against the great anger of my enemies. My God, wake up. Command that the right thing be done.

7.verse: Let all the people of the earth gather around you. Rule over them from your throne in heaven.

8.verse: LORD, judge all people. LORD, show that I have done what is right. Most High God, remember that I am honest.

9.verse: God, you always do what is right. You look deep down inside the hearts and minds of people. Bring to an end the terrible things sinful people do. Make godly people safe.

10.verse: The Most High God is like a shield that keeps me safe. He saves those whose hearts are honest.

11.verse: God judges fairly. He shows his anger every day.

12.verse: If evil people don’t change their ways, God will sharpen his sword. He will get his bow ready to use.

13.verse: He has prepared his deadly weapons. He has made his flaming arrows ready.

14.verse: Whoever is full of evil plans trouble and ends up telling lies.

15.verse: Whoever digs a hole and shovels it out falls into the pit they have made.

16.verse: The trouble they cause comes back on them. The terrible things they do will happen to them.

17.verse: I will give thanks to the LORD because he does what is right. I will sing the praises of the name of the LORD Most High.

1.verse: For the director of music. According to gittith. A psalm of David. LORD, our Lord, how majestic is your name in the whole earth! You have set your glory in the heavens.

2.verse: You have made sure that children and infants praise you. Their praise is a wall that stops the talk of your enemies.

3.verse: I think about the heavens. I think about what your fingers have created. I think about the moon and stars that you have set in place.

4.verse: What are human beings that you think about them? What is a son of man that you take care of him?

5.verse: You have made them a little lower than the angels. You placed on them a crown of glory and honor.

6.verse: You made human beings rule over everything your hands created. You put everything under their control.

7.verse: They rule over all flocks and herds and over the wild animals.

8.verse: They rule over the birds in the sky and over the fish in the ocean. They rule over everything that swims in the oceans.

9.verse: LORD, our Lord, how majestic is your name in the whole earth!

1.verse: For the director of music. A psalm of David to the tune of “The Death of the Son.” LORD, I will give thanks to you with all my heart. I will tell about all the wonderful things you have done.

2.verse: I will be glad and full of joy because of you. Most High God, I will sing the praises of your name.

3.verse: My enemies turn back. They fall down and die right in front of you.

4.verse: You have proved that I haven’t done anything wrong. You have sat on your throne and judged fairly.

5.verse: You have punished the nations. You have destroyed evil people. You have erased their names from your book for ever and ever.

6.verse: My enemies have been destroyed forever. You have leveled their cities to the ground. Even the memory of them is gone.

7.verse: The LORD rules forever. He has set up his throne so that he can judge people.

8.verse: He rules the world in keeping with what is right. He judges all its people fairly.

9.verse: The LORD is a place of safety for those who have been treated badly. He keeps them safe in times of trouble.

10.verse: LORD, those who know you will trust in you. You have never deserted those who look to you.

11.verse: Sing the praises of the LORD. He rules from his throne in Zion. Tell among the nations what he has done.

12.verse: The God who pays back murderers remembers. He doesn’t forget the cries of those who are hurting.

13.verse: LORD, see how badly my enemies treat me! Help me! Don’t let me go down to the gates of death!

14.verse: Then I can give praise to you at the gates of the city of Zion. There I will be full of joy because you have saved me.

15.verse: The nations have fallen into the pit they have dug. Their feet are caught in the net they have hidden.

16.verse: The LORD is known to be fair by the things he does. Evil people are trapped by what they have done.

17.verse: Sinful people go down to the place of the dead. So do all the nations that forget God.

18.verse: But God will never forget needy people. The hope of those who are hurting will never die.

19.verse: LORD, rise up. Don’t let people win the battle. Let the nations come to you and be judged.

20.verse: LORD, strike them with terror. Let the nations know they are only human beings.

1.verse: LORD, why are you so far away? Why do you hide yourself in times of trouble?

2.verse: An evil person is proud and hunts down those who are weak. He catches weak people by making clever plans.

3.verse: He brags about what his heart desires. He speaks well of those who always want more. He attacks the LORD with his words.

4.verse: Because he is proud, that evil person doesn’t turn to the LORD. There is no room for God in any of his thoughts.

5.verse: Everything always goes well for him. So he is proud. He doesn’t want to have anything to do with God’s laws. He makes fun of all his enemies.

6.verse: He says to himself, “I will always be secure.” He promises himself, “No one will ever harm me.”

7.verse: His mouth is full of lies and warnings. With his tongue he speaks evil and makes trouble.

8.verse: Sinful people hide and wait near the villages. From their hiding places they murder people who aren’t guilty. They watch in secret for those they want to attack.

9.verse: They hide and wait like a lion in the bushes. From their hiding places they wait to catch those who are helpless. They catch them and drag them off in their nets.

10.verse: Those they have attacked are beaten up. They fall to the ground. They fall because their attackers are too strong for them.

11.verse: Sinful people say to themselves, “God will never notice. He covers his face. He never sees us.”

12.verse: LORD, rise up! God, show your power! Don’t forget those who are helpless.

13.verse: Why do sinful people attack you with their words? Why do they say to themselves, “He won’t hold us accountable”?

14.verse: God, you see the problems of people in trouble. You take note of their pain. You do something about it. So those who are attacked place themselves in your care. You help children whose fathers have died.

15.verse: Take away the power of sinful people. Hold them accountable for the evil things they do. Uncover all the evil they have done.

16.verse: The LORD is King for ever and ever. The nations will disappear from his land.

17.verse: LORD, you hear the desires of those who are hurting. You cheer them up and give them hope. You listen to their cries.

18.verse: You stand up for those whose fathers have died and for those who have been treated badly. You do it so that mere human beings made of dust may not terrify others anymore.

1.verse: For the director of music. A psalm of David. I run to the LORD for safety. So how can you say to me, “Fly away like a bird to your mountain.

2.verse: Look! Evil people are bending their bows. They are placing their arrows against the strings. They are planning to shoot from the shadows at those who have honest hearts.

3.verse: When law and order are being destroyed, what can godly people do?”

4.verse: The LORD is in his holy temple. The LORD is on his throne in heaven. He watches everyone on earth. His eyes study them.

5.verse: The LORD watches over those who do what is right. But he really hates sinful people and those who love to hurt others.

6.verse: He will pour out flaming coals and burning sulfur on those who do what is wrong. A hot and dry wind will destroy them.

7.verse: The LORD always does what is right. So he loves it when people do what is fair. Those who are honest will enjoy his blessing.

1.verse: For the director of music. According to sheminith. A psalm of David. Help, LORD! No one does what is right anymore. Those who are faithful have disappeared from the human race.

2.verse: Everyone tells lies to their neighbors. With their lips they praise others, but they don’t really mean it.

3.verse: May the LORD close all lips that don’t mean what they say. May he stop every tongue that brags.

4.verse: They say, “What we speak with our tongues will win the battle. What we say with our lips will keep us safe. No one will have victory over us.”

5.verse: The LORD says, “The poor are being robbed. Those who are in need groan. So I will stand up to help them. I will keep them safe from those who tell lies about them.”

6.verse: The words of the LORD are perfect. They are like silver made pure in a clay furnace. They are like gold made pure seven times over.

7.verse: LORD, you will keep needy people safe. You will always keep sinners from hurting us.

8.verse: Proud and sinful people walk around openly when the evil they do is praised by the human race.

1.verse: For the director of music. A psalm of David. LORD, how long must I wait? Will you forget me forever? How long will you turn your face away from me?

2.verse: How long must I struggle with my thoughts? How long must my heart be sad day after day? How long will my enemies keep winning the battle over me?

3.verse: LORD my God, look at me and answer me. Give me new life, or I will die.

4.verse: Then my enemies will say, “We have beaten him.” They will be filled with joy when I die.

5.verse: But I trust in your faithful love. My heart is filled with joy because you will save me.

6.verse: I will sing praise to the LORD. He has been so good to me.

1.verse: For the director of music. A psalm of David. Foolish people say in their hearts, “There is no God.” They do all kinds of horrible and evil things. No one does anything good.

2.verse: The LORD looks down from heaven on all people. He wants to see if there are any who understand. He wants to see if there are any who trust in God.

3.verse: All of them have turned away. They have all become evil. No one does anything good, no one at all.

4.verse: Do all these people who do evil know nothing? They eat up my people as if they were eating bread. They never call out to the LORD.

5.verse: But just look at them! They are filled with terror because God is among those who do right.

6.verse: You who do evil keep poor people from succeeding. But the LORD is their place of safety.

7.verse: How I pray that the God who saves Israel will come out of Zion! Then the LORD will bless his people with great success again. So let the people of Jacob be filled with joy! Let Israel be glad!

1.verse: A psalm of David. LORD, who can live in your sacred tent? Who can stay on your holy mountain?

2.verse: Anyone who lives without blame and does what is right. They speak the truth from their heart.

3.verse: They don’t tell lies about other people. They don’t do wrong to their neighbors. They don’t say anything bad about them.

4.verse: They hate evil people. But they honor those who have respect for the LORD. They keep their promises even when it hurts. They do not change their mind.

5.verse: They lend their money to poor people without charging interest. They don’t accept money to harm those who aren’t guilty. Anyone who lives like that will always be secure.

1.verse: A miktam of David. My God, keep me safe. I go to you for safety.

2.verse: I say to the LORD, “You are my Lord. Without you, I don’t have anything that is good.”

3.verse: I say about God’s people who live in our land, “They are the noble ones. I take great delight in them.”

4.verse: Those who run after other gods will suffer more and more. I will not pour out offerings of blood to those gods. My lips will not speak their names.

5.verse: LORD, you alone are everything I need. You make my life secure.

6.verse: I am very pleased with what you have given me. I am very happy with what I’ve received from you.

7.verse: I will praise the LORD. He gives me good advice. Even at night my heart teaches me.

8.verse: I keep my eyes always on the LORD. He is at my right hand. So I will always be secure.

9.verse: So my heart is glad. Joy is on my tongue. My body also will be secure.

10.verse: You will not leave me in the place of the dead. You will not let your faithful one rot away.

11.verse: You always show me the path of life. You will fill me with joy when I am with you. You will make me happy forever at your right hand.

1.verse: A prayer of David. LORD, hear me, because I ask for what is right. Listen to my cry for help. Hear my prayer. It doesn’t come from lips that tell lies.

2.verse: When you hand down your sentence, may it be in my favor. May your eyes see what is right.

3.verse: Look deep down into my heart. Study me carefully at night and test me. You won’t find anything wrong. I have planned nothing evil. My mouth has not said sinful things.

4.verse: Though evil people tried to pay me to do wrong, I have not done what they wanted. Instead I have done what you commanded.

5.verse: My steps have stayed on your paths. My feet have not slipped.

6.verse: My God, I call out to you because you will answer me. Listen to me. Hear my prayer.

7.verse: Show me the wonders of your great love. By using your great power, you save those who go to you for safety from their enemies.

8.verse: Take good care of me, just as you would take care of your own eyes. Hide me in the shadow of your wings.

9.verse: Save me from the sinful people who want to destroy me. Save me from my deadly enemies who are all around me.

10.verse: They make their hearts hard and stubborn. Their mouths speak with pride.

11.verse: They have tracked me down. They are all around me. Their eyes watch for a chance to throw me to the ground.

12.verse: They are like a hungry lion, waiting to attack. They are like a powerful lion, hiding in the bushes.

13.verse: LORD, rise up. Oppose them and bring them down. With your sword, save me from those evil people.

14.verse: LORD, by your power save me from people like that. They belong to this world. They get their reward in this life. May what you have stored up for evil people fill their bellies. May their children’s stomachs be filled with it. And may there even be leftovers for their little ones.

15.verse: You will show that I am right; I will enjoy your blessing. When I wake up, I will be satisfied because I will see you.

1.verse: For the director of music. A psalm of David, the servant of the LORD. He sang the words of this song to the LORD. He sang them when the LORD saved him. He saved him from the power of all his enemies and of Saul. David said, I love you, LORD. You give me strength.

2.verse: The LORD is my rock and my place of safety. He is the God who saves me. My God is my rock. I go to him for safety. He is like a shield to me. He’s the power that saves me. He’s my place of safety.

3.verse: I called out to the LORD. He is worthy of praise. He saved me from my enemies.

4.verse: The ropes of death were almost wrapped around me. A destroying flood swept over me.

5.verse: The ropes of the grave were tight around me. Death set its trap in front of me.

6.verse: When I was in trouble, I called out to the LORD. I cried to my God for help. From his temple he heard my voice. My cry for help reached his ears.

7.verse: The earth trembled and shook. The base of the mountains rocked back and forth. It trembled because the LORD was angry.

8.verse: Smoke came out of his nose. Flames of fire came out of his mouth. Burning coals blazed out of it.

9.verse: He opened the heavens and came down. Dark clouds were under his feet.

10.verse: He stood on the cherubim and flew. The wings of the wind lifted him up.

11.verse: He covered himself with darkness. The dark rain clouds of the sky were like a tent around him.

12.verse: Clouds came out of the brightness that was all around him. They came with hailstones and flashes of lightning.

13.verse: The LORD thundered from heaven. The voice of the Most High God was heard.

14.verse: He shot his arrows and scattered our enemies. He sent great flashes of lightning and chased the enemies away.

15.verse: The bottom of the sea could be seen. The foundations of the earth were uncovered. LORD, it happened when your anger blazed out. It came like a blast of breath from your nose.

16.verse: He reached down from heaven. He took hold of me. He lifted me out of deep waters.

17.verse: He saved me from my powerful enemies. He set me free from those who were too strong for me.

18.verse: They opposed me when I was in trouble. But the LORD helped me.

19.verse: He brought me out into a wide and safe place. He saved me because he was pleased with me.

20.verse: The LORD has been good to me because I do what is right. He has rewarded me because I lead a pure life.

21.verse: I have lived the way the LORD wanted me to. I am not guilty of turning away from my God.

22.verse: I keep all his laws in mind. I haven’t turned away from his commands.

23.verse: He knows that I am without blame. He knows I’ve kept myself from sinning.

24.verse: The LORD has rewarded me for doing what is right. He has rewarded me because I haven’t done anything wrong.

25.verse: LORD, to those who are faithful you show that you are faithful. To those who are without blame you show that you are without blame.

26.verse: To those who are pure you show that you are pure. But to those whose paths are crooked you show that you are clever.

27.verse: You save those who aren’t proud. But you bring down those whose eyes are proud.

28.verse: LORD, you keep the lamp of my life burning brightly. You are my God. You bring light into my darkness.

29.verse: With your help I can attack a troop of soldiers. With the help of my God I can climb over a wall.

30.verse: God’s way is perfect. The LORD’s word doesn’t have any flaws. He is like a shield to all who go to him for safety.

31.verse: Who is God except the LORD? Who is the Rock except our God?

32.verse: God gives me strength for the battle. He keeps my way secure.

33.verse: He makes my feet like the feet of a deer. He causes me to stand on the highest places.

34.verse: He trains my hands to fight every battle. My arms can bend a bow of bronze.

35.verse: LORD, you are like a shield that keeps me safe. Your strong right hand keeps me going. Your help has made me great.

36.verse: You give me a wide path to walk on so that I don’t twist my ankles.

37.verse: I chased my enemies and caught them. I didn’t turn back until they were destroyed.

38.verse: I crushed them so that they couldn’t get up. They fell under my feet.

39.verse: LORD, you gave me strength to fight the battle. You made my enemies humble in front of me.

40.verse: You made them turn their backs and run away. So I destroyed my enemies.

41.verse: They cried out for help. But there was no one to save them. They called out to the LORD. But he didn’t answer them.

42.verse: I beat them as fine as dust blown by the wind. I stomped on them like mud in the streets.

43.verse: You saved me when my own people attacked me. You made me the ruler over nations. People I didn’t know serve me now.

44.verse: People from other lands bow down to me in fear. As soon as they hear me, they obey me.

45.verse: All of them give up hope. They come trembling out of their hiding places.

46.verse: The LORD lives! Give praise to my Rock! Give honor to God my Savior!

47.verse: He is the God who pays back my enemies. He brings the nations under my control.

48.verse: He saves me from my enemies. You have honored me more than them. You have saved me from a man who wanted to hurt me.

49.verse: LORD, I will praise you among the nations. I will sing the praises of your name.

50.verse: The LORD helps his king win great battles. He shows his faithful love to his anointed king. He shows it to David and to his family forever.

1.verse: For the director of music. A psalm of David. The heavens tell about the glory of God. The skies show that his hands created them.

2.verse: Day after day they speak about it. Night after night they make it known.

3.verse: But they don’t speak or use words. No sound is heard from them.

4.verse: Yet their voice goes out into the whole earth. Their words go out from one end of the world to the other. God has set up a tent in the heavens for the sun.

5.verse: The sun is like a groom leaving the room of his wedding night. The sun is like a great runner who takes delight in running a race.

6.verse: It rises at one end of the heavens. Then it moves across to the other end. Everything enjoys its warmth.

7.verse: The law of the LORD is perfect. It gives us new strength. The laws of the LORD can be trusted. They make childish people wise.

8.verse: The rules of the LORD are right. They give joy to our hearts. The commands of the LORD shine brightly. They give light to our minds.

9.verse: The law that brings respect for the LORD is pure. It lasts forever. The commands the LORD gives are true. All of them are completely right.

10.verse: They are more priceless than gold. They have greater value than huge amounts of pure gold. They are sweeter than honey that is taken from the honeycomb.

11.verse: Your servant is warned by them. When people obey them, they are greatly rewarded.

12.verse: But who can know their own mistakes? Forgive my hidden faults.

13.verse: Also keep me from the sins I want to commit. May they not be my master. Then I will be without blame. I will not be guilty of any great sin against your law.

14.verse: LORD, may these words of my mouth please you. And may these thoughts of my heart please you also. You are my Rock and my Redeemer.

1.verse: For the director of music. A psalm of David. May the LORD answer you when you are in trouble. May the God of Jacob keep you safe.

2.verse: May he send you help from the sacred tent. May he give you aid from Zion.

3.verse: May he remember all your sacrifices. May he accept your burnt offerings.

4.verse: May he give you what your heart wishes for. May he make all your plans succeed.

5.verse: May we shout for joy over your victory. May we lift up our flags in the name of our God. May the LORD give you everything you ask for.

6.verse: Now I know that the LORD gives victory to his anointed king. He answers him from his sacred home in heaven. The power of God’s right hand gives victory to the king.

7.verse: Some trust in chariots. Some trust in horses. But we trust in the LORD our God.

8.verse: They are brought to their knees and fall down. But we get up and stand firm.

9.verse: LORD, give victory to the king! Answer us when we call out to you!

1.verse: For the director of music. A psalm of David. LORD, the king is filled with joy because you are strong. How great is his joy because you help him win his battles!

2.verse: You have given him what his heart wished for. You haven’t kept back from him what his lips asked for.

3.verse: You came to greet him with rich blessings. You placed a crown of pure gold on his head.

4.verse: He asked you for life, and you gave it to him. You promised him days that would never end.

5.verse: His glory is great because you helped him win his battles. You have honored him with glory and majesty.

6.verse: You have given him blessings that will never end. You have made him glad and joyful because you are with him.

7.verse: The king trusts in the LORD. The faithful love of the Most High God will keep the king secure.

8.verse: You, the king, will capture all your enemies. Your right hand will take hold of them.

9.verse: When you appear for battle, you will burn them up like they were in a flaming furnace. The LORD will swallow them up in his great anger. His fire will burn them up.

10.verse: You will wipe their children from the face of the earth. You will remove them from the human race.

11.verse: Your enemies make evil plans against you. They think up evil things to do. But they can’t succeed.

12.verse: You will make them turn their backs and run away when you aim your arrows at them.

13.verse: LORD, may you be honored because you are strong. We will sing and praise your might.

1.verse: For the director of music. A psalm of David to the tune of “The Doe of the Morning.” My God, my God, why have you deserted me? Why do you seem so far away when I need you to save me? Why do you seem so far away that you can’t hear my groans?

2.verse: My God, I cry out in the daytime. But you don’t answer. I cry out at night. But you don’t let me sleep.

3.verse: But you rule from your throne as the Holy One. You are the God Israel praises.

4.verse: Our people of long ago put their trust in you. They trusted in you, and you saved them.

5.verse: They cried out to you and were saved. They trusted in you, and you didn’t let them down.

6.verse: Everyone treats me like a worm and not a man. They hate me and look down on me.

7.verse: All those who see me laugh at me. They shout at me and make fun of me. They shake their heads at me.

8.verse: They say, “He trusts in the LORD. Let the LORD help him. If the LORD is pleased with him, let him save him.”

9.verse: But you brought me out of my mother’s body. You made me trust in you even when I was at my mother’s breast.

10.verse: From the time I was born, you took good care of me. Ever since I came out of my mother’s body, you have been my God.

11.verse: Don’t be far away from me. Trouble is near, and there is no one to help me.

12.verse: Many enemies are all around me. They are like strong bulls from the land of Bashan.

13.verse: They are like roaring lions that tear to pieces what they kill. They open their mouths wide to attack me.

14.verse: My strength is like water that is poured out on the ground. I feel as if my bones aren’t connected. My heart has turned to wax. It has melted away inside me.

15.verse: My mouth is dried up like a piece of broken pottery. My tongue sticks to the roof of my mouth. You bring me down to the edge of the grave.

16.verse: A group of sinful people has closed in on me. They are all around me like a pack of dogs. They have pierced my hands and my feet.

17.verse: Everyone can see all my bones right through my skin. People stare at me. They laugh when I suffer.

18.verse: They divide up my clothes among them. They cast lots for what I am wearing.

19.verse: LORD, don’t be so far away from me. You give me strength. Come quickly to help me.

20.verse: Save me from being killed by the sword. Save the only life I have. Save me from the power of those dogs.

21.verse: Save me from the mouths of those lions. Save me from the horns of those wild oxen.

22.verse: I will announce your name to my people. I will praise you among those who are gathered to worship you.

23.verse: You who have respect for the LORD, praise him! All you people of Jacob, honor him! All you people of Israel, worship him!

24.verse: He has not forgotten the one who is hurting. He has not turned away from his suffering. He has not turned his face away from him. He has listened to his cry for help.

25.verse: Because of what you have done, I will praise you in the whole community of those who worship you. In front of those who respect you, I will keep my promises.

26.verse: Those who are poor will eat and be satisfied. Those who seek the LORD will praise him. May their hearts be filled with new hope!

27.verse: People from one end of the earth to the other will remember and turn to the LORD. The people of all the nations will bow down in front of him.

28.verse: The LORD is King. He rules over the nations.

29.verse: All rich people of the earth will feast and worship God. All who go down to the grave will kneel in front of him. Those who cannot keep themselves alive will kneel.

30.verse: Those who are not yet born will serve him. Those who are born later will be told about the Lord.

31.verse: And they will tell people who have not yet been born, “The Lord has done what is right!”

1.verse: A psalm of David. The LORD is my shepherd. He gives me everything I need.

2.verse: He lets me lie down in fields of green grass. He leads me beside quiet waters.

3.verse: He gives me new strength. He guides me in the right paths for the honor of his name.

4.verse: Even though I walk through the darkest valley, I will not be afraid. You are with me. Your shepherd’s rod and staff comfort me.

5.verse: You prepare a feast for me right in front of my enemies. You pour oil on my head. My cup runs over.

6.verse: I am sure that your goodness and love will follow me all the days of my life. And I will live in the house of the LORD forever.

1.verse: A psalm of David. The earth belongs to the LORD. And so does everything in it. The world belongs to him. And so do all those who live in it.

2.verse: He set it firmly on the oceans. He made it secure on the waters.

3.verse: Who can go up to the temple on the mountain of the LORD? Who can stand in his holy place?

4.verse: Anyone who has clean hands and a pure heart. Anyone who does not trust in the statue of a god. Anyone who doesn’t use the name of that god when he makes a promise.

5.verse: People like that will receive the LORD’s blessing. When God their Savior hands down his sentence, it will be in their favor.

6.verse: The people who look to God are like that. God of Jacob, they look to you.

7.verse: Open wide, you gates. Open up, you ancient doors. Then the King of glory will come in.

8.verse: Who is the King of glory? The LORD, who is strong and mighty. The LORD, who is mighty in battle.

9.verse: Open wide, you gates. Open wide, you ancient doors. Then the King of glory will come in.

10.verse: Who is he, this King of glory? The LORD who rules over all. He is the King of glory.

1.verse: A psalm of David. In you, LORD my God, I put my trust.

2.verse: I trust in you. Don’t let me be put to shame. Don’t let my enemies win the battle over me.

3.verse: Those who put their hope in you will never be put to shame. But those who lie to other people for no reason will be put to shame.

4.verse: LORD, show me your ways. Teach me how to follow you.

5.verse: Guide me in your truth. Teach me. You are God my Savior. I put my hope in you all day long.

6.verse: LORD, remember your great mercy and love. You have shown them to your people for a long time.

7.verse: Don’t remember the sins I committed when I was young. Don’t remember how often I refused to obey you. Remember me because you love me. LORD, you are good.

8.verse: The LORD is honest and good. He teaches sinners to walk in his ways.

9.verse: He shows those who aren’t proud how to do what is right. He teaches them his ways.

10.verse: All the LORD’s ways are loving and faithful toward those who obey what his covenant commands.

11.verse: LORD, be true to your name. Forgive my sin, even though it is great.

12.verse: Who are the people who have respect for the LORD? God will teach them the ways they should choose.

13.verse: Things will always go well for them. Their children will be given the land.

14.verse: The LORD shares his plans with those who have respect for him. He makes his covenant known to them.

15.verse: My eyes always look to the LORD. He alone can set my feet free from the trap.

16.verse: Turn to me and help me. I am lonely and hurting.

17.verse: Take away the troubles of my heart. Set me free from my great pain.

18.verse: Look at how I’m hurting! See how much I suffer! Take away all my sins.

19.verse: Look at how many enemies I have! See how terrible their hatred is for me!

20.verse: Guard my life. Save me. Don’t let me be put to shame. I go to you for safety.

21.verse: May my honest and good life keep me safe. LORD, I have put my hope in you.

22.verse: God, set Israel free from all their troubles!

1.verse: A psalm of David. LORD, when you hand down your sentence, let it be in my favor. I have lived without blame. I have trusted in the LORD. I have never doubted him.

2.verse: LORD, test me. Try me out. Look deep down into my heart and mind.

3.verse: I have always remembered your love that never fails. I have always depended on the fact that you are faithful.

4.verse: I don’t spend time with people who tell lies. I don’t keep company with pretenders.

5.verse: I hate to be with a group of sinful people. I refuse to spend time with those who are evil.

6.verse: I wash my hands to show that I’m not guilty. LORD, I come near your altar.

7.verse: I shout my praise to you. I tell about all the wonderful things you have done.

8.verse: LORD, I love the house where you live. I love the place where your glory is.

9.verse: Don’t destroy me together with sinners. Don’t take away my life along with murderers.

10.verse: Their hands are always planning to do evil. Their right hands are full of money that has bought their help.

11.verse: But I live without blame. Save me from harm and treat me with kindness.

12.verse: My feet stand on level ground. In the whole community I will praise the LORD.

1.verse: A psalm of David. The LORD is my light, and he saves me. Why should I fear anyone? The LORD is my place of safety. Why should I be afraid?

2.verse: My enemies are evil. They will trip and fall when they attack me and try to swallow me up.

3.verse: Even if an army attacks me, my heart will not be afraid. Even if war breaks out against me, I will still trust in God.

4.verse: I’m asking the LORD for only one thing. Here is what I want. I want to live in the house of the LORD all the days of my life. I want to look at the beauty of the LORD. I want to worship him in his temple.

5.verse: When I’m in trouble, he will keep me safe in his house. He will hide me in the safety of his holy tent. He will put me on a rock that is very high.

6.verse: Then I will win the battle over my enemies who are all around me. At his holy tent I will offer my sacrifice with shouts of joy. I will sing and make music to the LORD.

7.verse: LORD, hear my voice when I call out to you. Treat me with kindness and answer me.

8.verse: My heart says, “Seek him!” LORD, I will seek you.

9.verse: Don’t turn your face away from me. Don’t turn me away because you are angry. You have helped me. God my Savior, don’t say no to me. Don’t desert me.

10.verse: My father and mother may desert me, but the LORD will accept me.

11.verse: LORD, teach me your ways. Lead me along a straight path. There are many people who treat me badly.

12.verse: My enemies want to harm me. So don’t turn me over to them. Witnesses who tell lies are rising up against me. They say all sorts of evil things about me.

13.verse: Here is something I am still sure of. I will see the LORD’s goodness while I’m still alive.

14.verse: Wait for the LORD. Be strong and don’t lose hope. Wait for the LORD.

1.verse: A psalm of David. LORD, my Rock, I call out to you. Pay attention to me. If you remain silent, I will die. I will be like those who go down into the grave.

2.verse: Hear my cry for your favor when I call out to you for help. Hear me when I lift up my hands in prayer toward your Most Holy Room.

3.verse: Don’t drag me away with sinners. Don’t drag me away with those who do evil. They speak in a friendly way to their neighbors. But their hearts are full of hate.

4.verse: Pay them back for their evil actions. Pay them back for what their hands have done. Give them exactly what they should get.

5.verse: They don’t care about the LORD’s mighty acts. They don’t care about what his hands have done. So he will tear them down. He will never build them up again.

6.verse: Give praise to the LORD. He has heard my cry for his favor.

7.verse: The LORD gives me strength. He is like a shield that keeps me safe. My heart trusts in him, and he helps me. My heart jumps for joy. With my song I praise him.

8.verse: The LORD gives strength to his people. He guards and saves his anointed king.

9.verse: Save your people. Bless those who belong to you. Be their shepherd. Take care of them forever.

1.verse: A psalm of David. Praise the LORD, you angels in heaven. Praise the LORD for his glory and strength.

2.verse: Praise the LORD for the glory that belongs to him. Worship the LORD because of his beauty and holiness.

3.verse: The voice of the LORD is heard over the waters. The God of glory thunders. The LORD thunders over the mighty waters.

4.verse: The voice of the LORD is powerful. The voice of the LORD is majestic.

5.verse: The voice of the LORD breaks the cedar trees. The LORD breaks the cedars of Lebanon into pieces.

6.verse: He makes the mountains of Lebanon leap like a calf. He makes Mount Hermon jump like a young wild ox.

7.verse: The voice of the LORD strikes with flashes of lightning.

8.verse: The voice of the LORD shakes the desert. The LORD shakes the Desert of Kadesh.

9.verse: The voice of the LORD twists the oak trees. It strips the forests bare. And in his temple everyone cries out, “Glory!”

10.verse: The LORD on his throne rules over the flood. The LORD rules from his throne as King forever.

11.verse: The LORD gives strength to his people. The LORD blesses his people with peace.

1.verse: A psalm of David. A song for setting apart the completed temple to God. LORD, I will give you honor. You brought me out of deep trouble. You didn’t give my enemies the joy of seeing me die.

2.verse: LORD my God, I called out to you for help. And you healed me.

3.verse: LORD, you brought me up from the place of the dead. You kept me from going down into the pit.

4.verse: Sing the praises of the LORD, you who are faithful to him. Praise him, because his name is holy.

5.verse: His anger lasts for only a moment. But his favor lasts for a person’s whole life. Weeping can stay for the night. But joy comes in the morning.

6.verse: When I felt safe, I said, “I will always be secure.”

7.verse: LORD, when you gave me your help, you made Mount Zion stand firm. But when you took away your help, I was terrified.

8.verse: LORD, I called out to you. I cried to you for mercy.

9.verse: I said, “What good will come if I become silent in death? What good will come if I go down into the grave? Can the dust of my dead body praise you? Can it tell how faithful you are?

10.verse: LORD, hear me. Have mercy on me. LORD, help me.”

11.verse: You turned my loud crying into dancing. You removed my clothes of sadness and dressed me with joy.

12.verse: So my heart will sing your praises. I can’t keep silent. LORD, my God, I will praise you forever.

1.verse: For the director of music. A psalm of David. LORD, I have come to you for safety. Don’t let me ever be put to shame. Save me, because you do what is right.

2.verse: Pay attention to me. Come quickly to help me. Be the rock I go to for safety. Be the strong fort that saves me.

3.verse: You are my rock and my fort. Lead me and guide me for the honor of your name.

4.verse: Keep me free from the trap that is set for me. You are my place of safety.

5.verse: Into your hands I commit my very life. LORD, set me free. You are my faithful God.

6.verse: I hate those who worship worthless statues of gods. But I trust in the LORD.

7.verse: I will be glad and full of joy because you love me. You saw that I was hurting. You took note of my great pain.

8.verse: You have not handed me over to the enemy. You have put me in a wide and safe place.

9.verse: LORD, have mercy on me. I’m in deep trouble. I’m so sad I can hardly see. My whole body grows weak with sadness.

10.verse: Pain has taken over my life. My years are spent in groaning. I have no strength because I’m hurting so much. My body is getting weaker and weaker.

11.verse: My neighbors make fun of me because I have so many enemies. My closest friends are afraid of me. People who see me on the street run away from me.

12.verse: No one remembers me. I might as well be dead. I have become like broken pottery.

13.verse: I hear many people whispering, “There is terror all around him!” Many have joined together against me. They plan to kill me.

14.verse: But I trust in you, LORD. I say, “You are my God.”

15.verse: My whole life is in your hands. Save me from the hands of my enemies. Save me from those who are chasing me.

16.verse: May you look on me with favor. Save me because your love is faithful.

17.verse: LORD, I have cried out to you. Don’t let me be put to shame. But let sinners be put to shame. Let them lie silent in the place of the dead.

18.verse: Their lips tell lies. Let them be silenced. They speak with pride against those who do right. They make fun of them.

19.verse: You have stored up so many good things. You have stored them up for those who have respect for you. You give those things while everyone watches. You give them to people who run to you for safety.

20.verse: They are safe because you are with them. You hide them from the evil plans of their enemies. In your house you keep them safe from those who bring charges against them.

21.verse: Give praise to the LORD. He showed me his wonderful love when my enemies attacked the city I was in.

22.verse: I was afraid and said, “I’ve been cut off from you!” But you heard my cry for your favor. You heard me when I called out to you for help.

23.verse: Love the LORD, all you who are faithful to him! The LORD keeps safe those who are faithful to him. But he completely pays back those who are proud.

24.verse: Be strong, all you who put your hope in the LORD. Never give up.

1.verse: A maskil of David. Blessed is the person whose lawless acts are forgiven. Their sins have been taken away.

2.verse: Blessed is the person whose sin the LORD never counts against them. That person doesn’t want to cheat anyone.

3.verse: When I kept silent about my sin, my body became weak because I groaned all day long.

4.verse: Day and night you punished me. I became weaker and weaker as I do in the heat of summer.

5.verse: Then I admitted my sin to you. I didn’t cover up the wrong I had done. I said, “I will admit my lawless acts to the LORD.” And you forgave the guilt of my sin.

6.verse: Let everyone who is faithful pray to you while they can still look to you. When troubles come like a flood, they certainly won’t reach those who are faithful.

7.verse: You are my hiding place. You will keep me safe from trouble. You will surround me with songs sung by those who praise you because you save your people.

8.verse: I will guide you and teach you the way you should go. I will give you good advice and watch over you with love.

9.verse: Don’t be like a horse or a mule. They can’t understand anything. They have to be controlled by bits and bridles. If they aren’t, they won’t come to you.

10.verse: Sinful people have all kinds of trouble. But the LORD’s faithful love is all around those who trust in him.

11.verse: Be glad because of what the LORD has done for you. Be joyful, you who do what is right! Sing, all you whose hearts are honest!

1.verse: You who are godly, sing with joy to the LORD. It is right for honest people to praise him.

2.verse: With the harp, praise the LORD. With the lyre that has ten strings, make music to him.

3.verse: Sing a new song to him. Play with skill, and shout with joy.

4.verse: What the LORD says is right and true. He is faithful in everything he does.

5.verse: The LORD loves what is right and fair. The earth is full of his faithful love.

6.verse: The heavens were made when the LORD commanded it to happen. All the stars were created by the breath of his mouth.

7.verse: He gathers together the waters of the sea. He puts the oceans in their places.

8.verse: Let the whole earth have respect for the LORD. Let all the people in the world honor him.

9.verse: He spoke, and the world came into being. He commanded, and it stood firm.

10.verse: The LORD blocks the sinful plans of the nations. He keeps them from doing what they want to do.

11.verse: But the plans of the LORD stand firm forever. What he wants to do will last for all time.

12.verse: Blessed is the nation whose God is the LORD. Blessed are the people he chose to be his own.

13.verse: From heaven the LORD looks down and sees everyone.

14.verse: From his throne he watches all those who live on the earth.

15.verse: He creates the hearts of all people. He is aware of everything they do.

16.verse: A king isn’t saved just because his army is big. A soldier doesn’t escape just because he is very strong.

17.verse: People can’t trust a horse to save them either. Though it is very strong, it can’t save them.

18.verse: But the LORD looks with favor on those who respect him. He watches over those who put their hope in his faithful love.

19.verse: He watches over them to save them from death. He wants to keep them alive when there is no food in the land.

20.verse: We wait in hope for the LORD. He helps us. He is like a shield that keeps us safe.

21.verse: Our hearts are full of joy because of him. We trust in him, because he is holy.

22.verse: LORD, may your faithful love be with us. We put our hope in you.

1.verse: A psalm of David when he was with Abimelek and pretended to be out of his mind. Abimelek drove him away, and David left. I will thank the LORD at all times. My lips will always praise him.

2.verse: I will find my glory in knowing the LORD. Let those who are hurting hear me and be joyful.

3.verse: Join me in giving glory to the LORD. Let us honor him together.

4.verse: I looked to the LORD, and he answered me. He saved me from everything I was afraid of.

5.verse: Those who look to him have joyful faces. They are never covered with shame.

6.verse: This poor man called out, and the LORD heard him. He saved him out of all his troubles.

7.verse: The angel of the LORD stands guard around those who have respect for him. And he saves them.

8.verse: Taste and see that the LORD is good. Blessed is the person who goes to him for safety.

9.verse: You holy people of God, have respect for the LORD. Those who respect him have everything they need.

10.verse: The lions may grow weak and hungry. But those who look to the LORD have every good thing they need.

11.verse: My children, come. Listen to me. I will teach you to have respect for the LORD.

12.verse: Do you love life and want to see many good days?

13.verse: Then keep your tongues from speaking evil. Keep your lips from telling lies.

14.verse: Turn away from evil, and do good. Look for peace, and go after it.

15.verse: The LORD looks with favor on those who are godly. His ears are open to their cry.

16.verse: But the LORD doesn’t look with favor on those who do evil. He removes all memory of them from the earth.

17.verse: Godly people cry out, and the LORD hears them. He saves them from all their troubles.

18.verse: The LORD is close to those whose hearts have been broken. He saves those whose spirits have been crushed.

19.verse: The person who does what is right may have many troubles. But the LORD saves him from all of them.

20.verse: The LORD watches over all his bones. Not one of them will be broken.

21.verse: Sinners will be killed by their own evil. The enemies of godly people will be judged.

22.verse: The LORD will save those who serve him. No one who goes to him for safety will be found guilty.

1.verse: A psalm of David. LORD, stand up against those who stand up against me. Fight against those who fight against me.

2.verse: Pick up your shield and your armor. Rise up and help me.

3.verse: Get your spear and javelin ready to fight against those who are chasing me. Say to me, “I will save you.”

4.verse: Let those who are trying to kill me be brought down in dishonor. Let those who plan to destroy me be turned back in terror.

5.verse: Let them be like straw blowing in the wind, while the angel of the LORD drives them away.

6.verse: Let their path be dark and slippery, while the angel of the LORD chases them.

7.verse: They set a trap for me without any reason. Without any reason they dug a pit to catch me.

8.verse: So let them be destroyed without warning. Let the trap they set for me catch them. Let them fall into the pit and be destroyed.

9.verse: Then I will be full of joy because of what the LORD has done. I will be glad because he has saved me.

10.verse: My whole being will cry out, “Who is like you, LORD? You save poor people from those who are too strong for them. You save poor and needy people from those who rob them.”

11.verse: Mean people come forward to speak against me. They ask me things I don’t know anything about.

12.verse: They pay me back with evil, even though I was good to them. They leave me like someone who has lost a family member.

13.verse: But when they were sick, I put on the clothing of sadness. I made myself humble by going without food. My prayers for them weren’t always answered.

14.verse: So I went around crying as if I were mourning over my friend or relative. I bowed my head in sadness as if I were weeping over my mother.

15.verse: But when I tripped and fell, they were all very happy. Attackers gathered against me when I didn’t even know it. They kept on telling lies about me.

16.verse: Like ungodly people, they were mean and made fun of me. They ground their teeth at me in hate.

17.verse: Lord, how much longer will you just look on? Save me from their deadly attacks. Save the only life I have. Save me from these lions.

18.verse: I will give you thanks in the whole community. Among all your people I will praise you.

19.verse: Don’t let those who are my enemies without any reason laugh at me and make fun of me. Don’t let those who hate me without any reason wink at me with an evil purpose.

20.verse: They don’t speak words of peace. They make up false charges against those who live quietly in the land.

21.verse: They make fun of me. They say, “With our own eyes we have seen what you did.”

22.verse: LORD, you have seen this. Don’t be silent. Lord, don’t be far away from me.

23.verse: Wake up! Rise up to help me! My God and Lord, stand up for me.

24.verse: LORD my God, when you hand down your sentence, let it be in my favor. You always do what is right. Don’t let my enemies have the joy of seeing me fall.

25.verse: Don’t let them think, “That’s exactly what we wanted!” Don’t let them say, “We have swallowed him up.”

26.verse: Let all those who laugh at me because I’m in trouble be ashamed and bewildered. Let all who think they are better than I am put on shame and dishonor as if they were clothes.

27.verse: Let those who are happy when my name is cleared shout with joy and gladness. Let them always say, “May the LORD be honored. He is pleased when everything goes well with the one who serves him.”

28.verse: You always do what is right. My tongue will speak about it and praise you all day long.

1.verse: For the director of music. A psalm of David, the servant of the LORD. I have a message from God in my heart. It is about the evil ways of anyone who sins. They don’t have any respect for God.

2.verse: They praise themselves so much that they can’t see their sin or hate it.

3.verse: Their mouths speak words that are evil and false. They do not act wisely or do what is good.

4.verse: Even as they lie in bed they make evil plans. They commit themselves to a sinful way of life. They never say no to what is wrong.

5.verse: LORD, your love is as high as the heavens. Your faithful love reaches up to the skies.

6.verse: Your holiness is as great as the height of the highest mountains. You are as honest as the oceans are deep. LORD, you keep people and animals safe.

7.verse: How priceless your faithful love is! People find safety in the shadow of your wings.

8.verse: They eat well because there is more than enough in your house. You let them drink from your river that flows with good things.

9.verse: You have the fountain of life. We are filled with light because you give us light.

10.verse: Keep on loving those who know you. Keep on doing right to those whose hearts are honest.

11.verse: Don’t let the feet of those who are proud step on me. Don’t let the hands of those who are evil drive me away.

12.verse: See how those who do evil have fallen! They are thrown down and can’t get up.

1.verse: A psalm of David. Don’t be upset because of sinful people. Don’t be jealous of those who do wrong.

2.verse: Like grass, they will soon dry up. Like green plants, they will soon die.

3.verse: Trust in the LORD and do good. Then you will live in the land and enjoy its food.

4.verse: Find your delight in the LORD. Then he will give you everything your heart really wants.

5.verse: Commit your life to the LORD. Here is what he will do if you trust in him.

6.verse: He will make the reward for your godly life shine like the dawn. He will make the proof of your honest life shine like the sun at noon.

7.verse: Be still and wait patiently for the LORD to act. Don’t be upset when other people succeed. Don’t be upset when they carry out their evil plans.

8.verse: Turn away from anger and don’t give in to wrath. Don’t be upset, because that only leads to evil.

9.verse: Sinful people will be destroyed. But those who put their hope in the LORD will receive the land.

10.verse: In a little while, there won’t be any more sinners. Even if you look for them, you won’t be able to find them.

11.verse: But those who are free of pride will be given the land. They will enjoy peace and success.

12.verse: Sinful people make plans to harm those who do what is right. They grind their teeth at them.

13.verse: But the Lord laughs at those who do evil. He knows the day is coming when he will judge them.

14.verse: Sinners pull out their swords. They bend their bows. They want to kill poor and needy people. They plan to murder those who lead honest lives.

15.verse: But they will be killed by their own swords. Their own bows will be broken.

16.verse: Those who do what is right may have very little. But it’s better than the wealth of many sinners.

17.verse: The power of those who are evil will be broken. But the LORD takes good care of those who do what is right.

18.verse: Those who are without blame spend their days in the LORD’s care. What he has given them will last forever.

19.verse: When trouble comes to them, they will have what they need. When there is little food in the land, they will still have plenty.

20.verse: But sinful people will die. The LORD’s enemies may be like flowers in the field. But they will be swallowed up. They will disappear like smoke.

21.verse: Sinful people borrow and don’t pay back. But those who are godly give freely to others.

22.verse: The LORD will give the land to those he blesses. But he will destroy those he curses.

23.verse: The LORD makes secure the footsteps of the person who delights in him,

24.verse: Even if that person trips, he won’t fall. The LORD’s hand takes good care of him.

25.verse: I once was young, and now I’m old. But I’ve never seen godly people deserted. I’ve never seen their children begging for bread.

26.verse: The godly are always giving and lending freely. Their children will be a blessing.

27.verse: Turn away from evil and do good. Then you will live in the land forever.

28.verse: The LORD loves those who are honest. He will not desert those who are faithful to him. Those who do wrong will be completely destroyed. The children of sinners will die.

29.verse: Those who do what is right will be given the land. They will live in it forever.

30.verse: The mouths of those who do what is right speak words of wisdom. They say what is honest.

31.verse: God’s law is in their hearts. Their feet do not slip.

32.verse: Those who are evil hide and wait for godly people. They want to kill them.

33.verse: But the LORD will not leave the godly in their power. He will not let them be found guilty when they are brought into court.

34.verse: Put your hope in the LORD. Live as he wants you to. He will honor you by giving you the land. When sinners are destroyed, you will see it.

35.verse: I saw a mean and sinful person. He was doing well, like a green tree in its own land.

36.verse: But he soon passed away and was gone. Even though I looked for him, I couldn’t find him.

37.verse: Consider honest people who are without blame. People who seek peace will have a tomorrow.

38.verse: But all sinners will be destroyed. Those who are evil won’t have a tomorrow.

39.verse: The LORD saves those who do what is right. He is their place of safety when trouble comes.

40.verse: The LORD helps them and saves them. He saves them from sinful people because they go to him for safety.

1.verse: A psalm of David. A prayer. LORD, don’t correct me when you are angry. Don’t punish me when you are burning with anger.

2.verse: You have wounded me with your arrows. You have struck me with your hand.

3.verse: Because of your anger, my whole body is sick. Because of my sin, I’m not healthy.

4.verse: My guilt has become too much for me. It is a load too heavy to carry.

5.verse: My wounds are ugly. They stink. I’ve been foolish. I have sinned.

6.verse: I am bent over. I’ve been brought very low. All day long I go around weeping.

7.verse: My back is filled with burning pain. My whole body is sick.

8.verse: I am weak and feel as if I’ve been broken in pieces. I groan because of the great pain in my heart.

9.verse: Lord, everything I really want is clearly known to you. You always hear me when I sigh.

10.verse: My heart pounds, and my strength is gone. My eyes can hardly see.

11.verse: My friends and companions avoid me because of my wounds. My neighbors stay far away from me.

12.verse: Those who are trying to kill me set their traps. Those who want to harm me talk about destroying me. All day long they make their plans and tell their lies.

13.verse: Like a deaf person, I can’t hear. Like someone who can’t speak, I can’t say a word.

14.verse: I’m like someone who doesn’t hear. I’m like someone whose mouth can’t make any reply.

15.verse: LORD, I wait for you to help me. Lord my God, I know you will answer.

16.verse: I said, “Don’t let my enemies have the joy of seeing me fall. Don’t let them brag when my feet slip.”

17.verse: I am about to fall. My pain never leaves me.

18.verse: I admit that I have done wrong. I am troubled by my sin.

19.verse: Though I have done nothing to cause it, many people have become my enemies. They hate me without any reason.

20.verse: They pay me back with evil, even though I was good to them. They bring charges against me, though I try only to do what is good.

21.verse: LORD, don’t desert me. My God, don’t be far away from me.

22.verse: Lord my Savior, come quickly to help me.

1.verse: For the director of music. For Jeduthun. A psalm of David. I said, “I will be careful about how I live. I will not sin by what I say. I will keep my mouth closed when I am near sinful people.”

2.verse: So I was completely silent. I didn’t even say anything good. But the pain inside me grew worse.

3.verse: My heart was deeply troubled. As I thought about what was happening to me, I became even more troubled. Then I spoke out.

4.verse: I said, “LORD, show me when my life will end. Show me how many days I have left. Tell me how short my life will be.

5.verse: You have given me only a few days to live. My whole life doesn’t seem like anything to you. No one lasts any longer than a breath. This is true even for those who feel secure.

6.verse: People are only shadows as they go here and there. They rush around, but it doesn’t mean anything. They pile up wealth, but they don’t know who will finally get it.

7.verse: “Lord, what can I look forward to now? You are the only hope I have.

8.verse: Save me from all the wrong things I’ve done. Don’t let foolish people make fun of me.

9.verse: I keep silent. I don’t open my mouth. You are the one who has caused all this to happen.

10.verse: Please stop beating me. I’m about to die from the blows of your hand.

11.verse: You correct and punish people for their sin. Then, just as a moth eats cloth, you destroy their wealth. No one lasts any longer than a breath.

12.verse: “LORD, hear my prayer. Listen to my cry for help. Pay attention to my weeping. I’m like an outsider in your home. I’m just a stranger, like all my family who lived before me.

13.verse: Leave me alone. Let me enjoy life again before I die.”

1.verse: For the director of music. A psalm of David. I was patient while I waited for the LORD. He turned to me and heard my cry for help.

2.verse: I was sliding down into the pit of death, and he pulled me out. He brought me up out of the mud and dirt. He set my feet on a rock. He gave me a firm place to stand on.

3.verse: He gave me a new song to sing. It is a hymn of praise to our God. Many people will see and have respect for the LORD. They will put their trust in him.

4.verse: Blessed is the person who trusts in the LORD. They don’t trust in proud people. Those proud people worship statues of gods.

5.verse: LORD my God, no one can compare with you. You have done many wonderful things. You have planned to do these things for us. There are too many of them for me to talk about.

6.verse: You didn’t want sacrifices and offerings. You didn’t require burnt offerings and sin offerings. You opened my ears so that I could hear you and obey you.

7.verse: Then I said, “Here I am. It is written about me in the book.

8.verse: My God, I have come to do what you want. Your law is in my heart.”

9.verse: I have told the whole community of those who worship you. I have told them what you have done to save me. LORD, you know that I haven’t kept quiet.

10.verse: I haven’t kept to myself that what you did for me was right. I have spoken about how faithful you were when you saved me. I haven’t hidden your love and your faithfulness from the whole community.

11.verse: LORD, don’t hold back your mercy from me. May your love and faithfulness always keep me safe.

12.verse: There are more troubles all around me than I can count. My sins have caught up with me, and I can’t see any longer. My sins are more than the hairs of my head. I have lost all hope.

13.verse: LORD, please save me. LORD, come quickly to help me.

14.verse: Let all those who are trying to kill me be put to shame. Let them lose their way. Let all those who want to destroy me be turned back in shame.

15.verse: Some people make fun of me. Let them be shocked when their plans fail.

16.verse: But let all those who seek you be joyful and glad because of what you have done. Let those who count on you to save them always say, “The LORD is great!”

17.verse: But I am poor and needy. May the Lord be concerned about me. You are the God who helps me and saves me. You are my God, so don’t wait any longer.

1.verse: For the director of music. A psalm of David. Blessed are those who care about weak people. When they are in trouble, the LORD saves them.

2.verse: The LORD guards them and keeps them alive. They are counted among those who are blessed in the land. The LORD won’t hand them over to the wishes of their enemies.

3.verse: The LORD will take care of them when they are lying sick in bed. He will make them well again.

4.verse: I said, “LORD, have mercy on me. Heal me, because I have sinned against you.”

5.verse: My enemies are saying bad things about me. They say, “When will he die and his name be forgotten?”

6.verse: When one of them comes to see me, he says things that aren’t true. At the same time, he thinks up lies to tell against me. Then he goes out and spreads those lies around.

7.verse: All my enemies whisper to each other about me. They want something terrible to happen to me.

8.verse: They say, “He is sick and will die very soon. He will never get up from his bed again.”

9.verse: Even my close friend, someone I trusted, has failed me. I even shared my bread with him.

10.verse: But LORD, may you have mercy on me. Make me well, so I can pay them back.

11.verse: Then I will know that you are pleased with me, because my enemies haven’t won the battle over me.

12.verse: You will take good care of me because I’ve been honest. You will let me be with you forever.

13.verse: Give praise to the LORD, the God of Israel, for ever and ever. Amen and Amen.

1.verse: BOOK II Psalms 42–72 Psalm 42 - For the director of music. A maskil of the Sons of Korah. A deer longs for streams of water. God, I long for you in the same way.

2.verse: I am thirsty for God. I am thirsty for the living God. When can I go and meet with him?

3.verse: My tears have been my food day and night. All day long people say to me, “Where is your God?”

4.verse: When I remember what has happened, I tell God all my troubles. I remember how I used to walk to the house of God. The Mighty One guarded my steps. We shouted with joy and praised God as we went along with the joyful crowd.

5.verse: My spirit, why are you so sad? Why are you so upset deep down inside me? Put your hope in God. Once again I will have reason to praise him. He is my Savior and my God.

6.verse: My spirit is very sad deep down inside me. So I will remember you here where the Jordan River begins. I will remember you here on the Hermon mountains and on Mount Mizar.

7.verse: You have sent wave upon wave of trouble over me. It roars down on me like a waterfall. All your waves and breakers have rolled over me.

8.verse: During the day the LORD sends his love to me. During the night I sing about him. I say a prayer to the God who gives me life.

9.verse: I say to God my Rock, “Why have you forgotten me? Why must I go around in sorrow? Why am I treated so badly by my enemies?”

10.verse: My body suffers deadly pain as my enemies make fun of me. All day long they say to me, “Where is your God?”

11.verse: My spirit, why are you so sad? Why are you so upset deep down inside me? Put your hope in God. Once again I will have reason to praise him. He is my Savior and my God.

1.verse: My God, when you hand down your decision, let it be in my favor. Stand up for me against an unfaithful nation. Save me from those lying and sinful people.

2.verse: You are God, my place of safety. Why have you turned your back on me? Why must I go around in sorrow? Why am I beaten down by my enemies?

3.verse: Send me your light and your faithful care. Let them lead me. Let them bring me back to your holy mountain, to the place where you live.

4.verse: Then I will go to the altar of God. I will go to God. He is my joy and my delight. God, you are my God. I will praise you by playing the lyre.

5.verse: My spirit, why are you so sad? Why are you so upset deep down inside me? Put your hope in God. Once again I will have reason to praise him. He is my Savior and my God.

1.verse: For the director of music. A maskil of the Sons of Korah. God, we have heard what you did. Those who came before us have told us what you did in their days, in days long ago.

2.verse: By your power you drove out the nations. You gave our people homes in the land. You crushed the people who were there. And you made our people do well.

3.verse: They didn’t win the land with their swords. They didn’t gain success by their own power. Your powerful right hand and your mighty arm gave them victory. You gave them success because you loved them.

4.verse: You are my King and my God. You give victories to the people of Jacob.

5.verse: With your help we push back our enemies. By your power we walk all over them.

6.verse: I put no trust in my bow. My sword doesn’t bring me victory.

7.verse: But you give us victory over our enemies. You put them to shame.

8.verse: All day long we talk about how great God is. We will praise your name forever.

9.verse: But now you have turned your back on us and made us humble. You don’t march out with our armies anymore.

10.verse: You made us turn and run from our enemies. They have taken what belongs to us.

11.verse: You handed us over to be eaten up like sheep. You have scattered us among the nations.

12.verse: You sold your people for very little. You didn’t gain anything when you sold them.

13.verse: You have made us something that our neighbors laugh at. Those who live around us make fun of us and tease us.

14.verse: The nations make jokes about us. They shake their heads at us.

15.verse: All day long I have to live with my shame. My face is covered with it.

16.verse: That’s because they laugh at me and attack me with their words. They want to get even with me.

17.verse: All of this happened to us, even though we had not forgotten you. We had not broken the covenant you made with us.

18.verse: Our hearts had not turned away from you. Our feet had not wandered from your path.

19.verse: But you crushed us and left us to the wild dogs. You covered us over with deep darkness.

20.verse: We didn’t forget our God. We didn’t spread out our hands in prayer to a false god.

21.verse: If we had, God would have discovered it. He knows the secrets of our hearts.

22.verse: But because of you, we face death all day long. We are considered as sheep to be killed.

23.verse: Lord, wake up! Why are you sleeping? Get up! Don’t say no to us forever.

24.verse: Why do you turn your face away from us? Why do you forget our pain and troubles?

25.verse: We are brought down to the dust. Our bodies lie flat on the ground.

26.verse: Rise up and help us. Save us because of your faithful love.

1.verse: For the director of music. A maskil of the Sons of Korah. A wedding song to the tune of “Lilies.” My heart is full of beautiful words as I say my poem for the king. My tongue is like the pen of a skillful writer.

2.verse: You are the most excellent of men. Your lips have been given the ability to speak gracious words. God has blessed you forever.

3.verse: Mighty one, put your sword at your side. Put on glory and majesty as if they were your clothes.

4.verse: In your majesty ride out with power to fight for what is true, humble and fair. Let your right hand do wonderful things.

5.verse: Shoot your sharp arrows into the hearts of your enemies. Let the nations come under your control.

6.verse: Your throne is the very throne of God. Your kingdom will last for ever and ever. You will rule by treating everyone fairly.

7.verse: You love what is right and hate what is evil. So your God has placed you above your companions. He has filled you with joy by pouring the sacred oil on your head.

8.verse: Myrrh and aloes and cassia make all your robes smell good. In palaces decorated with ivory the music played on stringed instruments makes you glad.

9.verse: Daughters of kings are among the women you honor. At your right hand is the royal bride dressed in gold from Ophir.

10.verse: Royal bride, listen and pay careful attention. Forget about your people and the home you came from.

11.verse: Let the king be charmed by your beauty. Honor him. He is now your master.

12.verse: The people of Tyre will come with gifts. Wealthy people will try to gain your favor.

13.verse: In her room, the princess looks glorious. Her gown has gold threads running through it.

14.verse: Dressed in beautiful clothes, she is led to the king. Her virgin companions follow her. They have been brought to be with her.

15.verse: They are led in with joy and gladness. They enter the palace of the king.

16.verse: Your sons will rule just as your father and grandfather did. You will make them princes through the whole land.

17.verse: I will make sure that people will always remember you. The nations will praise you for ever and ever.

1.verse: For the director of music. A song of the Sons of Korah. According to alamoth. God is our place of safety. He gives us strength. He is always there to help us in times of trouble.

2.verse: The earth may fall apart. The mountains may fall into the middle of the sea. But we will not be afraid.

3.verse: The waters of the sea may roar and foam. The mountains may shake when the waters rise. But we will not be afraid.

4.verse: God’s blessings are like a river. They fill the city of God with joy. That city is the holy place where the Most High God lives.

5.verse: Because God is there, the city will not fall. God will help it at the beginning of the day.

6.verse: Nations are in disorder. Kingdoms fall. God speaks, and the people of the earth melt in fear.

7.verse: The LORD who rules over all is with us. The God of Jacob is like a fort to us.

8.verse: Come and see what the LORD has done. See the places he has destroyed on the earth.

9.verse: He makes wars stop from one end of the earth to the other. He breaks every bow. He snaps every spear. He burns every shield with fire.

10.verse: He says, “Be still, and know that I am God. I will be honored among the nations. I will be honored in the earth.”

11.verse: The LORD who rules over all is with us. The God of Jacob is like a fort to us.

1.verse: For the director of music. A psalm of the Sons of Korah. Clap your hands, all you nations. Shout to God with cries of joy.

2.verse: Do this because the LORD Most High is wonderful. He is the great King over the whole earth.

3.verse: He brought nations under our control. He made them fall under us.
