4.verse: He chose our land for us. The people of Jacob are proud of their land, and God loves them.

5.verse: God went up to his throne while his people were shouting with joy. The LORD went up while trumpets were playing.

6.verse: Sing praises to God. Sing praises. Sing praises to our King. Sing praises.

7.verse: God is the King of the whole earth. Sing a psalm of praise to him.

8.verse: God rules over the nations. He is seated on his holy throne.

9.verse: The nobles of the nations come together. They are now part of the people of the God of Abraham. The kings of the earth belong to God. He is greatly honored.

1.verse: A song. A psalm of the Sons of Korah. The LORD is great. He is really worthy of praise. Praise him in the city of our God, his holy mountain.

2.verse: Mount Zion is high and beautiful. It brings joy to everyone on earth. Mount Zion is like the highest parts of Mount Zaphon. It is the city of the Great King.

3.verse: God is there to keep it safe. He has shown himself to be like a fort to the city.

4.verse: Many kings joined forces. They entered Israel together.

5.verse: But when they saw Mount Zion, they were amazed. They ran away in terror.

6.verse: Trembling took hold of them. They felt pain like a woman giving birth.

7.verse: LORD, you destroyed them like ships of Tarshish that were torn apart by an east wind.

8.verse: What we heard we have also seen. We have seen it in the city of the LORD who rules over all. We have seen it in the city of our God. We have heard and seen that God makes it secure forever.

9.verse: God, inside your temple we think about your faithful love.

10.verse: God, your fame reaches from one end of the earth to the other. So people praise you from one end of the earth to the other. You use your power to do what is right.

11.verse: Mount Zion is filled with joy. The villages of Judah are glad. That’s because you judge fairly.

12.verse: Walk all around Zion. Count its towers.

13.verse: Think carefully about its outer walls. Just look at how safe it is! Then you can tell its people that God keeps them safe.

14.verse: This God is our God for ever and ever. He will be our guide to the very end.

1.verse: For the director of music. A psalm of the Sons of Korah. Hear this, all you nations. Listen, all you who live in this world.

2.verse: Listen, people, whether you are ordinary or important. Listen, people, whether you are rich or poor.

3.verse: My mouth will speak wise words. What I think about in my heart will give you understanding.

4.verse: I will pay attention to a proverb. I will explain my riddle as I play the harp.

5.verse: Why should I be afraid when trouble comes? Why should I fear when sinners are all around me? They are the kind of people who want to take advantage of me.

6.verse: They trust in their wealth. They brag about how rich they are.

7.verse: No one can pay for the life of anyone else. No one can give God what that would cost.

8.verse: The price for a life is very high. No payment is ever enough.

9.verse: No one can pay enough to live forever and not rot in the grave.

10.verse: Everyone can see that even wise people die. People who are foolish and who have no sense also pass away. All of them leave their wealth to others.

11.verse: Their tombs will remain their houses forever. Their graves will be their homes for all time to come. Naming lands after themselves won’t help either.

12.verse: Even though people may be very rich, they don’t live on and on. They are like the animals. They die.

13.verse: That’s what happens to those who trust in themselves. It also happens to their followers, who agree with what they say.

14.verse: They are like sheep and will end up in the grave. Death will be their shepherd. But when honest people come to power, a new day will dawn. The bodies of sinners will waste away in the grave. They will end up far away from their princely houses.

15.verse: But God will save me from the place of the dead. He will certainly take me to himself.

16.verse: Don’t get too upset when other people become rich. Don’t be troubled when they become more and more wealthy.

17.verse: They won’t take anything with them when they die. Their riches won’t go down to the grave with them.

18.verse: While they lived, they believed they were blessed. People praised them when things were going well for them.

19.verse: But they will die, like their people of long ago. They will never again see the light of life.

20.verse: People who have riches but don’t understand are like the animals. They die.

1.verse: A psalm of Asaph. The Mighty One, God, the LORD, speaks. He calls out to the earth from the sunrise in the east to the sunset in the west.

2.verse: From Zion, perfect and beautiful, God’s glory shines out.

3.verse: Our God comes, and he won’t be silent. A burning fire goes ahead of him. A terrible storm is all around him.

4.verse: He calls out to heaven and earth to be his witnesses. Then he judges his people.

5.verse: He says, “Gather this holy people around me. They made a covenant with me by offering a sacrifice.”

6.verse: The heavens announce that what God decides is right. That’s because he is a God of justice.

7.verse: God says, “Listen, my people, and I will speak. I will be a witness against you, Israel. I am God, your God.

8.verse: I don’t bring charges against you because of your sacrifices. I don’t bring charges because of the burnt offerings you always bring me.

9.verse: I don’t need a bull from your barn. I don’t need goats from your pens.

10.verse: Every animal in the forest already belongs to me. And so do the cattle on a thousand hills.

11.verse: I own every bird in the mountains. The insects in the fields belong to me.

12.verse: If I were hungry, I wouldn’t tell you. The world belongs to me. And so does everything in it.

13.verse: Do I eat the meat of bulls? Do I drink the blood of goats?

14.verse: Bring me thank offerings, because I am your God. Carry out the promises you made to me, because I am the Most High God.

15.verse: Call out to me when trouble comes. I will save you. And you will honor me.”

16.verse: But here is what God says to a sinful person. “What right do you have to speak the words of my laws? How dare you speak the words of my covenant!

17.verse: You hate my teaching. You turn your back on what I say.

18.verse: When you see a thief, you join him. You make friends with those who commit adultery.

19.verse: You use your mouth to speak evil. You use your tongue to spread lies.

20.verse: You are a witness against your brother. You always tell lies about your own mother’s son.

21.verse: When you did these things, I kept silent. So you thought I was just like you. But now I’m going to bring you to court. I will bring charges against you.

22.verse: “You who forget God, think about this. If you don’t, I will tear you to pieces. No one will be able to save you.

23.verse: People who sacrifice thank offerings to me honor me. To those who are without blame I will show my power to save.”

1.verse: For the director of music. A psalm of David when the prophet Nathan came to him. Nathan came to him after David had committed adultery with Bathsheba. God, have mercy on me according to your faithful love. Because your love is so tender and kind, wipe out my lawless acts.

2.verse: Wash away all the evil things I’ve done. Make me pure from my sin.

3.verse: I know the lawless acts I’ve committed. I can’t forget my sin.

4.verse: You are the one I’ve really sinned against. I’ve done what is evil in your sight. So you are right when you sentence me. You are fair when you judge me.

5.verse: I know I’ve been a sinner ever since I was born. I’ve been a sinner ever since my mother became pregnant with me.

6.verse: I know that you wanted faithfulness even when I was in my mother’s body. You taught me wisdom in that secret place.

7.verse: Sprinkle me with hyssop, then I will be clean. Wash me, then I will be whiter than snow.

8.verse: Let me hear you say, “Your sins are forgiven.” That will bring me joy and gladness. Let the body you have broken be glad.

9.verse: Take away all my sins. Wipe away all the evil things I’ve done.

10.verse: God, create a pure heart in me. Give me a new spirit that is faithful to you.

11.verse: Don’t send me away from you. Don’t take your Holy Spirit away from me.

12.verse: Give me back the joy that comes from being saved by you. Give me a spirit that obeys you so that I will keep going.

13.verse: Then I will teach your ways to those who commit lawless acts. And sinners will turn back to you.

14.verse: You are the God who saves me. I have committed murder. God, take away my guilt. Then my tongue will sing about how right you are no matter what you do.

15.verse: Lord, open my lips so that I can speak. Then my mouth will praise you.

16.verse: You don’t take delight in sacrifice. If you did, I would bring it. You don’t take pleasure in burnt offerings.

17.verse: The greatest sacrifice you want is a broken spirit. God, you will gladly accept a heart that is broken because of sadness over sin.

18.verse: May you be pleased to give Zion success. May it please you to build up the walls of Jerusalem.

19.verse: Then you will delight in the sacrifices of those who do what is right. Whole burnt offerings will bring delight to you. And bulls will be offered on your altar.

1.verse: For the director of music. A maskil of David when Doeg, who was from Edom, had gone to Saul. Doeg had told Saul, “David has gone to the house of Ahimelek.” You think you are such a big, strong man! Why do you brag about the evil things you’ve done? You are a dishonor to God all the time.

2.verse: You plan ways to destroy others. Your tongue is like a blade that has a sharp edge. You are always telling lies.

3.verse: You love evil instead of good. You would rather lie than tell the truth.

4.verse: You love to harm others with your words, you liar!

5.verse: So God will destroy you forever. He will grab you and pluck you from your tent. He will remove you from this life.

6.verse: Those who do what is right will see it and learn a lesson from it. They will laugh at you and say,

7.verse: “Just look at this fellow! He didn’t depend on God for his safety. He put his trust in all his wealth. He grew strong by destroying others!”

8.verse: But I am like a healthy olive tree. My roots are deep in the house of God. I trust in your faithful love for ever and ever.

9.verse: I will praise you forever for what you have done. I will praise you when I’m with your faithful people. I will put my hope in you because you are good.

1.verse: For the director of music. According to mahalath. A maskil of David. Foolish people say in their hearts, “There is no God.” They do all kinds of horrible and evil things. No one does anything good.

2.verse: God looks down from heaven on all people. He wants to see if there are any who understand. He wants to see if there are any who trust in God.

3.verse: All of them have turned away. They have all become evil. No one does anything good, no one at all.

4.verse: Don’t these people who do evil know anything? They eat up my people as if they were eating bread. They never call out to God for help.

5.verse: Just look at them! They are filled with terror even when there is nothing to be afraid of! People of Israel, God scattered the bones of those who attacked you. You put them to shame, because God hated them.

6.verse: How I pray that the God who saves Israel will come out of Zion! God will bless his people with great success again. Then let the people of Jacob be filled with joy! Let Israel be glad!

1.verse: For the director of music. To be played on stringed instruments. A maskil of David when the men from Ziph had gone to Saul. They had said, “Isn’t David hiding among us?” God, save me by your power. Set me free by your might.

2.verse: God, hear my prayer. Listen to what I’m saying.

3.verse: Enemies who are proud are attacking me. Mean people are trying to kill me. They don’t care about God.

4.verse: But I know that God helps me. The Lord is the one who keeps me going.

5.verse: My enemies tell lies about me. Do to them the evil things they planned against me. God, be faithful and destroy them.

6.verse: I will sacrifice an offering to you just because I choose to. LORD, I will praise your name because it is good.

7.verse: You have saved me from all my troubles. With my own eyes I have seen you win the battle over my enemies.

1.verse: For the director of music. A maskil of David to be played on stringed instruments. God, listen to my prayer. Pay attention to my cry for help.

2.verse: Hear me and answer me. My thoughts upset me. I’m very troubled.

3.verse: I’m troubled by what my enemies say about me. I’m upset because they say they will harm me. They cause me all kinds of suffering. When they are angry, they attack me with their words.

4.verse: I feel great pain deep down inside me. The terrors of death have fallen on me.

5.verse: Fear and trembling have taken hold of me. Panic has overpowered me.

6.verse: I said, “I wish I had wings like a dove! Then I would fly away and be at rest.

7.verse: I would escape to a place far away. I would stay out in the desert.

8.verse: I would hurry to my place of safety. It would be far away from the winds and storms I’m facing.”

9.verse: Lord, confuse the sinners and keep them from understanding one another. I see people destroying things and fighting in the city.

10.verse: Day and night they prowl around on top of its walls. The city is full of crime and trouble.

11.verse: Forces that destroy are at work inside it. Its streets are full of people who cheat others and take advantage of them.

12.verse: If an enemy were making fun of me, I could stand it. If he were getting ready to oppose me, I could hide.

13.verse: But it’s you, someone like myself. It’s my companion, my close friend.

14.verse: We used to enjoy good friendship at the house of God. We used to walk together among those who came to worship.

15.verse: Let death take my enemies by surprise. Let them be buried alive, because their hearts and homes are full of evil.

16.verse: But I call out to God. And the LORD saves me.

17.verse: Evening, morning and noon I groan and cry out. And he hears my voice.

18.verse: Even though many enemies are fighting against me, he brings me safely back from the battle.

19.verse: God has been on his throne since ancient times and does not change. He will hear my enemies and make them humble. That’s because they have no respect for God.

20.verse: My companion attacks his friends. He breaks his promise.

21.verse: His talk is as smooth as butter. But he has war in his heart. His words flow like olive oil. But they are like swords ready for battle.

22.verse: Turn your worries over to the LORD. He will keep you going. He will never let godly people be shaken.

23.verse: God, you will bring sinners down to the grave. Murderers and liars won’t live out even half of their lives. But I trust in you.

1.verse: For the director of music. A miktam of David after the Philistines had captured him in Gath. To the tune of “A Dove on Distant Oak Trees.” Help me, God. Men are chasing me. All day long they keep attacking me.

2.verse: My enemies chase me all day long. Many proud people are attacking me.

3.verse: When I’m afraid, I put my trust in you.

4.verse: I trust in God. I praise his word. I trust in God. I am not afraid. What can mere people do to me?

5.verse: All day long they twist my words. They are always making plans to destroy me.

6.verse: They get together and hide. They watch my steps. They hope to kill me.

7.verse: Because they are so evil, make sure you don’t let them escape. God, bring down the nations in your anger.

8.verse: Make a record of my sadness. List my tears in your book. Aren’t you making a record of them?

9.verse: My enemies will turn back when I call out to you for help. Then I will know that God is on my side.

10.verse: I trust in God. I praise his word. I trust in the LORD. I praise his word.

11.verse: I trust in God. I am not afraid. What can mere people do to me?

12.verse: God, I have made promises to you. I will bring my thank offerings to you.

13.verse: You have saved me from the darkness of death. You have kept me from tripping and falling. Now I can live with you in the light of life.

1.verse: For the director of music. A miktam of David when he had run away from Saul into the cave. To the tune of “Do Not Destroy.” Have mercy on me, God. Have mercy on me. I go to you for safety. I will find safety in the shadow of your wings. There I will stay until the danger is gone.

2.verse: I cry out to God Most High. I cry out to God, and he shows that I am right.

3.verse: He answers from heaven and saves me. He puts to shame those who chase me. He shows his love and that he is faithful.

4.verse: Men who are like lions are all around me. I am forced to lie down among people who are like hungry animals. Their teeth are like spears and arrows. Their tongues are like sharp swords.

5.verse: God, may you be honored above the heavens. Let your glory be over the whole earth.

6.verse: My enemies spread a net to catch me by the feet. I felt helpless. They dug a pit in my path. But they fell into it themselves.

7.verse: God, my heart feels secure. My heart feels secure. I will sing and make music to you.

8.verse: My spirit, wake up! Harp and lyre, wake up! I want to sing and make music before the sun rises.

9.verse: Lord, I will praise you among the nations. I will sing about you among the people of the earth.

10.verse: Great is your love. It reaches to the heavens. Your truth reaches to the skies.

11.verse: God, may you be honored above the heavens. Let your glory be over the whole earth.

1.verse: For the director of music. A miktam of David to the tune of “Do Not Destroy.” Are you rulers really fair when you speak? Do you judge people honestly?

2.verse: No, in your hearts you plan to be unfair. With your hands you do terrible things on the earth.

3.verse: Even from birth those who are evil go down the wrong path. From the day they are born they go the wrong way and spread lies.

4.verse: Their words are like the poison of a snake. They are like the poison of a cobra that has covered up its ears.

5.verse: It won’t listen to a snake charmer’s tune, even if the charmer plays very well.

6.verse: God, break the teeth in the mouths of those sinners! LORD, tear out the sharp teeth of those lions!

7.verse: Let those people disappear like water that flows away. When they draw their bows, let their arrows fall short of the target.

8.verse: Let them be like a slug that melts away as it moves along. Let them be like a baby that is born dead and never sees the sun.

9.verse: Evil people will be swept away before burning thorns can heat a pot. And it doesn’t matter if the thorns are green or dry.

10.verse: Godly people will be glad when those who have hurt them are paid back. They will dip their feet in the blood of those who do evil.

11.verse: Then people will say, “The godly will get their reward. There really is a God who judges the earth.”

1.verse: For the director of music. A miktam of David when Saul had sent men to watch David’s house. Saul sent the men to kill David. To the tune of “Do Not Destroy.” God, save me from my enemies. Keep me safe from people who are attacking me.

2.verse: Save me from those who do evil. Save me from people who want to kill me.

3.verse: See how they hide and wait for me! LORD, angry people plan to harm me, even though I haven’t hurt them in any way or sinned against them.

4.verse: I haven’t done anything wrong to them. But they are ready to attack me. Rise up and help me! Look at what I’m up against!

5.verse: LORD God who rules over all, rise up. God of Israel, punish all the nations. Don’t show any mercy to those sinful people who have turned against me.

6.verse: My enemies are like a pack of barking dogs that come back to the city in the evening. They prowl around the city.

7.verse: Listen to what pours out of their mouths. The words from their lips are like swords. They think, “Who can hear us?”

8.verse: But you laugh at them, LORD. You make fun of all those nations.

9.verse: You give me strength. I look to you. God, you are like a fort to me.

10.verse: You are my God, and I can depend on you. God will march out in front of me. He will let me look down on those who tell lies about me.

11.verse: Lord, you are like a shield that keeps us safe. Don’t kill my enemies all at once. If you do, my people will forget about it. Use your power to pull my enemies up by the roots like weeds. Destroy them.

12.verse: They have sinned with their mouths. Their lips have spoken evil words. They have cursed me and lied. Let them be caught in their pride.

13.verse: Burn them up in your anger. Burn them up until there isn’t anything left of them. Then everyone from one end of the earth to the other will know that God rules over the people of Jacob.

14.verse: My enemies are like a pack of barking dogs that come back into the city in the evening. They prowl around the city.

15.verse: They wander around looking for food. They groan if they don’t find something that will satisfy them.

16.verse: But I will sing about your strength. In the morning I will sing about your love. You are like a fort to me. You keep me safe in times of trouble.

17.verse: You give me strength. I sing praise to you. God, you are like a fort to me. You are my God, and I can depend on you.

1.verse: For the director of music. For teaching. A miktam of David when he fought against Aram Naharaim and Aram Zobah. That was when Joab returned and struck down 12,000 people from Edom in the Valley of Salt. To the tune of “The Lily of the Covenant.” God, you have turned away from us. You have attacked us. You have been angry. Now turn back to us!

2.verse: You have shaken the land and torn it open. Fix its cracks, because it is falling apart.

3.verse: You have shown your people hard times. You have made us drink the wine of your anger. Now we can’t even walk straight.

4.verse: But you lead into battle those who have respect for you. You give them a flag to wave against the enemy’s weapons.

5.verse: Save us and help us by your power. Do this so that those you love may be saved.

6.verse: God has spoken from his temple. He has said, “I will win the battle. Then I will divide up the land around Shechem. I will divide up the Valley of Sukkoth.

7.verse: Gilead belongs to me. So does the land of Manasseh. Ephraim is the strongest tribe. It is like a helmet for my head. Judah is the royal tribe. It is like a ruler’s scepter.

8.verse: Moab serves me like one who washes my feet. I toss my sandal on Edom to show that I own it. I shout to Philistia that I have won the battle.”

9.verse: Who will bring me to the city that has high walls around it? Who will lead me to the land of Edom?

10.verse: God, isn’t it you, even though you have now turned away from us? Isn’t it you, even though you don’t lead our armies into battle anymore?

11.verse: Help us against our enemies. The help people give doesn’t amount to anything.

12.verse: With your help we will win the battle. You will walk all over our enemies.

1.verse: For the director of music. A psalm of David to be played on stringed instruments. God, hear my cry for help. Listen to my prayer.

2.verse: From a place far away I call out to you. I call out as my heart gets weaker. Lead me to the safety of a rock that is high above me.

3.verse: You have always kept me safe from my enemies. You are like a strong tower to me.

4.verse: I long to live in your holy tent forever. There I find safety in the shadow of your wings.

5.verse: God, you have heard my promises. You have given me what belongs to those who worship you.

6.verse: Add many days to the king’s life. Let him live on and on for many years.

7.verse: May he always enjoy your blessing as he rules. Let your love and truth keep him safe.

8.verse: Then I will always sing praise to you. I will keep my promises day after day.

1.verse: For the director of music. For Jeduthun. A psalm of David. It is surely true that I find my rest in God. He is the God who saves me.

2.verse: It is surely true that he is my rock. He is the God who saves me. He is like a fort to me. I will always be secure.

3.verse: How long will you enemies attack me? Will all of you throw me down? I’m like a leaning wall. I’m like a fence about to fall.

4.verse: Surely my enemies only want to pull me down from my place of honor. They take delight in telling lies. They bless me with what they say. But in their hearts they ask for bad things to happen to me.

5.verse: Yes, I must find my rest in God. He is the God who gives me hope.

6.verse: It is surely true that he is my rock and the God who saves me. He is like a fort to me, so I will always be secure.

7.verse: I depend on God to save me and to honor me. He is my mighty rock and my place of safety.

8.verse: Trust in him at all times, you people. Tell him all your troubles. God is our place of safety.

9.verse: Surely ordinary people are only a breath. Important people are not what they seem to be. If they were weighed on a scale, they wouldn’t amount to anything. Together they are only a breath.

10.verse: Don’t trust in money you have taken from others. Don’t put false hope in things you have stolen. Even if your riches grow, don’t put your trust in them.

11.verse: God, I have heard you say two things. One is that power belongs to you, God.

12.verse: The other is that your love, Lord, never ends. You will reward everyone in keeping with what they have done.

1.verse: A psalm of David when he was in the Desert of Judah. God, you are my God. I seek you with all my heart. With all my strength I thirst for you in this dry desert where there isn’t any water.

2.verse: I have seen you in the sacred tent. There I have seen your power and your glory.

3.verse: Your love is better than life. So I will bring glory to you with my lips.

4.verse: I will praise you as long as I live. I will call on your name when I lift up my hands in prayer.

5.verse: I will be as satisfied as if I had eaten the best food there is. I will sing praise to you with my mouth.

6.verse: As I lie on my bed I remember you. I think of you all night long.

7.verse: Because you have helped me, I sing in the shadow of your wings.

8.verse: I hold on to you tightly. Your powerful right hand takes good care of me.

9.verse: Those who want to kill me will be destroyed. They will go down into the grave.

10.verse: They will be killed by swords. They will become food for wild dogs.

11.verse: But the king will be filled with joy because of what God has done. All those who make promises in God’s name will be able to brag. But the mouths of liars will be shut.

1.verse: For the director of music. A psalm of David. God, hear me as I tell you my problem. Don’t let my enemies kill me.

2.verse: Hide me from evil people who talk about how to harm me. Hide me from those people who are planning to do evil.

3.verse: They make their tongues like sharp swords. They aim their mean words like deadly arrows.

4.verse: They shoot from their hiding places at people who aren’t guilty. They shoot quickly and aren’t afraid of being caught.

5.verse: They help one another make evil plans. They talk about hiding their traps. They say, “Who can see what we are doing?”

6.verse: They make plans to do what is evil. They say, “We have thought up a perfect plan!” The hearts and minds of people are so clever!

7.verse: But God will shoot my enemies with his arrows. He will suddenly strike them down.

8.verse: He will turn their own words against them. He will destroy them. All those who see them will shake their heads and look down on them.

9.verse: All people will respect God. They will tell about his works. They will think about what he has done.

10.verse: Godly people will be full of joy because of what the LORD has done. They will go to him for safety. All those whose hearts are honest will be proud of what he has done.

1.verse: For the director of music. A psalm of David. A song. Our God, we look forward to praising you in Zion. We will keep our promises to you.

2.verse: All people will come to you, because you hear and answer prayer.

3.verse: When our sins became too much for us, you forgave our lawless acts.

4.verse: Blessed are those you choose and bring near to worship you. You bring us into the courtyards of your holy temple. There in your house we are filled with all kinds of good things.

5.verse: God our Savior, you answer us with right and wonderful deeds. People all over the world and beyond the farthest oceans put their hope in you.

6.verse: You formed the mountains by your power. You showed how strong you are.

7.verse: You calmed the oceans and their roaring waves. You calmed the angry words and actions of the nations.

8.verse: Everyone on earth is amazed at the wonderful things you have done. What you do makes people from one end of the earth to the other sing for joy.

9.verse: You take care of the land and water it. You make it able to grow many crops. You fill your streams with water. You do that to provide the people with grain. That’s what you have decided to do for the land.

10.verse: You water its rows. You smooth out its bumps. You soften it with showers. And you bless its crops.

11.verse: You bring the year to a close with huge crops. You provide more than enough food.

12.verse: The grass grows thick even in the desert. The hills are dressed with gladness.

13.verse: The meadows are covered with flocks and herds. The valleys are dressed with grain. They sing and shout for joy.

1.verse: For the director of music. A song. A psalm. Shout to God for joy, everyone on earth!

2.verse: Sing about the glory of his name! Give him glorious praise!

3.verse: Say to God, “What wonderful things you do! Your power is so great that your enemies bow down to you in fear.

4.verse: Everyone on earth bows down to you. They sing praise to you. They sing the praises of your name.”

5.verse: Come and see what God has done. See what wonderful things he has done for people!

6.verse: He turned the Red Sea into dry land. The people of Israel passed through the waters on foot. Come, let us be full of joy because of what he did.

7.verse: He rules by his power forever. His eyes watch the nations. Let no one who refuses to obey him rise up against him.

8.verse: Praise our God, all you nations. Let the sound of the praise you give him be heard.

9.verse: He has kept us alive. He has kept our feet from slipping.

10.verse: God, you have tested us. You put us through fire to make us like silver.

11.verse: You put us in prison. You placed heavy loads on our backs.

12.verse: You let our enemies ride their chariots over our heads. We went through fire and water. But you brought us to a place where we have everything we need.

13.verse: I will come to your temple with burnt offerings. I will keep my promises to you.

14.verse: I made them with my lips. My mouth spoke them when I was in trouble.

15.verse: I will sacrifice fat animals to you as burnt offerings. I will offer rams, bulls and goats to you.

16.verse: Come and hear, all you who have respect for God. Let me tell you what he has done for me.

17.verse: I cried out to him with my mouth. I praised him with my tongue.

18.verse: If I had enjoyed having sin in my heart, the Lord would not have listened.

19.verse: But God has surely listened. He has heard my prayer.

20.verse: Give praise to God. He has accepted my prayer. He has not held back his love from me.

1.verse: For the director of music. A psalm. A song to be played on stringed instruments. God, have mercy on us and bless us. May you be pleased with us.

2.verse: Then your ways will be known on earth. All nations will see that you have the power to save.

3.verse: God, may the nations praise you. May all the people on earth praise you.

4.verse: May the nations be glad and sing for joy. You rule the people of the earth fairly. You guide the nations of the earth.

5.verse: God, may the nations praise you. May all the people on earth praise you.

6.verse: The land produces its crops. God, our God, blesses us.

7.verse: May God continue to bless us. Then people from one end of the earth to the other will have respect for him.

1.verse: For the director of music. A psalm of David. A song. May God rise up and scatter his enemies. May they turn and run away from him.

2.verse: May you, God, blow them away like smoke. As fire melts wax, so may God destroy sinful people.

3.verse: But may those who do what is right be glad and filled with joy when they are with him. May they be happy and joyful.

4.verse: Sing to God, sing praise to his name. Lift up a song to the God who rides on the clouds. Be glad when you are with him. His name is the LORD.

5.verse: God is in his holy temple. He is a father to children whose fathers have died. He takes care of women whose husbands have died.

6.verse: God gives lonely people a family. He sets prisoners free, and they go out singing. But those who refuse to obey him live in a land that is baked by the sun.

7.verse: God, you led your people out. You marched through the desert.

8.verse: The ground shook when you, the God of Sinai, appeared. The heavens poured down rain when you, the God of Israel, appeared.

9.verse: God, you gave us plenty of rain. You renewed your worn-out land.

10.verse: God, your people made their homes in it. From all your riches, you provided for those who were poor.

11.verse: The Lord gives the message. The women who make it known are a huge group.

12.verse: They said, “Kings and armies are running away. The women at home are dividing up the things the army took from their enemies.

13.verse: Even while the soldiers sleep near the sheep pens, God wins the battle for them. He gives the enemy’s silver and gold to Israel, his dove.”

14.verse: The Mighty One has scattered the kings around the land. It was like snow falling on Mount Zalmon.

15.verse: Mount Bashan is a majestic mountain. Mount Bashan is a very rocky mountain.

16.verse: Why are you jealous of Mount Zion, you rocky mountain? That’s where God chooses to rule. That’s where the LORD himself will live forever.

17.verse: God has come with tens of thousands of his chariots. He has come with thousands and thousands of them. The Lord has come from Mount Sinai. He has entered his holy place.

18.verse: When he went up to his place on high, he took many prisoners. He received gifts from people, even from those who refused to obey him. The LORD God went up to live on Mount Zion.

19.verse: Give praise to the Lord. Give praise to God our Savior. He carries our heavy loads day after day.

20.verse: Our God is a God who saves. He is the King and the LORD. He saves us from death.

21.verse: God will certainly smash the heads of his enemies. He will break the hairy heads of those who keep on sinning.

22.verse: The Lord says, “I will bring your enemies from Bashan. I will bring them up from the bottom of the sea.

23.verse: Then your feet can wade in their blood. The tongues of your dogs can lick up all the blood they want.”

24.verse: God, those who worship you come marching into view. My God and King, those who follow you have entered the sacred tent.

25.verse: The singers are walking in front. Next come the musicians. Young women playing tambourines are with them.

26.verse: The leaders sing, “Praise God among all those who worship him. Praise the LORD in the community of Israel.”

27.verse: The little tribe of Benjamin leads the worshipers. Next comes the great crowd of Judah’s princes. Then come the princes of Zebulun and the princes of Naphtali.

28.verse: God, show us your power. Show us your strength. God, do as you have done before.

29.verse: Do it from your temple at Jerusalem, where kings will bring you gifts.

30.verse: Give a strong warning to Egypt, that beast among the tall grass. It is like a herd of bulls among the calves. May that beast bow down before you with gifts of silver. Scatter the nations who like to make war.

31.verse: Messengers will come from Egypt. The people of Cush will be quick to bring gifts to you.

32.verse: Sing to God, you kingdoms of the earth. Sing praise to the Lord.

33.verse: He rides across the highest places in heaven. He rides across the ancient skies above. He thunders with his mighty voice.

34.verse: Tell how powerful God is. He rules as king over Israel. The skies show how powerful he is.

35.verse: How wonderful is God in his holy place! The God of Israel gives power and strength to his people. Give praise to God!

1.verse: For the director of music. A psalm of David to the tune of “Lilies.” God, save me. My troubles are like a flood. I’m up to my neck in them.

2.verse: I’m sinking in deep mud. I have no firm place to stand. I am out in deep water. The waves roll over me.

3.verse: I’m worn out from calling for help. My throat is very dry. My eyes grow tired looking for my God.

4.verse: Those who hate me without any reason are more than the hairs on my head. Many people who don’t have any reason to be my enemies are trying to destroy me. They force me to give back what I didn’t steal.

5.verse: God, you know how foolish I’ve been. My guilt is not hidden from you.

6.verse: Lord, you are the LORD who rules over all. May those who put their hope in you not be dishonored because of me. You are the God of Israel. May those who worship you not be put to shame because of me.

7.verse: Because of you, people laugh at me. My face is covered with shame.

8.verse: I’m an outsider to my own family. I’m a stranger to my own mother’s children.

9.verse: My great love for your house destroys me. Those who make fun of you make fun of me also.

10.verse: When I weep and go without eating, they laugh at me.

11.verse: When I put on rough clothing to show how sad I am, people make jokes about me.

12.verse: Those who gather in public places make fun of me. Those who get drunk make up songs about me.

13.verse: But LORD, I pray to you. May this be the time you help me. God, answer me because you love me so much. Save me, as you always do.

14.verse: Save me from the trouble I’m in. It’s like slippery mud, so don’t let me sink in it. Save me from those who hate me. Save me from the deep water I’m in.

15.verse: Don’t let the floods cover me. Don’t let the deep water swallow me up. Don’t let the grave close its mouth over me.

16.verse: LORD, answer me because your love is so good. Turn to me because you are so kind.

17.verse: Don’t turn your face away from me. Answer me quickly. I’m in trouble.

18.verse: Come near and save me. Set me free from my enemies.

19.verse: You know how they make fun of me. They dishonor me and put me to shame. You know all about my enemies.

20.verse: They have broken my heart by saying evil things about me. It has left me helpless. I looked for pity, but I didn’t find any. I looked for someone to comfort me, but I didn’t find anyone.

21.verse: They put bitter spices in my food. They gave me vinegar when I was thirsty.

22.verse: Let their feast be a trap and a snare. Let my enemies get what’s coming to them.

23.verse: Let their eyes grow weak so they can’t see. Let their backs be bent forever.

24.verse: Pour out your anger on them. Let them feel what it is like.

25.verse: May their homes be deserted. May no one live in their tents.

26.verse: They attack those you have wounded. They talk about the pain of those you have hurt.

27.verse: Charge them with one crime after another. Don’t save them.

28.verse: May their names be erased from the book of life. Don’t include them in the list of those who do right.

29.verse: I’m in pain. I’m in deep trouble. God, save me and keep me safe.

30.verse: I will praise God’s name by singing to him. I will bring him glory by giving him thanks.

31.verse: That will please the LORD more than offering him an ox. It will please him more than offering him a bull with its horns and hooves.

32.verse: Poor people will see it and be glad. The hearts of those who worship God will be strengthened.

33.verse: The LORD hears those who are in need. He doesn’t forget his people in prison.

34.verse: Let heaven and earth praise him. Let the oceans and everything that moves in them praise him.

35.verse: God will save Zion. He will build the cities of Judah again. Then people will live in them and own the land.

36.verse: The children of those who serve God will receive it. Those who love him will live there.

1.verse: For the director of music. A prayer of David. God, hurry and save me. LORD, come quickly and help me.

2.verse: Let those who are trying to kill me be put to shame. Let them not be honored. Let all those who want to destroy me be turned back in shame.

3.verse: Some people make fun of me. Let them be turned back when their plans fail.

4.verse: But let all those who seek you be joyful and glad because of what you have done. Let those who want you to save them always say, “The LORD is great!”

5.verse: But I am poor and needy. God, come quickly to me. You are the God who helps me and saves me. LORD, please don’t wait any longer.

1.verse: LORD, I have gone to you for safety. Let me never be put to shame.

2.verse: You do what is right, so save me and help me. Pay attention to me and save me.

3.verse: Be my rock of safety that I can always go to. Give the command to save me. You are my rock and my fort.

4.verse: My God, save me from the power of sinners. Save me from the hands of those who are mean and evil.

5.verse: You are the King and the LORD. You have always been my hope. I have trusted in you ever since I was young.

6.verse: From the time I was born I have depended on you. You brought me out of my mother’s body. I will praise you forever.

7.verse: To many people I am an example of how much you care. You are my strong place of safety.

8.verse: My mouth is filled with praise for you. All day long I will talk about your glory.

9.verse: Don’t push me away when I’m old. Don’t desert me when my strength is gone.

10.verse: My enemies speak against me. Those who want to kill me get together and make evil plans.

11.verse: They say, “God has deserted him. Go after him and grab him. No one will save him.”

12.verse: God, don’t be far away from me. My God, come quickly and help me.

13.verse: May those who bring charges against me die in shame. May those who want to harm me be covered with shame and dishonor.

14.verse: But I will always have hope. I will praise you more and more.

15.verse: I will tell other people about all the good things you have done. All day long I will talk about how you have saved your people. But there’s no way I could say how many times you’ve done this.

16.verse: LORD and King, I will come and announce your mighty acts. I will announce all the good things that you alone do.

17.verse: God, ever since I was young you have taught me. To this very day I tell about your wonderful acts.

18.verse: God, don’t leave me even when I’m old and have gray hair. Let me live to tell my children about your power. Let me tell all of them about your mighty acts.

19.verse: God, your saving acts reach to the skies. You have done great things. God, who is like you?

20.verse: You have sent many bitter troubles my way. But you will give me new life. Even if I’m almost in the grave, you will bring me back.

21.verse: You will honor me more and more. You will comfort me once again.

22.verse: My God, I will use the harp to praise you because you are always faithful. Holy One of Israel, I will use the lyre to sing praise to you.

23.verse: My lips will shout with joy when I sing praise to you. You have saved me.

24.verse: All day long my tongue will say that you have done what is right. Those who wanted to harm me have been put to shame. They have not been honored.

1.verse: A psalm of Solomon. God, give the king the ability to judge fairly. He is your royal son. Help him to do what is right.

2.verse: May he rule your people in the right way. May he be fair to those among your people who are hurting.

3.verse: May the mountains and the hills produce rich crops, because the people will do what is right.

4.verse: May the king stand up for those who are hurting. May he save the children of those who are in need. May he crush those who treat others badly.

5.verse: May the king rule as long as the sun shines and the moon gives its light. May he rule for all time to come.

6.verse: May he be like rain falling on the fields. May he be like showers watering the earth.

7.verse: May godly people do well as long as he rules. May they have more than they need as long as the moon lasts.

8.verse: May the king rule from sea to sea. May his kingdom reach from the Euphrates River to the ends of the earth.

9.verse: May the desert tribes bow down to him. May his enemies lick the dust.

10.verse: May the kings of Tarshish and of places far away bring him gifts. May the kings of Sheba and Seba give him presents.

11.verse: May all kings bow down to him. May all nations serve him.

12.verse: The king will save needy people who cry out to him. He will save those who are hurting and have no one else to help.

13.verse: He will take pity on those who are weak and in need. He will save them from death.

14.verse: He will save them from people who treat others badly. He will save them from people who do mean things to them. Their lives are very special to him.

15.verse: May the king live a long time! May gold from Sheba be given to him. May people always pray for him. May they ask the LORD to bless him all day long.

16.verse: May there be plenty of grain everywhere in the land. May it sway in the wind on the tops of the hills. May the crops grow well, like those in Lebanon. May they grow like the grass of the field.

17.verse: May the king’s name be remembered forever. May his fame last as long as the sun shines. Then all nations will be blessed because of him. They will call him blessed.

18.verse: Give praise to the LORD God, the God of Israel. Only he can do wonderful things.

19.verse: Give praise to his glorious name forever. May his glory fill the whole earth. Amen and Amen.

20.verse: The prayers of David, the son of Jesse, end here.

1.verse: BOOK III Psalms 73–89 Psalm 73 - A psalm of Asaph. God is truly good to Israel. He is good to those who have pure hearts.

2.verse: But my feet had almost slipped. I had almost tripped and fallen.

3.verse: I saw that proud and sinful people were doing well. And I began to long for what they had.

4.verse: They don’t have any troubles. Their bodies are healthy and strong.

5.verse: They don’t have the problems most people have. They don’t suffer as other people do.

6.verse: Their pride is like a necklace. They put on meanness as if it were their clothes.

7.verse: Many sins come out of their hard and stubborn hearts. There is no limit to the evil things they can think up.

8.verse: They laugh at others and speak words of hatred. They are proud. They warn others about the harm they can do to them.

9.verse: They brag as if they owned heaven itself. They talk as if they controlled the earth.

10.verse: So people listen to them. They lap up their words like water.

11.verse: They say, “How would God know what we’re doing? Does the Most High God know anything?”

12.verse: Here is what sinful people are like. They don’t have a care in the world. They keep getting richer and richer.

13.verse: It seems as if I have kept my heart pure for no reason. It didn’t do me any good to wash my hands to show that I wasn’t guilty of doing anything wrong.

14.verse: Day after day I’ve been in pain. God has punished me in a new way every morning.

15.verse: What if I had talked like that? Then I wouldn’t have been faithful to God’s children.

16.verse: I tried to understand it all. But it was more than I could handle.

17.verse: It troubled me until I entered God’s temple. Then I understood what will finally happen to bad people.

18.verse: God, I’m sure you will make them slip and fall. You will throw them down and destroy them.

19.verse: It will happen very suddenly. A terrible death will take them away completely.

20.verse: A dream goes away when a person wakes up. Lord, it will be like that when you rise up. It will be as if those people were only a dream.

21.verse: At one time my heart was sad and my spirit was bitter.

22.verse: I didn’t have any sense. I didn’t know anything. I acted like a wild animal toward you.

23.verse: But I am always with you. You hold me by my right hand.

24.verse: You give me wise advice to guide me. And when I die, you will take me away into the glory of heaven.

25.verse: I don’t have anyone in heaven but you. I don’t want anything on earth besides you.

26.verse: My body and my heart may grow weak. God, you give strength to my heart. You are everything I will ever need.

27.verse: Those who don’t want anything to do with you will die. You destroy all those who aren’t faithful to you.

28.verse: But I am close to you. And that’s good. LORD and King, I have made you my place of safety. I will talk about everything you have done.

1.verse: A maskil of Asaph. God, why have you turned your back on us for so long? Why are you so angry with us? We are your very own sheep.

2.verse: Remember the nation that you chose as your own so long ago. Remember that you set us free from slavery to be your very own people. Remember Mount Zion, where you lived.

3.verse: Walk through this place that has been torn down beyond repair. See how completely your enemies have destroyed the temple!

4.verse: In the place where you used to meet with us, your enemies have shouted, “We’ve won the battle!” They have set up their flags to show they have beaten us.

5.verse: They acted like people cutting down a forest with axes.

6.verse: They smashed all the beautiful wooden walls with their axes and hatchets.

7.verse: They burned your temple to the ground. They polluted the place where your Name is.

8.verse: They had said in their hearts, “We will crush them completely!” They burned every place where you were worshiped in the land.

9.verse: We don’t get signs from God anymore. There aren’t any prophets left. None of us knows how long that will last.

10.verse: God, how long will your enemies make fun of you? Will they attack you with their words forever?

11.verse: Why don’t you help us? Why do you hold back your power? Use your strong power to destroy your enemies!

12.verse: God, you have been my king for a long time. You are the only God who can save anyone on earth.

13.verse: You parted the waters of the Red Sea by your power. You broke the heads of that sea monster in Egypt.

14.verse: You crushed the heads of the sea monster Leviathan. You fed it to the creatures of the desert.

15.verse: You opened up streams and springs. You dried up rivers that flow all year long.

16.verse: You rule over the day and the night. You created the sun and the moon.

17.verse: You decided where the borders of the earth would be. You made both summer and winter.

18.verse: LORD, remember how your enemies have made fun of you. Remember how foolish people have attacked you with their words.

19.verse: Don’t hand over Israel, your dove, to those wild animals. Don’t forget your suffering people forever.

20.verse: Honor the covenant you made with us. Horrible things are happening in every dark corner of the land.

21.verse: Don’t let your suffering people be put to shame. May those who are poor and needy praise you.

22.verse: God, rise up. Stand up for your cause. Remember how foolish people make fun of you all day long.

23.verse: Pay close attention to the shouts of your enemies. The trouble they cause never stops.

1.verse: For the director of music. A psalm of Asaph. A song to the tune of “Do Not Destroy.” God, we praise you. We praise you because you are near to us. People talk about the wonderful things you have done.

2.verse: You say, “I choose the appointed time to judge people. And I judge them fairly.

3.verse: When the earth and all its people tremble, I keep everything from falling to pieces.

4.verse: To the proud I say, ‘Don’t brag anymore.’ To sinners I say, ‘Don’t show off your power.

5.verse: Don’t show it off against me. Don’t talk back to me.’ ”

6.verse: No one from east or west or north or south can judge themselves.

7.verse: God is the one who judges. He says to one person, “You are guilty.” To another he says, “You are not guilty.”

8.verse: In the hand of the LORD is a cup. It is full of wine mixed with spices. It is the wine of his anger. He pours it out. All the evil people on earth drink it down to the very last drop.

9.verse: I will speak about this forever. I will sing praise to the God of Jacob.

10.verse: God says, “I will destroy the power of all sinful people. But I will make godly people more powerful.”

1.verse: For the director of music. A psalm of Asaph. A song to be played on stringed instruments. In the land of Judah, God is well known. In Israel, his name is great.

2.verse: His tent is in Jerusalem. The place where he lives is on Mount Zion.

3.verse: There he broke the deadly arrows of his enemies. He broke their shields and swords. He broke their weapons of war.

4.verse: God, you shine like a very bright light. You are more majestic than mountains full of wild animals.

5.verse: Brave soldiers have been robbed of everything they had. Now they lie there, sleeping in death. Not one of them can even lift his hands.

6.verse: God of Jacob, at your command both horse and chariot lie still.

7.verse: People should have respect for you alone. Who can stand in front of you when you are angry?

8.verse: From heaven you handed down your sentence. The land was afraid and became quiet.

9.verse: God, that happened when you rose up to judge. It happened when you came to save all your suffering people in the land.

10.verse: Your anger against sinners brings you praise. Those who live through your anger gather to worship you.

11.verse: Make promises to the LORD your God and keep them. Let all the neighboring nations bring gifts to the God who should be respected.

12.verse: He breaks the proud spirit of rulers. The kings of the earth have respect for him.

1.verse: For the director of music. For Jeduthun. A psalm of Asaph. I cried out to God for help. I cried out to God to hear me.

2.verse: When I was in trouble, I looked to the Lord for help. During the night I lifted up my hands in prayer. But I refused to be comforted.

3.verse: God, I remembered you, and I groaned. I thought about you, and I became weak.

4.verse: You kept me from going to sleep. I was so troubled I couldn’t speak.

5.verse: I thought about days gone by. I thought about the years of long ago.

6.verse: I remembered how I used to sing praise to you in the night. I thought about it, and here is what I asked myself.

7.verse: “Will the Lord turn away from us forever? Won’t he ever show us his kindness again?

8.verse: Has his faithful love disappeared forever? Has his promise failed for all time?

9.verse: Has God forgotten to help us? Has he held back his tender love because he was angry?”

10.verse: Then I thought, “Here is what gives me hope. For many years the Most High God showed how powerful he is.

11.verse: LORD, I will remember what you did. Yes, I will remember your miracles of long ago.

12.verse: I will spend time thinking about everything you have done. I will consider all your mighty acts.”

13.verse: God, everything you do is holy. What god is as great as our God?

14.verse: You are the God who does miracles. You show your power among the nations.

15.verse: With your mighty arm you set your people free. You set the children of Jacob and Joseph free.

16.verse: God, the water of the Red Sea saw you. It saw you and boiled up. The deepest waters were stirred up.

17.verse: The clouds poured down rain. The skies rumbled with thunder. Lightning flashed back and forth like arrows.

18.verse: Your thunder was heard in the windstorm. Your lightning lit up the world. The earth trembled and shook.

19.verse: Your path led through the Red Sea. You walked through the mighty waters. But your footprints were not seen.

20.verse: You led your people like a flock. You led them by the hands of Moses and Aaron.

1.verse: A maskil of Asaph. My people, listen to my teaching. Pay attention to what I say.

2.verse: I will open my mouth and tell a story. I will speak about things that were hidden. They happened a long time ago.

3.verse: We have heard about them and we know them. Our people who lived before us have told us about them.

4.verse: We won’t hide them from our children. We will tell them to those who live after us. We will tell them what the LORD has done that is worthy of praise. We will talk about his power and the wonderful things he has done.

5.verse: He gave laws to the people of Jacob. He gave Israel their law. He commanded our people who lived before us to teach his laws to their children.

6.verse: Then those born later would know his laws. Even their children yet to come would know them. And they in turn would tell their children.

7.verse: Then they would put their trust in God. They would not forget what he had done. They would obey his commands.

8.verse: They would not be like their people who lived long ago. Those people were stubborn. They refused to obey God. They turned away from him. Their spirits were not faithful to him.

9.verse: The soldiers of Ephraim were armed with bows. But they ran away on the day of battle.

10.verse: They didn’t keep the covenant God had made with them. They refused to live by his law.

11.verse: They forgot what he had done. They didn’t remember the wonders he had shown them.

12.verse: He did miracles right in front of their people who lived long ago. At that time they were living in Egypt, in the area of Zoan.

13.verse: God parted the Red Sea and led them through it. He made the water stand up like a wall.

14.verse: He guided them with the cloud during the day. He led them with the light of a fire all night long.

15.verse: He broke the rocks open in the desert. He gave them as much water as there is in the oceans.

16.verse: He brought streams out of a rocky cliff. He made water flow down like rivers.

17.verse: But they continued to sin against him. In the desert they refused to obey the Most High God.

18.verse: They were stubborn and tested God. They ordered him to give them the food they wanted.

19.verse: They spoke against God. They said, “Can God really put food on a table in the desert?

20.verse: It is true that he struck the rock, and streams of water poured out. Huge amounts of water flowed down. But can he also give us bread? Can he supply meat for his people?”

21.verse: When the LORD heard what they said, he was very angry. His anger broke out like fire against the people of Jacob. He became very angry with Israel.

22.verse: That was because they didn’t believe in God. They didn’t trust in his power to save them.

23.verse: But he gave a command to the skies above. He opened the doors of the heavens.

24.verse: He rained down manna for the people to eat. He gave them the grain of heaven.

25.verse: Mere human beings ate the bread of angels. He sent them all the food they could eat.

26.verse: He made the east wind blow from the heavens. By his power he caused the south wind to blow.

27.verse: He rained down meat on them like dust. He sent them birds like sand on the seashore.

28.verse: He made the birds come down inside their camp. The birds fell all around their tents.

29.verse: People ate until they couldn’t eat any more. He gave them what they had wanted.

30.verse: But even before they had finished eating, God acted. He did it while the food was still in their mouths.

31.verse: His anger rose up against them. He put to death the strongest among them. He struck down Israel’s young men.

32.verse: But even after all that, they kept on sinning. Even after the wonderful things he had done, they still didn’t believe.

33.verse: So he brought their days to an end like a puff of smoke. He ended their years with terror.

34.verse: Every time God killed some of them, the others would seek him. They gladly turned back to him again.

35.verse: They remembered that God was their Rock. They remembered that God Most High had set them free.

36.verse: But they didn’t mean it when they praised him. They lied to him when they spoke.

37.verse: They turned away from him. They weren’t faithful to the covenant he had made with them.

38.verse: But he was full of tender love. He forgave their sins and didn’t destroy his people. Time after time he held back his anger. He didn’t let all his burning anger blaze out.

39.verse: He remembered that they were only human. He remembered they were only a breath of air that drifts by and doesn’t return.

40.verse: How often they refused to obey him in the desert! How often they caused him sorrow in that dry and empty land!

41.verse: Again and again they tested God. They made the Holy One of Israel sad and angry.

42.verse: They didn’t remember his power. They forgot the day he set them free from those who had treated them so badly.

43.verse: They forgot how he had shown them his signs in Egypt. They forgot his miracles in the area of Zoan.

44.verse: He turned the river of Egypt into blood. The people of Egypt couldn’t drink water from their streams.

45.verse: He sent large numbers of flies that bit them. He sent frogs that destroyed their land.

46.verse: He gave their crops to the grasshoppers. He gave their food to the locusts.

47.verse: He destroyed their vines with hail. He destroyed their fig trees with sleet.

48.verse: He killed their cattle with hail. Their livestock were struck by lightning.

49.verse: Because he was so angry with Egypt, he caused them to have great trouble. In his great anger he sent destroying angels against them.

50.verse: God prepared a path for his anger. He didn’t spare their lives. He gave them over to the plague.

51.verse: He killed the oldest son of each family in Egypt. He struck down the oldest son in every house in the land of Ham.

52.verse: But he brought his people out like a flock. He led them like sheep through the desert.

53.verse: He guided them safely, and they weren’t afraid. But the Red Sea swallowed up their enemies.

54.verse: And so he brought his people to the border of his holy land. He led them to the central hill country he had taken by his power.

55.verse: He drove out the nations to make room for his people. He gave to each family a piece of land to pass on to their children. He gave the tribes of Israel a place to make their homes.

56.verse: But they tested God. They refused to obey the Most High God. They didn’t keep his laws.

57.verse: They were like their people who lived long ago. They turned away from him and were not faithful. They were like a bow that doesn’t shoot straight. They couldn’t be trusted.

58.verse: They made God angry by going to their high places. They made him jealous by worshiping the statues of their gods.

59.verse: When God saw what the people were doing, he was very angry. He turned away from them completely.

60.verse: He deserted the holy tent at Shiloh. He left the tent he had set up among his people.

61.verse: He allowed the ark to be captured. Into the hands of his enemies he sent the ark where his glory rested.

62.verse: He let his people be killed by swords. He was very angry with them.

63.verse: Fire destroyed their young men. Their young women had no one to marry.

64.verse: Their priests were killed by swords. Their widows weren’t able to weep.

65.verse: Then the Lord woke up as if he had been sleeping. He was like a warrior waking up from the deep sleep caused by wine.

66.verse: He drove back his enemies. He put them to shame that will last forever.

67.verse: He turned his back on the tents of the people of Joseph. He didn’t choose to live in the tribe of Ephraim.

68.verse: Instead, he chose to live in the tribe of Judah. He chose Mount Zion, which he loved.

69.verse: There he built his holy place as secure as the heavens. He built it to last forever, like the earth.

70.verse: He chose his servant David. He took him from the sheep pens.

71.verse: He brought him from tending sheep to be the shepherd of his people Jacob. He made him the shepherd of Israel, his special people.

72.verse: David cared for them with a faithful and honest heart. With skilled hands he led them.

1.verse: A psalm of Asaph. God, an army from the nations has attacked your land. They have polluted your holy temple. They have completely destroyed Jerusalem.

2.verse: They have left the dead bodies of your people. They have left them as food for the birds in the sky. They have left the bodies of your faithful people. They have left them for the wild animals.

3.verse: They have poured out the blood of your people like water. It is all around Jerusalem. No one is left to bury the dead.

4.verse: We are something our neighbors joke about. The nations around us laugh at us and make fun of us.

5.verse: LORD, how long will you be angry with us? Will it be forever? How long will your jealousy burn like fire?

6.verse: Bring your great anger against the nations that don’t pay any attention to you. Bring it against the kingdoms that don’t worship you.

7.verse: They have swallowed up the people of Jacob. They have destroyed Israel’s homeland.

8.verse: Don’t hold against us the sins of our people who lived before us. May you be quick to show us your tender love. We are in great need.

9.verse: God our Savior, help us. Then glory will come to you. Save us and forgive our sins. Then people will honor your name.

10.verse: Why should the nations say, “Where is their God?” Show the nations that you punish those who kill your people. We want to see it happen.

11.verse: Listen to the groans of the prisoners. Use your strong arm to save people sentenced to death.

12.verse: Lord, our neighbors have laughed at you. Pay them back seven times for what they have done.

13.verse: We are your people, your very own sheep. We will praise you forever. For all time to come we will keep on praising you.

1.verse: For the director of music. A psalm of Asaph to the tune of “The Lilies of the Covenant.” Shepherd of Israel, hear us. You lead the people of Joseph like a flock. You sit on your throne between the cherubim. Show your glory

2.verse: to the people of Ephraim, Benjamin and Manasseh. Call your strength into action. Come and save us.

3.verse: God, make us new again. May you be pleased with us. Then we will be saved.

4.verse: LORD God, you rule over all. How long will you be angry? Will you be angry with your people even when they pray to you?

5.verse: You have given us tears as our food. You have made us drink tears by the bowlful.

6.verse: You have let our neighbors mock us. Our enemies laugh at us.

7.verse: God who rules over all, make us new again. May you be pleased with us. Then we will be saved.

8.verse: You brought Israel out of Egypt. Israel was like a vine. After you drove the nations out of Canaan, you planted the vine in their land.

9.verse: You prepared the ground for it. It took root and spread out over the whole land.

10.verse: The mountains were covered with its shade. The shade of its branches covered the mighty cedar trees.

11.verse: Your vine sent its branches out all the way to the Mediterranean Sea. They reached as far as the Euphrates River.

12.verse: Why have you broken down the walls around your vine? Now all who pass by it can pick its grapes.

13.verse: Wild pigs from the forest destroy it. Insects from the fields feed on it.

14.verse: God who rules over all, return to us! Look down from heaven and see us! Watch over your vine.

15.verse: Guard the root you have planted with your powerful right hand. Take care of the branch you have raised up for yourself.

16.verse: Your vine has been cut down and burned in the fire. You have been angry with us, and we are dying.

17.verse: May you honor the people at your right hand. May you honor the nation you have raised up for yourself.

18.verse: Then we won’t turn away from you. Give us new life. We will worship you.

19.verse: LORD God who rules over all, make us new again. May you be pleased with us. Then we will be saved.

1.verse: For the director of music. According to gittith. A psalm of Asaph. Sing joyfully to God! He gives us strength. Give a loud shout to the God of Jacob!

2.verse: Let the music begin. Play the tambourines. Play sweet music on harps and lyres.

3.verse: Blow the ram’s horn on the day of the New Moon feast. Blow it again when the moon is full and the Feast of Booths begins.

4.verse: This is an order given to Israel. It is a law of the God of Jacob.

5.verse: He gave it as a covenant law for the people of Joseph. It was given when God went out to punish Egypt. There I heard a voice I didn’t recognize.

6.verse: The voice said, “I removed the load from your shoulders. I set your hands free from carrying heavy baskets.

7.verse: You called out when you were in trouble, and I saved you. I answered you out of a thundercloud. I tested you at the waters of Meribah.

8.verse: “My people, listen and I will warn you. Israel, I wish you would listen to me!

9.verse: Don’t have anything to do with the gods of other nations. Don’t bow down and worship any god other than me.

10.verse: I am the LORD your God. I brought you up out of Egypt. Open your mouth wide, and I will fill it with good things.

11.verse: “But my people wouldn’t listen to me. Israel wouldn’t obey me.

12.verse: So I let them go their own stubborn way. I let them follow their own sinful plans.

13.verse: “I wish my people would listen to me! I wish Israel would live as I want them to live!

14.verse: Then I would quickly bring their enemies under control. I would use my power against their attackers.

15.verse: Those who hate me would bow down to me in fear. They would be punished forever.

16.verse: But you would be fed with the finest wheat. I would satisfy you with the sweetest honey.”

1.verse: A psalm of Asaph. God takes his place at the head of a large gathering of leaders. He announces his decisions among them.

2.verse: He says, “How long will you stand up for those who aren’t fair to others? How long will you show mercy to sinful people?

3.verse: Stand up for the weak and for children whose fathers have died. Protect the rights of people who are poor or treated badly.

4.verse: Save those who are weak and needy. Save them from the power of sinful people.

5.verse: “You leaders don’t know anything. You don’t understand anything. You are in the dark about what is right. Law and order have been destroyed all over the world.

6.verse: “I said, ‘You leaders are like gods. You are all children of the Most High God.’

7.verse: But you will die, like mere human beings. You will die like every other leader.”

8.verse: God, rise up. Judge the earth. All the nations belong to you.

1.verse: A song. A psalm of Asaph. God, don’t remain silent. Don’t refuse to listen. Do something, God.

2.verse: See how your enemies are growling like dogs. See how they are rising up against you.

3.verse: They make clever plans against your people. They make evil plans against those you love.

4.verse: “Come,” they say. “Let’s destroy that whole nation. Then the name of Israel won’t be remembered anymore.”

5.verse: All of them agree on the evil plans they have made. They join forces against you.

6.verse: Their forces include the people of Edom, Ishmael, Moab and Hagar.

7.verse: They also include the people of Byblos, Ammon, Amalek, Philistia and Tyre.

8.verse: Even Assyria has joined them to give strength to the people of Moab and Ammon.

9.verse: Do to them what you did to the people of Midian. Do to them what you did to Sisera and Jabin at the Kishon River.

10.verse: Sisera and Jabin died near the town of Endor. Their bodies were left on the ground like human waste.

11.verse: Do to the nobles of your enemies what you did to Oreb and Zeeb. Do to all their princes what you did to Zebah and Zalmunna.

12.verse: They said, “Let’s take over the grasslands that belong to God.”

13.verse: My God, make them like straw that the wind blows away. Make them like tumbleweed.

14.verse: Destroy them as fire burns up a forest. Destroy them as a flame sets mountains on fire.

15.verse: Chase them with your mighty winds. Terrify them with your storm.

16.verse: LORD, put them to shame so that they will seek you.

17.verse: May they always be filled with terror and shame. May they die in dishonor.

18.verse: May you, the LORD, let your enemies know who you are. You alone are the Most High God over the whole earth.

1.verse: For the director of music. According to gittith. A psalm of the Sons of Korah. LORD who rules over all, how lovely is the place where you live!

2.verse: I can’t wait to be in the courtyards of the LORD’s temple. I really want to be there. My whole being cries out for the living God.

3.verse: LORD who rules over all, even the sparrow has found a home near your altar. My King and my God, the swallow also has a nest there, where she may have her young.

4.verse: Blessed are those who live in your house. They are always praising you.

5.verse: Blessed are those whose strength comes from you. They have firmly decided to travel to your temple.

6.verse: As they pass through the dry Valley of Baka, they make it a place where water flows. The rain in the fall covers it with pools.

7.verse: Those people get stronger as they go along, until each of them appears in Zion, where God lives.

8.verse: LORD God who rules over all, hear my prayer. God of the people of Jacob, listen to me.

9.verse: God, may you be pleased with your anointed king. You appointed him to be like a shield that keeps us safe.

10.verse: A single day in your courtyards is better than a thousand anywhere else. I would rather guard the door of the house of my God than live in the tents of sinful people.

11.verse: The LORD God is like the sun that gives us light. He is like a shield that keeps us safe. The LORD blesses us with favor and honor. He doesn’t hold back anything good from those whose lives are without blame.

12.verse: LORD who rules over all, blessed is the person who trusts in you.

1.verse: For the director of music. A psalm of the Sons of Korah. LORD, you were good to your land. You blessed the people of Jacob with great success again.

2.verse: You forgave the evil things your people did. You took away all their sins.

3.verse: You stopped being angry with them. You turned your great anger away from them.

4.verse: God our Savior, make us new again. Stop being unhappy with us.

5.verse: Will you be angry with us forever? Will you be angry for all time to come?

6.verse: Won’t you give us new life again? Then we’ll be joyful because of what you have done.

7.verse: LORD, show us your faithful love. Save us.

8.verse: I will listen to what God the LORD says. He promises peace to his faithful people. But they must not turn to foolish ways.

9.verse: I know he’s ready to save those who have respect for him. Then his glory can be seen in our land.

10.verse: God’s truth and faithful love join together. His peace and holiness kiss each other.

11.verse: His truth springs up from the earth. His holiness looks down from heaven.

12.verse: The LORD will certainly give what is good. Our land will produce its crops.

13.verse: God’s holiness leads the way in front of him. It prepares the way for his coming.

1.verse: A prayer of David. LORD, hear me and answer me. I am poor and needy.

2.verse: Keep my life safe, because I am faithful to you. Save me, because I trust in you. You are my God.

3.verse: Lord, have mercy on me. I call out to you all day long.

4.verse: Bring joy to me. Lord, I put my trust in you.

5.verse: Lord, you are forgiving and good. You are full of love for all who call out to you.

6.verse: LORD, hear my prayer. Listen to my cry for mercy.

7.verse: When I’m in trouble, I will call out to you. And you will answer me.

8.verse: Lord, there’s no one like you among the gods. No one can do what you do.

9.verse: Lord, all the nations you have made will come and worship you. They will bring glory to you.

10.verse: You are great. You do wonderful things. You alone are God.

11.verse: LORD, teach me how you want me to live. Do this so that I will depend on you, my faithful God. Give me a heart that doesn’t want anything more than to worship you.

12.verse: Lord my God, I will praise you with all my heart. I will bring glory to you forever.

13.verse: Great is your love for me. You have kept me from going down into the place of the dead.

14.verse: God, proud people are attacking me. A gang of mean people is trying to kill me. They don’t care about you.

15.verse: But Lord, you are a God who is tender and kind. You are gracious. You are slow to get angry. You are faithful and full of love.

16.verse: Come to my aid and have mercy on me. Show your strength by helping me. Save me because I serve you just as my mother did.

17.verse: Prove your goodness to me. Then my enemies will see it and be put to shame. LORD, you have helped me and given me comfort.

1.verse: A psalm of the Sons of Korah. A song. The LORD has built his city on the holy mountain.

2.verse: He loves the city of Zion more than all the other places where the people of Jacob live.

3.verse: City of God, the LORD says glorious things about you.

4.verse: He says, “I will include Egypt and Babylon in a list of nations who recognize me as king. I will also include Philistia and Tyre, along with Cush. I will say about them, ‘They were born in Zion.’ ”

5.verse: Certainly it will be said about Zion, “This nation and that nation were born in it. The Most High God himself will make it secure.”

6.verse: Here is what the LORD will write in his list of the nations. “Each of them was born in Zion.”

7.verse: As they make music they will sing, “Zion, all our blessings come from you.”

1.verse: For the director of music. According to mahalath leannoth. A song. A psalm of the Sons of Korah. A maskil of Heman the Ezrahite. LORD, you are the God who saves me. Day and night I cry out to you.

2.verse: Please hear my prayer. Pay attention to my cry for help.

3.verse: I have so many troubles I’m about to die.

4.verse: People think my life is over. I’m like someone who doesn’t have any strength.

5.verse: People treat me as if I were dead. I’m like those who have been killed and are now in the grave. You don’t even remember them anymore. They are cut off from your care.

6.verse: It’s as if you have put me deep down in the grave. It’s as if you have put me in that deep, dark place.

7.verse: Your great anger lies heavy on me. All the waves of your anger have crashed over me.

8.verse: You have taken my closest friends away from me. You have made me sickening to them. I feel trapped and can’t escape.

9.verse: I’m crying so much I can’t see very well. LORD, I call out to you every day. I lift up my hands to you in prayer.

10.verse: Do you do wonderful things for those who are dead? Do their spirits rise up and praise you?

11.verse: Do those who are dead speak about your love? Do those who are in the grave tell how faithful you are?

12.verse: Are your wonderful deeds known in that dark place? Are your holy acts known in that land where the dead are forgotten?

13.verse: LORD, I cry out to you for help. In the morning I pray to you.
