14.verse: LORD, why do you say no to me? Why do you turn your face away from me?

15.verse: I’ve been in pain ever since I was young. I’ve been close to death. You have made me suffer terrible things. I have lost all hope.

16.verse: Your great anger has swept over me. Your terrors have destroyed me.

17.verse: All day long they surround me like a flood. They have closed in all around me.

18.verse: You have taken my friends and neighbors away from me. Darkness is my closest friend.

1.verse: A maskil of Ethan the Ezrahite. LORD, I will sing about your great love forever. For all time to come, I will tell how faithful you are.

2.verse: I will tell everyone that your love stands firm forever. I will tell them that you are always faithful, even in heaven itself.

3.verse: You said, “Here is the covenant I have made with my chosen one. Here is the promise I have made to my servant David.

4.verse: ‘I will make your family line continue forever. I will make your kingdom secure for all time to come.’ ”

5.verse: LORD, the heavens praise you for your wonderful deeds. When your holy angels gather together, they praise you for how faithful you are.

6.verse: Who in the skies above can compare with the LORD? Who among the angels is like the LORD?

7.verse: God is highly respected among his holy angels. He’s more wonderful than all those who are around him.

8.verse: LORD God who rules over all, who is like you? LORD, you are mighty. You are faithful in everything you do.

9.verse: You rule over the stormy sea. When its waves rise up, you calm them down.

10.verse: You crushed Egypt and killed her people. With your powerful arm you scattered your enemies.

11.verse: The heavens belong to you. The earth is yours also. You made the world and everything that is in it.

12.verse: You created everything from north to south. Mount Tabor and Mount Hermon sing to you with joy.

13.verse: Your arm is powerful. Your hand is strong. Your right hand is mighty.

14.verse: Your kingdom is built on what is right and fair. Your faithful love leads the way in front of you.

15.verse: Blessed are those who have learned to shout praise to you. LORD, they live in the light of your kindness.

16.verse: All day long they are full of joy because of who you are. They celebrate the fact that you do what is right.

17.verse: You bring them glory and give them strength. You are pleased to honor our king.

18.verse: Our king is like a shield that keeps us safe. He belongs to the LORD. He belongs to the Holy One of Israel.

19.verse: You once spoke to your faithful people in a vision. You said, “I have given strength to a soldier. I have raised up a young man from among the people.

20.verse: I have found my servant David. I have poured my sacred oil on his head.

21.verse: My powerful hand will keep him going. My mighty arm will give him strength.

22.verse: No enemy will have the victory over him. No evil person will treat him badly.

23.verse: I will crush the king’s enemies. I will completely destroy them.

24.verse: I will love him and be faithful to him. Because of me his power will increase.

25.verse: I will give him a great kingdom. It will reach from the Mediterranean Sea to the Euphrates River.

26.verse: He will call out to me, ‘You are my Father. You are my God. You are my Rock and Savior.’

27.verse: I will also make him my oldest son. Among all the kings of the earth, he will be the most important one.

28.verse: I will continue to love him forever. I will never break my covenant with him.

29.verse: I will make his family line continue forever. His kingdom will last as long as the heavens.

30.verse: “What if his sons turn away from my laws and do not follow them?

31.verse: What if they disobey my orders and fail to keep my commands?

32.verse: Then I will punish them for their sins. I will strike them with a rod. I will whip them for their evil acts.

33.verse: But I will not stop loving David. I will always be faithful to him.

34.verse: I will not break my covenant. I will not go back on my word.

35.verse: Once and for all, I have made a promise. It is based on my holiness. And I will not lie to David.

36.verse: His family line will continue forever. His kingdom will last as long as the sun.

37.verse: It will last forever like the moon, that faithful witness in the sky.”

38.verse: But you have turned your back on your anointed king. You have been very angry with him.

39.verse: You have broken the covenant you made with him. You have thrown your servant’s crown into the dirt.

40.verse: You have broken through the walls around his city. You have completely destroyed his secure places.

41.verse: All those who pass by have carried off what belonged to him. His neighbors make fun of him.

42.verse: You have made his enemies strong. You have made all of them happy.

43.verse: You have made his sword useless. You have not helped him in battle.

44.verse: You have put an end to his glory. You have knocked his throne to the ground.

45.verse: You have cut short the days of his life. You have covered him with shame.

46.verse: LORD, how long will you hide yourself? Will it be forever? How long will your anger burn like fire?

47.verse: Remember how short my life is. You have created all people for such a useless purpose!

48.verse: Who can live and not die? Who can escape the power of the grave?

49.verse: Lord, where is the great love you used to have? You faithfully promised it to David.

50.verse: Lord, remember how my enemies have made fun of me. I’ve had to put up with mean words from all the nations.

51.verse: LORD, your enemies have said mean things. They have laughed at everything your anointed king has done.

52.verse: Give praise to the LORD forever! Amen and Amen.

1.verse: BOOK IV Psalms 90–106 Psalm 90 - A prayer of Moses, the man of God. Lord, from the very beginning you have been like a home to us.

2.verse: Before you created the whole world and the mountains were made, from the beginning to the end you are God.

3.verse: You turn human beings back to dust. You say to them, “Return to dust.”

4.verse: To you a thousand years are like a day that has just gone by. They are like a few hours of the night.

5.verse: Yet you sweep people away, and they die. They are like new grass that grows in the morning.

6.verse: In the morning it springs up new, but by evening it’s all dried up.

7.verse: Your anger destroys us. Your burning anger terrifies us.

8.verse: You have put our sins right in front of you. You have placed our secret sins where you can see them clearly.

9.verse: You have been angry with us all of our days. We groan as we come to the end of our lives.

10.verse: We live to be about 70. Or we may live to be 80, if we stay healthy. But even our best days are filled with trouble and sorrow. The years quickly pass, and we are gone.

11.verse: If only we knew the power of your anger! It’s as great as the respect we should have for you.

12.verse: Teach us to realize how short our lives are. Then our hearts will become wise.

13.verse: LORD, please stop punishing us! How long will you keep it up? Be kind to us.

14.verse: Satisfy us with your faithful love every morning. Then we can sing for joy and be glad all our days.

15.verse: Make us glad for as many days as you have made us suffer. Give us joy for as many years as we’ve had trouble.

16.verse: Show us your mighty acts. Let our children see your glorious power.

17.verse: May the Lord our God always be pleased with us. Lord, make what we do succeed. Please make what we do succeed.

1.verse: Whoever rests in the shadow of the Most High God will be kept safe by the Mighty One.

2.verse: I will say about the LORD, “He is my place of safety. He is like a fort to me. He is my God. I trust in him.”

3.verse: He will certainly save you from hidden traps and from deadly sickness.

4.verse: He will cover you with his wings. Under the feathers of his wings you will find safety. He is faithful. He will keep you safe like a shield or a tower.

5.verse: You won’t have to be afraid of the terrors that come during the night. You won’t have to fear the arrows that come at you during the day.

6.verse: You won’t have to be afraid of the sickness that attacks in the darkness. You won’t have to fear the plague that destroys at noon.

7.verse: A thousand may fall dead at your side. Ten thousand may fall near your right hand. But no harm will come to you.

8.verse: You will see with your own eyes how God punishes sinful people.

9.verse: Suppose you say, “The LORD is the one who keeps me safe.” Suppose you let the Most High God be like a home to you.

10.verse: Then no harm will come to you. No terrible plague will come near your tent.

11.verse: The LORD will command his angels to take good care of you.

12.verse: They will lift you up in their hands. Then you won’t trip over a stone.

13.verse: You will walk on lions and cobras. You will crush mighty lions and poisonous snakes.

14.verse: The LORD says, “I will save the one who loves me. I will keep him safe, because he trusts in me.

15.verse: He will call out to me, and I will answer him. I will be with him in times of trouble. I will save him and honor him.

16.verse: I will give him a long and full life. I will save him.”

1.verse: A psalm. A song for the Sabbath day. LORD, it is good to praise you. Most High God, it is good to make music to honor you.

2.verse: It is good to sing every morning about your love. It is good to sing every night about how faithful you are.

3.verse: I sing about it to the music of the lyre that has ten strings. I sing about it to the music of the harp.

4.verse: LORD, you make me glad by your deeds. I sing for joy about what you have done.

5.verse: LORD, how great are the things you do! How wise your thoughts are!

6.verse: Here is something that people without sense don’t know. Here is what foolish people don’t understand.

7.verse: Those who are evil spring up like grass. Those who do wrong succeed. But they will be destroyed forever.

8.verse: But LORD, you are honored forever.

9.verse: LORD, your enemies will certainly die. All those who do evil will be scattered.

10.verse: You have made me as strong as a wild ox. You have poured the finest olive oil on me.

11.verse: I’ve seen my evil enemies destroyed. I’ve heard that they have lost the battle.

12.verse: Those who do what is right will grow like a palm tree. They will grow strong like a cedar tree in Lebanon.

13.verse: Their roots will be firm in the house of the LORD. They will grow strong and healthy in the courtyards of our God.

14.verse: When they get old, they will still bear fruit. Like young trees they will stay fresh and strong.

15.verse: They will say to everyone, “The LORD is honest. He is my Rock, and there is no evil in him.”

1.verse: The LORD rules. He puts on majesty as if it were clothes. The LORD puts on majesty and strength. Indeed, the world has been set in place. It is firm and secure.

2.verse: LORD, you began to rule a long time ago. You have always existed.

3.verse: LORD, the seas have lifted up their voice. They have lifted up their pounding waves.

4.verse: But LORD, you are more powerful than the roar of the ocean. You are stronger than the waves of the sea. LORD, you are powerful in heaven.

5.verse: Your laws do not change, LORD. Your temple will be holy for all time to come.

1.verse: The LORD is a God who punishes. Since you are the one who punishes, come and show your anger.

2.verse: Judge of the earth, rise up. Pay back proud people for what they have done.

3.verse: LORD, how long will those who are evil be glad? How long will they be full of joy?

4.verse: Proud words pour out of their mouths. All those who do evil are always bragging.

5.verse: LORD, they crush your people. They treat badly those who belong to you.

6.verse: They kill outsiders. They kill widows. They murder children whose fathers have died.

7.verse: They say, “The LORD doesn’t see what’s happening. The God of Jacob doesn’t pay any attention to it.”

8.verse: You who aren’t wise, pay attention. You foolish people, when will you become wise?

9.verse: Does he who made the ear not hear? Does he who formed the eye not see?

10.verse: Does he who corrects nations not punish? Does he who teaches human beings not know anything?

11.verse: The LORD knows what people think. He knows that their thoughts don’t amount to anything.

12.verse: LORD, blessed is the person you correct. Blessed is the person you teach from your law.

13.verse: You give them rest from times of trouble, until a pit is dug to trap sinners.

14.verse: The LORD won’t say no to his people. He will never desert those who belong to him.

15.verse: He will again judge people in keeping with what is right. All those who have honest hearts will follow the right way.

16.verse: Who will rise up for me against sinful people? Who will stand up for me against those who do evil?

17.verse: Suppose the LORD had not helped me. Then I would soon have been lying quietly in the grave.

18.verse: I said, “My foot is slipping.” But LORD, your faithful love kept me from falling.

19.verse: I was very worried. But your comfort brought me joy.

20.verse: Can you have anything to do with rulers who aren’t fair? Can those who make laws that cause suffering be friends of yours?

21.verse: Evil people join together against those who do what is right. They sentence to death those who aren’t guilty of doing anything wrong.

22.verse: But the LORD has become like a fort to me. My God is my rock. I go to him for safety.

23.verse: He will pay them back for their sins. He will destroy them for their evil acts. The LORD our God will destroy them.

1.verse: Come, let us sing for joy to the LORD. Let us give a loud shout to the Rock who saves us.

2.verse: Let us come to him and give him thanks. Let us praise him with music and song.

3.verse: The LORD is the great God. He is the greatest King. He rules over all the gods.

4.verse: He owns the deepest parts of the earth. The mountain peaks belong to him.

5.verse: The ocean is his, because he made it. He formed the dry land with his hands.

6.verse: Come, let us bow down and worship him. Let us fall on our knees in front of the LORD our Maker.

7.verse: He is our God. We are the sheep belonging to his flock. We are the people he takes good care of. If only you would listen to his voice today.

8.verse: He says, “Don’t be stubborn as you were at Meribah. Don’t be stubborn as you were that day at Massah in the desert.

9.verse: There your people of long ago really tested me. They did it even though they had seen what I had done for them.

10.verse: For 40 years I was angry with them. I said, ‘Their hearts are always going astray. They do not know how I want them to live.’

11.verse: So when I was angry, I made a promise. I said, ‘They will never enjoy the rest I planned for them.’ ”

1.verse: Sing a new song to the LORD. All you people of the earth, sing to the LORD.

2.verse: Sing to the LORD. Praise him. Day after day tell about how he saves us.

3.verse: Tell the nations about his glory. Tell all people about the wonderful things he has done.

4.verse: The LORD is great. He is really worthy of praise. People should have respect for him as the greatest God of all.

5.verse: All the gods of the nations are like their statues. They can’t do anything. But the LORD made the heavens.

6.verse: Glory and majesty are all around him. Strength and glory can be seen in his temple.

7.verse: Praise the LORD, all you nations. Praise the LORD for his glory and strength.

8.verse: Praise the LORD for the glory that belongs to him. Bring an offering and come into the courtyards of his temple.

9.verse: Worship the LORD because of his beauty and holiness. All you people of the earth, tremble when you are with him.

10.verse: Say to the nations, “The LORD rules.” The world is firmly set in place. It can’t be moved. The LORD will judge the people of the world fairly.

11.verse: Let the heavens be full of joy. Let the earth be glad. Let the ocean and everything in it roar.

12.verse: Let the fields and everything in them be glad. Let all the trees in the forest sing for joy.

13.verse: Let all creation be full of joy in front of the LORD, because he is coming to judge the earth. He will faithfully judge the people of the world in keeping with what is right.

1.verse: The LORD rules. Let the earth be glad. Let countries that are far away be full of joy.

2.verse: Clouds and thick darkness surround him. His rule is built on what is right and fair.

3.verse: The LORD sends fire ahead of him. It burns up his enemies all around him.

4.verse: His lightning lights up the world. The earth sees it and trembles.

5.verse: The mountains melt like wax when the LORD is near. He is the Lord of the whole earth.

6.verse: The heavens announce that what he does is right. All people everywhere see his glory.

7.verse: All who worship statues of gods or brag about them are put to shame. All you gods, worship the LORD!

8.verse: Zion hears about it and is filled with joy. LORD, the villages of Judah are glad because of how you judge.

9.verse: LORD, you are the Most High God. You rule over the whole earth. You are honored much more than all gods.

10.verse: Let those who love the LORD hate evil. He guards the lives of those who are faithful to him. He saves them from the power of sinful people.

11.verse: Good things come to those who do what is right. Joy comes to those whose hearts are honest.

12.verse: You who are godly, be glad because of what the LORD has done. Praise him, because his name is holy.

1.verse: A psalm. Sing a new song to the LORD. He has done wonderful things. By the power of his right hand and his holy arm he has saved his people.

2.verse: The LORD has made known his power to save. He has shown the nations that he does what is right.

3.verse: He has shown his faithful love to the people of Israel. People from one end of the earth to the other have seen that our God has saved us.

4.verse: Shout for joy to the LORD, everyone on earth. Burst into joyful songs and make music.

5.verse: Make music to the LORD with the harp. Sing and make music with the harp.

6.verse: Blow the trumpets. Give a blast on the ram’s horn. Shout for joy to the LORD. He is the King.

7.verse: Let the ocean and everything in it roar. Let the world and all who live in it shout.

8.verse: Let the rivers clap their hands. Let the mountains sing together with joy.

9.verse: Let them sing to the LORD, because he is coming to judge the earth. He will judge the nations of the world in keeping with what is right and fair.

1.verse: The LORD rules. Let the nations tremble. He sits on his throne between the cherubim. Let the earth shake.

2.verse: Great is the LORD in Zion. He is honored over all the nations.

3.verse: Let them praise his great and wonderful name. He is holy.

4.verse: The King is mighty and loves justice. He has set up the rules for fairness. He has done what is right and fair for the people of Jacob.

5.verse: Honor the LORD our God. Worship at his feet. He is holy.

6.verse: Moses and Aaron were two of his priests. Samuel was one of those who worshiped him. They called out to the LORD. And he answered them.

7.verse: He spoke to them from the pillar of cloud. They obeyed his laws and the orders he gave them.

8.verse: LORD our God, you answered them. You showed Israel that you are a God who forgives. But when they did wrong, you punished them.

9.verse: Honor the LORD our God. Worship at his holy mountain. The LORD our God is holy.

1.verse: A psalm for giving grateful praise. Shout for joy to the LORD, everyone on earth.

2.verse: Worship the LORD with gladness. Come to him with songs of joy.

3.verse: Know that the LORD is God. He made us, and we belong to him. We are his people. We are the sheep belonging to his flock.

4.verse: Give thanks as you enter the gates of his temple. Give praise as you enter its courtyards. Give thanks to him and praise his name.

5.verse: The LORD is good. His faithful love continues forever. It will last for all time to come.

1.verse: A psalm of David. I will sing about your love and fairness. LORD, I will sing praise to you.

2.verse: I will be careful to lead a life that is without blame. When will you come and help me? In my own home I will lead a life that is without blame.

3.verse: I won’t look at anything that is evil and call it good. I hate the acts of people who aren’t faithful to you. I won’t have anything to do with those things.

4.verse: I will stay away from those whose hearts are twisted. I won’t have anything to do with what is evil.

5.verse: I will get rid of anyone who tells lies about their neighbor in secret. I won’t put up with anyone whose eyes and heart are proud.

6.verse: I will look with favor on the faithful people in the land. They will live with me. Those whose lives are without blame will serve me.

7.verse: No one who lies and cheats will live in my house. No one who tells lies will serve me.

8.verse: Every morning I will get rid of all the sinful people in the land. I will remove from the city of the LORD everyone who does what is evil.

1.verse: A prayer of a suffering person who has become weak. They pour out their problems to the LORD. LORD, hear my prayer. Listen to my cry for help.

2.verse: Don’t turn your face away from me when I’m in trouble. Pay attention to me. When I call out for help, answer me quickly.

3.verse: My days are disappearing like smoke. My body burns like glowing coals.

4.verse: My strength has dried up like grass. I even forget to eat my food.

5.verse: I groan out loud because of my suffering. I’m nothing but skin and bones.

6.verse: I’m like a desert owl. I’m like an owl among destroyed buildings.

7.verse: I can’t sleep. I’ve become like a bird alone on a roof.

8.verse: All day long my enemies laugh at me. Those who make fun of me use my name as a curse.

9.verse: I eat ashes as my food. My tears fall into what I’m drinking.

10.verse: You were very angry with me. So you picked me up and threw me away.

11.verse: The days of my life are like an evening shadow. I dry up like grass.

12.verse: But LORD, you are seated on your throne forever. Your fame will continue for all time to come.

13.verse: You will rise up and show deep concern for Zion. The time has come for you to help Zion.

14.verse: The stones of your destroyed city are priceless to us. Even its dust brings deep concern to us.

15.verse: The nations will worship the LORD. All the kings on earth will respect his glorious power.

16.verse: The LORD will build Zion again. He will appear in his glory.

17.verse: He will answer the prayer of those who don’t have anything. He won’t say no to their cry for help.

18.verse: Let this be written down for those born after us. Then people who are not yet born can praise the LORD.

19.verse: Here is what should be written. “The LORD looked down from his temple in heaven. From heaven he viewed the earth.

20.verse: He heard the groans of the prisoners. He set free those who were sentenced to death.”

21.verse: So people will talk about him in Zion. They will praise him in Jerusalem.

22.verse: Nations and kingdoms will gather there to worship the LORD.

23.verse: When I was still young, he took away my strength. He wasn’t going to let me live much longer.

24.verse: So I said, “My God, don’t let me die in the middle of my life. You will live for all time to come.

25.verse: In the beginning you made the earth secure. You placed it on its foundations. Your hands created the heavens.

26.verse: They will pass away. But you will remain. They will all wear out like a piece of clothing. You will make them like clothes that are taken off and thrown away.

27.verse: But you remain the same. Your years will never end.

28.verse: Our children will live with you. Their sons and daughters will be safe in your care.”

1.verse: A psalm of David. I will praise the LORD. Deep down inside me, I will praise him. I will praise him, because his name is holy.

2.verse: I will praise the LORD. I won’t forget anything he does for me.

3.verse: He forgives all my sins. He heals all my sicknesses.

4.verse: He saves my life from going down into the grave. His faithful and tender love makes me feel like a king.

5.verse: He satisfies me with the good things I desire. Then I feel young and strong again, just like an eagle.

6.verse: The LORD does what is right and fair for all who are treated badly.

7.verse: He told Moses all about his plans. He let the people of Israel see his mighty acts.

8.verse: The LORD is tender and kind. He is gracious. He is slow to get angry. He is full of love.

9.verse: He won’t keep bringing charges against us. He won’t stay angry with us forever.

10.verse: He doesn’t punish us for our sins as much as we should be punished. He doesn’t pay us back in keeping with the evil things we’ve done.

11.verse: He loves those who have respect for him. His love is as high as the heavens are above the earth.

12.verse: He has removed our sins from us. He has removed them as far as the east is from the west.

13.verse: A father is tender and kind to his children. In the same way, the LORD is tender and kind to those who have respect for him.

14.verse: He knows what we are made of. He remembers that we are dust.

15.verse: The life of human beings is like grass. People grow like the flowers in the field.

16.verse: When the wind blows on them, they are gone. No one can tell that they had ever been there.

17.verse: But the LORD’s love for those who have respect for him lasts for ever and ever. Their children’s children will know that he always does what is right.

18.verse: He always loves those who keep his covenant. He always does what is right for those who remember to obey his commands.

19.verse: The LORD has set up his throne in heaven. His kingdom rules over all.

20.verse: Praise the LORD, you angels of his. Praise him, you mighty ones who carry out his orders and obey his word.

21.verse: Praise the LORD, all you angels in heaven. Praise him, all you who serve him and do what he wants.

22.verse: Let everything the LORD has made praise him everywhere in his kingdom. I will praise the LORD.

1.verse: I will praise the LORD. LORD my God, you are very great. You are dressed in glory and majesty.

2.verse: The LORD wraps himself in light as if it were a robe. He spreads out the heavens like a tent.

3.verse: He builds his palace high in the heavens. He makes the clouds serve as his chariot. He rides on the wings of the wind.

4.verse: He makes the winds serve as his messengers. He makes flashes of lightning serve him.

5.verse: He placed the earth on its foundations. It can never be moved.

6.verse: You, LORD, covered it with the oceans like a blanket. The waters covered the mountains.

7.verse: But you commanded the waters, and they ran away. At the sound of your thunder they rushed off.

8.verse: They flowed down the mountains. They went into the valleys. They went to the place you appointed for them.

9.verse: You drew a line they can’t cross. They will never cover the earth again.

10.verse: The LORD makes springs pour water into the valleys. It flows between the mountains.

11.verse: The springs give water to all the wild animals. The wild donkeys satisfy their thirst.

12.verse: The birds in the sky build nests by the waters. They sing among the branches.

13.verse: The LORD waters the mountains from his palace high in the clouds. The earth is filled with the things he has made.

14.verse: He makes grass grow for the cattle and plants for people to take care of. That’s how they get food from the earth.

15.verse: There is wine to make people glad. There is olive oil to make their skin glow. And there is bread to make them strong.

16.verse: The cedar trees of Lebanon belong to the LORD. He planted them and gave them plenty of water.

17.verse: There the birds make their nests. The stork has its home in the juniper trees.

18.verse: The high mountains belong to the wild goats. The cliffs are a safe place for the rock badgers.

19.verse: The LORD made the moon to mark off the seasons. The sun knows when to go down.

20.verse: You, LORD, bring darkness, and it becomes night. Then all the animals of the forest prowl around.

21.verse: The lions roar while they hunt. All their food comes from God.

22.verse: The sun rises, and they slip away. They return to their dens and lie down.

23.verse: Then people get up and go to work. They keep working until evening.

24.verse: LORD, you have made so many things! How wise you were when you made all of them! The earth is full of your creatures.

25.verse: Look at the ocean, so big and wide! It is filled with more creatures than people can count. It is filled with living things, from the largest to the smallest.

26.verse: Ships sail back and forth on it. Leviathan, the sea monster you made, plays in it.

27.verse: All creatures depend on you to give them their food when they need it.

28.verse: When you give it to them, they eat it. When you open your hand, they are satisfied with good things.

29.verse: When you turn your face away from them, they are terrified. When you take away their breath, they die and turn back into dust.

30.verse: When you send your Spirit, you create them. You give new life to the ground.

31.verse: May the glory of the LORD continue forever. May the LORD be happy with what he has made.

32.verse: When he looks at the earth, it trembles. When he touches the mountains, they pour out smoke.

33.verse: I will sing to the LORD all my life. I will sing praise to my God as long as I live.

34.verse: May these thoughts of mine please him. I find my joy in the LORD.

35.verse: But may sinners be gone from the earth. May evil people disappear. I will praise the LORD. Praise the LORD.

1.verse: Give praise to the LORD and announce who he is. Tell the nations what he has done.

2.verse: Sing to him, sing praise to him. Tell about all the wonderful things he has done.

3.verse: Praise him, because his name is holy. Let the hearts of those who trust in the LORD be glad.

4.verse: Seek the LORD and the strength he gives. Always seek him.

5.verse: Remember the wonderful things he has done. Remember his miracles and how he judged our enemies.

6.verse: Remember what he has done, you children of his servant Abraham. Remember it, you people of Jacob, God’s chosen ones.

7.verse: He is the LORD our God. He judges the whole earth.

8.verse: He will keep his covenant forever. He will keep his promise for all time to come.

9.verse: He will keep the covenant he made with Abraham. He will keep the promise he made to Isaac.

10.verse: He made it stand as a law for Jacob. He made it stand as a covenant for Israel that will last forever.

11.verse: He said, “I will give you the land of Canaan. It will belong to you.”

12.verse: At first there weren’t very many of God’s people. There were only a few, and they were strangers in the land.

13.verse: They wandered from nation to nation. They wandered from one kingdom to another.

14.verse: But God didn’t allow anyone to treat them badly. To keep them safe, he gave a command to kings.

15.verse: He said to them, “Do not touch my anointed ones. Do not harm my prophets.”

16.verse: He made the people in the land go hungry. He destroyed all their food supplies.

17.verse: He sent a man ahead of them into Egypt. That man was Joseph. He had been sold as a slave.

18.verse: The Egyptians put his feet in chains. They put an iron collar around his neck.

19.verse: He was in prison until what he said would happen came true. The word of the LORD proved that he was right.

20.verse: The king of Egypt sent for Joseph and let him out of prison. The ruler of many nations set him free.

21.verse: He put Joseph in charge of his palace. He made him ruler over everything he owned.

22.verse: Joseph was in charge of teaching the princes. He taught the elders how to think and live wisely.

23.verse: Then the rest of Jacob’s family went to Egypt. The people of Israel lived as outsiders in the land of Ham.

24.verse: The LORD gave his people so many children that there were too many of them for their enemies.

25.verse: He made the Egyptians hate his people. The Egyptians made evil plans against them.

26.verse: The LORD sent his servant Moses to the king of Egypt. He sent Aaron, his chosen one, along with him.

27.verse: The LORD gave them the power to do signs among the Egyptians. They did his wonders in the land of Ham.

28.verse: The LORD sent darkness over the land. He did it because the Egyptians had refused to obey his words.

29.verse: He turned their rivers and streams into blood. He caused the fish in them to die.

30.verse: Their land was covered with frogs. Frogs even went into the bedrooms of the rulers.

31.verse: The LORD spoke, and large numbers of flies came. Gnats filled the whole country.

32.verse: He turned their rain into hail. Lightning flashed all through their land.

33.verse: He destroyed their vines and fig trees. He broke down the trees in Egypt.

34.verse: He spoke, and the locusts came. There were so many of them they couldn’t be counted.

35.verse: They ate up every green thing in the land. They ate up what the land produced.

36.verse: Then he killed the oldest son of every family in Egypt. He struck down the oldest of all their sons.

37.verse: He brought the people of Israel out of Egypt. The Egyptians loaded them down with silver and gold. From among the tribes of Israel no one got tired or fell down.

38.verse: The Egyptians were glad when the people of Israel left. They were terrified because of Israel.

39.verse: The LORD spread out a cloud to cover his people. He gave them a fire to light up the night.

40.verse: They asked for meat, and he brought them quail. He fed them well with manna, the bread of heaven.

41.verse: He broke open a rock, and streams of water poured out. They flowed like a river in the desert.

42.verse: He remembered the holy promise he had made to his servant Abraham.

43.verse: His chosen people shouted for joy as he brought them out of Egypt.

44.verse: He gave them the lands of other nations. He let them take over what others had worked for.

45.verse: He did it so they might obey his rules and follow his laws. Praise the LORD.

1.verse: Praise the LORD. Give thanks to the LORD, because he is good. His faithful love continues forever.

2.verse: Who can speak enough about the mighty acts of the LORD? Who can praise him as much as he should be praised?

3.verse: Blessed are those who always do what is fair. Blessed are those who keep doing what is right.

4.verse: LORD, remember me when you bless your people. Help me when you save them.

5.verse: Then I will enjoy the good things you give your chosen ones. I will be joyful together with your people. I will join them when they praise you.

6.verse: We have sinned, just as our people of long ago did. We too have done what is evil and wrong.

7.verse: When our people were in Egypt, they forgot about the LORD’s miracles. They didn’t remember his many kind acts. At the Red Sea they refused to obey him.

8.verse: But he saved them for the honor of his name. He did it to make his mighty power known.

9.verse: He ordered the Red Sea to dry up, and it did. He led his people through it as if it were a desert.

10.verse: He saved them from the power of their enemies. He set them free from their control.

11.verse: The waters covered their enemies. Not one of them escaped alive.

12.verse: Then his people believed his promises and sang praise to him.

13.verse: But they soon forgot what he had done. They didn’t wait for what he had planned to happen.

14.verse: In the desert they longed for food. In that dry and empty land they tested God.

15.verse: So he gave them what they asked for. But he also sent a sickness that killed many of them.

16.verse: In their camp some of them became jealous of Moses and Aaron. Aaron had been set apart to serve the LORD.

17.verse: The ground opened up and swallowed Dathan. It buried Abiram and his followers.

18.verse: Fire blazed among all of them. Flames destroyed those evil people.

19.verse: At Mount Horeb they made a metal statue of a bull calf. They worshiped that statue of a god.

20.verse: They traded their glorious God for a statue of a bull that eats grass.

21.verse: They forgot the God who saved them. They forgot the God who had done great things in Egypt.

22.verse: They forgot the miracles he did in the land of Ham. They forgot the wonderful things he did by the Red Sea.

23.verse: So he said he would destroy them. But Moses, his chosen one, stood up for them. He kept God’s anger from destroying them.

24.verse: Later on, they refused to enter the pleasant land of Canaan. They didn’t believe God’s promise.

25.verse: In their tents they told the LORD how unhappy they were. They didn’t obey him.

26.verse: So he lifted up his hand and promised that he would make them die in the desert.

27.verse: He promised he would scatter their children’s children among the nations. He would make them die in other lands.

28.verse: They joined in worshiping the Baal that was worshiped at Peor. They ate food that had been offered to gods that aren’t even alive.

29.verse: Their evil ways made the LORD angry. So a plague broke out among them.

30.verse: But Phinehas stood up and took action. Then the plague stopped.

31.verse: What Phinehas did made him right with the LORD. It will be remembered for all time to come.

32.verse: By the waters of Meribah the LORD’s people made him angry. Moses got in trouble because of them.

33.verse: They refused to obey the Spirit of God. So Moses spoke without thinking.

34.verse: They didn’t destroy the nations in Canaan as the LORD had commanded them.

35.verse: Instead, they mixed with those nations and adopted their ways.

36.verse: They worshiped statues of their gods. That became a trap for them.

37.verse: They sacrificed their sons and daughters as offerings to false gods.

38.verse: They killed those who weren’t guilty of doing anything wrong. They killed their own sons and daughters. They sacrificed them as offerings to statues of the gods of Canaan. The land became “unclean” because of the blood of their children.

39.verse: The people made themselves impure by what they had done. They weren’t faithful to the LORD.

40.verse: So the LORD became angry with his people. He turned away from his own children.

41.verse: He handed them over to the nations. Their enemies ruled over them.

42.verse: Their enemies treated them badly and kept them under their power.

43.verse: Many times the LORD saved them. But they refused to obey him. So he destroyed them because of their sins.

44.verse: Yet he heard them when they cried out. He paid special attention to their suffering.

45.verse: Because they were his people, he remembered his covenant. Because of his great love, he felt sorry for them.

46.verse: He made all those who held them as prisoners have mercy on them.

47.verse: LORD our God, save us. Bring us back from among the nations. Then we will give thanks to you, because your name is holy. We will celebrate by praising you.

48.verse: Give praise to the LORD, the God of Israel, for ever and ever. Let all the people say, “Amen!” Praise the LORD.

1.verse: BOOK V Psalms 107–150 Psalm 107 - Give thanks to the LORD, because he is good. His faithful love continues forever.

2.verse: Let those who have been set free by the LORD tell their story. He set them free from the power of the enemy.

3.verse: He brought them back from other lands. He brought them back from east and west, from north and south.

4.verse: Some of them wandered in deserts that were dry and empty. They couldn’t find a city where they could make their homes.

5.verse: They were hungry and thirsty. Their lives were slipping away.

6.verse: Then they cried out to the LORD because of their problems. And he saved them from their troubles.

7.verse: He led them straight to a city where they could make their homes.

8.verse: Let them give thanks to the LORD for his faithful love. Let them give thanks for the wonderful things he does for people.

9.verse: He gives those who are thirsty all the water they want. He gives those who are hungry all the good food they can eat.

10.verse: Others lived in the deepest darkness. They suffered as prisoners in iron chains.

11.verse: That’s because they hadn’t obeyed the commands of God. They had refused to follow the plans of the Most High God.

12.verse: So he made them do work that was hard and bitter. They tripped and fell, and there was no one to help them.

13.verse: Then they cried out to the LORD because of their problems. And he saved them from their troubles.

14.verse: He brought them out of the deepest darkness. He broke their chains off.

15.verse: Let them give thanks to the LORD for his faithful love. Let them give thanks for the wonderful things he does for people.

16.verse: He breaks down gates that are made of bronze. He cuts through bars that are made of iron.

17.verse: Others were foolish. They suffered because of their sins. They suffered because they wouldn’t obey the LORD.

18.verse: They refused to eat anything. They came close to passing through the gates of death.

19.verse: Then they cried out to the LORD because of their problems. And he saved them from their troubles.

20.verse: He gave his command and healed them. He saved them from the grave.

21.verse: Let them give thanks to the LORD for his faithful love. Let them give thanks for the wonderful things he does for people.

22.verse: Let them sacrifice thank offerings. Let them talk about what he has done as they sing with joy.

23.verse: Some people sailed out on the ocean in ships. They traded goods on the mighty waters.

24.verse: They saw the works of the LORD. They saw the wonderful deeds he did on the ocean.

25.verse: He spoke and stirred up a storm. It lifted the waves high.

26.verse: They rose up to the heavens. Then they went down deep into the ocean. In that kind of danger the people’s boldness melted away.

27.verse: They were unsteady like people who have become drunk. They didn’t know what to do.

28.verse: Then they cried out to the LORD because of their problems. And he brought them out of their troubles.

29.verse: He made the storm as quiet as a whisper. The waves of the ocean calmed down.

30.verse: The people were glad when the ocean became calm. Then he guided them to the harbor they were looking for.

31.verse: Let them give thanks to the LORD for his faithful love. Let them give thanks for the wonderful things he does for people.

32.verse: Let them honor him among his people who gather for worship. Let them praise him in the meeting of the elders.

33.verse: He turned rivers into a desert. He turned flowing springs into thirsty ground.

34.verse: He turned land that produced crops into a salty land where nothing could grow. He did it because the people who lived there were evil.

35.verse: He turned the desert into pools of water. He turned the dry and cracked ground into flowing springs.

36.verse: He brought hungry people there to live. They built a city where they could make their homes.

37.verse: They planted fields and vineyards that produced large crops.

38.verse: He blessed the people, and they greatly increased their numbers. He kept their herds from getting smaller.

39.verse: Then the number of God’s people got smaller. They were made humble by trouble, suffering and sorrow.

40.verse: The God who looks down on proud nobles made them wander in a desert where no one lives.

41.verse: But he lifted needy people out of their suffering. He made their families increase like flocks of sheep.

42.verse: Honest people see it and are filled with joy. But no one who is evil has anything to say.

43.verse: Let those who are wise pay attention to these things. Let them think about the loving deeds of the LORD.

1.verse: A song. A psalm of David. God, my heart feels secure. I will sing and make music to you with all my heart.

2.verse: Harp and lyre, wake up! I want to sing and make music before the sun rises.

3.verse: LORD, I will praise you among the nations. I will sing about you among the people of the earth.

4.verse: Great is your love. It is higher than the heavens. Your truth reaches to the skies.

5.verse: God, may you be honored above the heavens. Let your glory be over the whole earth.

6.verse: Save us. Help us with your powerful right hand, so that those you love may be saved.

7.verse: God has spoken from his temple. He has said, “I will win the battle. Then I will divide up the land around Shechem. I will divide up the Valley of Sukkoth.

8.verse: Gilead belongs to me, and so does the land of Manasseh. Ephraim is the strongest tribe. It is like a helmet for my head. Judah is the royal tribe. It is like a ruler’s scepter.

9.verse: Moab serves me like one who washes my feet. I toss my sandal on Edom to show that I own it. I shout to Philistia that I have won the battle.”

10.verse: Who will bring me to the city that has high walls around it? Who will lead me to the land of Edom?

11.verse: God, isn’t it you, even though you have now turned away from us? Isn’t it you, even though you don’t lead our armies into battle anymore?

12.verse: Help us against our enemies. The help people give doesn’t amount to anything.

13.verse: With your help we will win the battle. You will walk all over our enemies.

1.verse: For the director of music. A psalm of David. God, I praise you. Don’t remain silent.

2.verse: Sinful people who lie and cheat have spoken against me. They have used their tongues to tell lies about me.

3.verse: They gather all around me with their words of hatred. They attack me without any reason.

4.verse: They bring charges against me, even though I love them and pray for them.

5.verse: They pay me back with evil for the good things I do. They pay back my love with hatred.

6.verse: Appoint an evil person to take my enemies to court. Let him stand at their right hand and bring charges against them.

7.verse: When they are tried, let them be found guilty. May even their prayers judge them.

8.verse: May their days be few. Let others take their places as leaders.

9.verse: May their children’s fathers die. May their wives become widows.

10.verse: May their children be driven from their destroyed homes. May they wander around like beggars.

11.verse: May everything those people own be taken away to pay for what they owe. May strangers rob them of everything they’ve worked for.

12.verse: May no one be kind to them or take pity on the children they leave behind.

13.verse: May their family line come to an end. May their names be forgotten by those who live after them.

14.verse: May the LORD remember the evil things their fathers have done. May he never erase the sins of their mothers.

15.verse: May the LORD never forget their sins. Then he won’t let people remember the names of my enemies anymore.

16.verse: They never thought about doing anything kind. Instead, they drove those who were poor and needy to their deaths. They did the same thing to those whose hearts were broken.

17.verse: They loved to curse others. May their curses come back on them. They didn’t find any pleasure in giving anyone their blessing. May no blessing ever come to them.

18.verse: They cursed others as easily as they put on clothes. Cursing was as natural to them as getting a drink of water or putting olive oil on their bodies.

19.verse: May their curses cover them like coats. May their curses be wrapped around them like a belt forever.

20.verse: May that be the LORD’s way of paying back those who bring charges against me. May it happen to those who say evil things about me.

21.verse: But LORD and King, help me so that you bring honor to yourself. Because your love is so good, save me.

22.verse: I am poor and needy. My heart is wounded deep down inside me.

23.verse: I fade away like an evening shadow. I’m like a locust that someone brushes off.

24.verse: My knees are weak because I’ve gone without food. My body is very thin.

25.verse: Those who bring charges against me laugh at me. When they see me, they shake their heads at me.

26.verse: LORD my God, help me. Save me because of your faithful love.

27.verse: LORD, let my enemies know that you yourself have saved me. You have done it with your own hand.

28.verse: They may curse me. But may you bless me. May those who attack me be put to shame. But may I be filled with joy.

29.verse: May those who bring charges against me be clothed with dishonor. May they be wrapped in shame as if it were a coat.

30.verse: With my mouth I will continually praise the LORD. I will praise him when all his people gather for worship.

31.verse: He stands ready to help those who need it. He saves them from those who are ready to sentence them to death.

1.verse: A psalm of David. The LORD says to my lord, “Sit at my right hand until I put your enemies under your control.”

2.verse: The LORD will make your royal authority spread out from Zion to other lands. He says, “Rule over your enemies who are all around you.”

3.verse: Your troops will be willing to fight for you on the day of battle. Your young men will be wrapped in holy majesty. They will come to you like the fresh dew that falls early in the morning.

4.verse: The LORD has made a promise. He will not change his mind. He has said, “You are a priest forever, just like Melchizedek.”

5.verse: The Lord is at your right hand. He will crush kings on the day when he is angry.

6.verse: He will judge the nations. He will pile up dead bodies on the field of battle. He will crush the rulers of the whole earth.

7.verse: He will drink from a brook along the way and receive new strength. And so he will win the battle.

1.verse: Praise the LORD. I will praise the LORD with all my heart. I will praise him where honest people gather for worship.

2.verse: The LORD has done great things. All who take delight in those things think deeply about them.

3.verse: What he does shows his glory and majesty. He will always do what is right.

4.verse: The LORD causes his wonders to be remembered. He is kind and tender.

5.verse: He provides food for those who have respect for him. He remembers his covenant forever.

6.verse: He has shown his people what his power can do. He has given them the lands of other nations.

7.verse: He is faithful and right in everything he does. All his rules can be trusted.

8.verse: They will stand firm for ever and ever. They were given by the LORD. He is faithful and honest.

9.verse: He set his people free. He made a covenant with them that will last forever. His name is holy and wonderful.

10.verse: If you really want to become wise, you must begin by having respect for the LORD. All those who follow his rules have good understanding. People should praise him forever.

1.verse: Praise the LORD. Blessed are those who have respect for the LORD. They find great delight when they obey God’s commands.

2.verse: Their children will be powerful in the land. Because they are honest, their children will be blessed.

3.verse: Their family will have wealth and riches. They will always be blessed for doing what is right.

4.verse: Even in the darkness light shines on honest people. It shines on those who are kind and tender and godly.

5.verse: Good things will come to those who are willing to lend freely. Good things will come to those who are fair in everything they do.

6.verse: Those who do what is right will always be secure. They will be remembered forever.

7.verse: They aren’t afraid when bad news comes. They stand firm because they trust in the LORD.

8.verse: Their hearts are secure. They aren’t afraid. In the end they will see their enemies destroyed.

9.verse: They have spread their gifts around to poor people. Their good works continue forever. They will be powerful and honored.

10.verse: Evil people will see it and be upset. They will grind their teeth and become weaker and weaker. What evil people long to do can’t succeed.

1.verse: Praise the LORD. Praise him, you who serve the LORD. Praise the name of the LORD.

2.verse: Let us praise the name of the LORD, both now and forever.

3.verse: From the sunrise in the east to the sunset in the west, may the name of the LORD be praised.

4.verse: The LORD is honored over all the nations. His glory reaches to the highest heavens.

5.verse: Who is like the LORD our God? He sits on his throne in heaven.

6.verse: He bends down to look at the heavens and the earth.

7.verse: He raises poor people up from the trash pile. He lifts needy people out of the ashes.

8.verse: He causes them to sit with princes. He causes them to sit with the princes of his people.

9.verse: He gives children to the woman who doesn’t have any children. He makes her a happy mother in her own home. Praise the LORD.

1.verse: The people of Israel came out of Egypt. The people of Jacob left a land where a different language was spoken.

2.verse: Then Judah became the holy place where God lived. Israel became the land he ruled over.

3.verse: The Red Sea saw him and parted. The Jordan River stopped flowing.

4.verse: The mountains leaped like rams. The hills skipped like lambs.

5.verse: Red Sea, why did you part? Jordan River, why did you stop flowing?

6.verse: Why did you mountains leap like rams? Why did you hills skip like lambs?

7.verse: Earth, tremble with fear when the Lord comes. Tremble when the God of Jacob is near.

8.verse: He turned the rock into a pool. He turned the hard rock into springs of water.

1.verse: LORD, may glory be given to you, not to us. You are loving and faithful.

2.verse: Why do the nations ask, “Where is their God?”

3.verse: Our God is in heaven. He does anything he wants to do.

4.verse: But the statues of their gods are made out of silver and gold. They are made by human hands.

5.verse: They have mouths but can’t speak. They have eyes but can’t see.

6.verse: They have ears but can’t hear. They have noses but can’t smell.

7.verse: They have hands but can’t feel. They have feet but can’t walk. They have throats but can’t say anything.

8.verse: Those who make statues of gods will be like them. So will all those who trust in them.

9.verse: All you Israelites, trust in the LORD. He helps you like a shield that keeps you safe.

10.verse: Priests of Aaron, trust in the LORD. He helps you like a shield that keeps you safe.

11.verse: You who have respect for the LORD, trust in him. He helps you like a shield that keeps you safe.

12.verse: The LORD remembers us and will bless us. He will bless Israel, his people. He will bless the priests of Aaron.

13.verse: The LORD will bless those who have respect for him. He will bless important and unimportant people alike.

14.verse: May the LORD give you many children. May he give them to you and to your children after you.

15.verse: May the LORD bless you. He is the Maker of heaven and earth.

16.verse: The highest heavens belong to the LORD. But he has given the earth to human beings.

17.verse: Dead people don’t praise the LORD. Those who lie quietly in the grave don’t praise him.

18.verse: But we who are alive praise the LORD, both now and forever. Praise the LORD.

1.verse: I love the LORD, because he heard my voice. He heard my cry for his help.

2.verse: Because he paid attention to me, I will call out to him as long as I live.

3.verse: The ropes of death were wrapped around me. The horrors of the grave came over me. I was overcome by sadness and sorrow.

4.verse: Then I called out to the LORD. I cried out, “LORD, save me!”

5.verse: The LORD is holy and kind. Our God is full of tender love.

6.verse: The LORD takes care of those who are not aware of danger. When I was in great need, he saved me.

7.verse: I said to myself, “Be calm. The LORD has been good to me.”

8.verse: LORD, you have saved me from death. You have dried the tears from my eyes. You have kept me from tripping and falling.

9.verse: So now I can enjoy life here with you while I’m still living.

10.verse: I trusted in the LORD even when I said to myself, “I am in great pain.”

11.verse: When I was terrified, I said to myself, “No one tells the truth.”

12.verse: The LORD has been so good to me! How can I ever pay him back?

13.verse: I will bring an offering of wine to the LORD and thank him for saving me. I will worship him.

14.verse: In front of all the LORD’s people, I will do what I promised him.

15.verse: The LORD pays special attention when his faithful people die.

16.verse: LORD, I serve you. I serve you just as my mother did. You have set me free from the chains of my suffering.

17.verse: LORD, I will sacrifice a thank offering to you. I will worship you.

18.verse: In front of all the LORD’s people, I will do what I promised him.

19.verse: I will keep my promise in the courtyards of the LORD’s temple. I will keep my promise in Jerusalem itself. Praise the LORD.

1.verse: All you nations, praise the LORD. All you people on earth, praise him.

2.verse: Great is his love for us. The LORD is faithful forever. Praise the LORD.

1.verse: Give thanks to the LORD, because he is good. His faithful love continues forever.

2.verse: Let the people of Israel say, “His faithful love continues forever.”

3.verse: Let the priests of Aaron say, “His faithful love continues forever.”

4.verse: Let those who have respect for the LORD say, “His faithful love continues forever.”

5.verse: When I was in great trouble, I cried out to the LORD. He answered me and set me free from my trouble.

6.verse: The LORD is with me. I will not be afraid. What can mere human beings do to me?

7.verse: The LORD is with me. He helps me. I win the battle over my enemies.

8.verse: It is better to go to the LORD for safety than to trust in mere human beings.

9.verse: It is better to go to the LORD for safety than to trust in human leaders.

10.verse: The nations were all around me. But by the LORD’s power I destroyed them.

11.verse: They were around me on every side. But by the LORD’s power I destroyed them.

12.verse: They attacked me like swarms of bees. But they were burned up as quickly as thorns in a fire. By the LORD’s power I destroyed them.

13.verse: I was pushed back and about to be killed. But the LORD helped me.

14.verse: The LORD gives me strength and makes me secure. He has saved me.

15.verse: Shouts of joy ring out in the tents of godly people. They praise him for his help in battle. They shout, “The LORD’s powerful right hand has done mighty things!

16.verse: The LORD’s powerful right hand has won the battle! The LORD’s powerful right hand has done mighty things!”

17.verse: I will not die but live. I will talk about what the LORD has done.

18.verse: The LORD has really punished me. But he didn’t let me die.

19.verse: Open for me the gates where the godly can go in. I will enter and give thanks to the LORD.

20.verse: This is the gate of the LORD. Only those who do what is right can go through it.

21.verse: LORD, I will give thanks to you, because you answered me. You have saved me.

22.verse: The stone the builders didn’t accept has become the most important stone of all.

23.verse: The LORD has done it. It is wonderful in our eyes.

24.verse: The LORD has done it on this day. Let us be joyful today and be glad.

25.verse: LORD, save us. LORD, give us success.

26.verse: Blessed is the one who comes in the name of the LORD. From the temple of the LORD we bless you.

27.verse: The LORD is God. He has been good to us. Take branches in your hands. Join in the march on the day of the feast. March up to the corners of the altar.

28.verse: You are my God, and I will praise you. You are my God, and I will honor you.

29.verse: Give thanks to the LORD, because he is good. His faithful love continues forever.

1.verse: א Aleph Blessed are those who live without blame. They live in keeping with the law of the LORD.

2.verse: Blessed are those who obey his covenant laws. They trust in him with all their hearts.

3.verse: They don’t do anything wrong. They live as he wants them to live.

4.verse: You have given me rules that I must obey completely.

5.verse: I hope I will always stand firm in following your orders.

6.verse: Then I won’t be put to shame when I think about all your commands.

7.verse: I will praise you with an honest heart as I learn about how fair your decisions are.

8.verse: I will obey your orders. Please don’t leave me all alone.

9.verse: ב Beth How can a young person keep their life pure? By living according to your word.

10.verse: I trust in you with all my heart. Don’t let me wander away from your commands.

11.verse: I have hidden your word in my heart so that I won’t sin against you.

12.verse: LORD, I give praise to you. Teach me your orders.

13.verse: With my lips I talk about all the decisions you have made.

14.verse: Following your covenant laws gives me joy just as great riches give joy to others.

15.verse: I spend time thinking about your rules. I consider how you want me to live.

16.verse: I take delight in your orders. I won’t fail to obey your word.

17.verse: ג Gimel Be good to me while I am alive. Do this so that I may obey your word.

18.verse: Open my eyes so that I can see the wonderful truths in your law.

19.verse: I’m a stranger on earth. Don’t hide your commands from me.

20.verse: My heart is filled with longing for your laws at all times.

21.verse: You correct proud people. They are under your curse. They wander away from your commands.

22.verse: I obey your covenant laws. So don’t let evil people laugh at me or hate me.

23.verse: Even if rulers sit together and tell lies about me, I will spend time thinking about your orders.

24.verse: Your covenant laws are my delight. They give me wise advice.

25.verse: ד Daleth I lie in the dust. I’m about to die. Keep me alive as you have promised.

26.verse: I told you how I’ve lived, and you gave me your answer. Teach me your orders.

27.verse: Help me understand how your rules direct me to live. Then I may think deeply about the wonderful things you have done.

28.verse: My sadness has worn me out. Give me strength as you have promised.

29.verse: Keep me from cheating and telling lies. Be kind to me and teach me your law.

30.verse: I have chosen to be faithful to you. I put my trust in your laws.

31.verse: LORD, I’m careful to obey your covenant laws. Don’t let me be put to shame.

32.verse: I am quick to follow your commands, because you have added to my understanding.

33.verse: ה He LORD, teach me how your orders direct me to live. Then I will live that way to the very end.

34.verse: Help me understand your law so that I may follow it. I will obey it with all my heart.

35.verse: Teach me to live as you command, because that makes me very happy.

36.verse: Make me want to follow your covenant laws instead of wanting to gain things only for myself.

37.verse: Turn my eyes away from things that are worthless. Keep me alive as you have promised.

38.verse: Keep your promise to me. Then other people will have respect for you.

39.verse: Please don’t let me be put to shame. Your laws are good.

40.verse: I really want to follow your rules. Keep me alive, because you do what is right.

41.verse: ו Waw LORD, show me your faithful love. Save me as you have promised.

42.verse: Then I can answer anyone who makes fun of me, because I trust in your word.

43.verse: Help me always to tell the truth about how faithful you are. I have put my hope in your laws.

44.verse: I will always obey your law, for ever and ever.

45.verse: I will lead a full and happy life, because I’ve tried to obey your rules.

46.verse: I will talk about your covenant laws to kings. I will not be put to shame.

47.verse: I take delight in obeying your commands because I love them.

48.verse: I reach out for your commands that I love. I do this so that I may think deeply about your orders.

49.verse: ז Zayin Remember what you have said to me. You have given me hope.

50.verse: Even when I suffer, I am comforted because you promised to keep me alive.

51.verse: Proud people make fun of me without mercy. But I don’t turn away from your law.

52.verse: LORD, I remember the laws you gave long ago. I find comfort in them.

53.verse: I am very angry because evil people have turned away from your law.

54.verse: No matter where I live, I sing about your orders.

55.verse: LORD, during the night I remember who you are. That’s why I keep your law.

56.verse: I have really done my best to obey your rules.

57.verse: ח Heth LORD, you are everything I need. I have promised to obey your words.

58.verse: I have looked to you with all my heart. Be kind to me as you have promised.

59.verse: I have thought about the way I live. And I have decided to follow your covenant laws.

60.verse: I won’t waste any time. I will be quick to obey your commands.

61.verse: Evil people may tie me up with ropes. But I won’t forget to obey your law.

62.verse: At midnight I get up to give you thanks because your decisions are very fair.

63.verse: I’m a friend to everyone who has respect for you. I’m a friend to everyone who follows your rules.

64.verse: LORD, the earth is filled with your love. Teach me your orders.

65.verse: ט Teth LORD, be good to me as you have promised.

66.verse: Increase my knowledge and give me good sense, because I trust your commands.

67.verse: Before I went through suffering, I went down the wrong path. But now I obey your word.

68.verse: You are good, and what you do is good. Teach me your orders.

69.verse: The lies of proud people have taken away my good name. But I follow your rules with all my heart.

70.verse: Their unfeeling hearts are hard and stubborn. But I take delight in your law.

71.verse: It was good for me to suffer. That’s what helped me to understand your orders.

72.verse: The law you gave is worth more to me than thousands of pieces of silver and gold.

73.verse: י Yodh You made me and formed me with your own hands. Give me understanding so that I can learn your commands.

74.verse: May those who have respect for you be filled with joy when they see me. I have put my hope in your word.

75.verse: LORD, I know that your laws are right. You were faithful to your promise when you made me suffer.

76.verse: May your faithful love comfort me as you have promised me.

77.verse: Show me your tender love so that I can live. I take delight in your law.

78.verse: May proud people be put to shame for treating me badly for no reason. I will think deeply about your rules.

79.verse: May those who have respect for you come to me. Then I can teach them your covenant laws.

80.verse: May I follow your orders with all my heart. Then I won’t be put to shame.

81.verse: כ Kaph I deeply long for you to save me. I have put my hope in your word.

82.verse: My eyes grow tired looking for what you have promised. I say, “When will you comfort me?”

83.verse: I’m as useless as a wineskin that smoke has dried up. But I don’t forget to follow your orders.

84.verse: How long do I have to wait? When will you punish those who attack me?

85.verse: Proud people do what is against your law. They dig pits for me to fall into.

86.verse: All your commands can be trusted. Help me, because people attack me without any reason.

87.verse: They almost wiped me off the face of the earth. But I have not turned away from your rules.

88.verse: Keep me alive, because of your faithful love. Do this so that I may obey the covenant laws you have given.

89.verse: ל Lamedh LORD, your word lasts forever. It stands firm in the heavens.

90.verse: You will be faithful for all time to come. You made the earth, and it continues to exist.

91.verse: Your laws continue to this very day, because all things serve you.

92.verse: If I had not taken delight in your law, I would have died because of my suffering.

93.verse: I will never forget your rules. You have kept me alive, because I obey them.

94.verse: Save me, because I belong to you. I’ve tried to obey your rules.

95.verse: Sinful people are waiting to destroy me. But I will spend time thinking about your covenant laws.

96.verse: I’ve learned that everything has its limits. But your commands are perfect. They are always there when I need them.

97.verse: מ Mem LORD, I really love your law! All day long I spend time thinking about it.

98.verse: Your commands make me wiser than my enemies, because your commands are always in my heart.

99.verse: I know more than all my teachers do, because I spend time thinking about your covenant laws.

100.verse: I understand more than the elders do, because I obey your rules.

101.verse: I’ve kept my feet from every path that sinners take so that I might obey your word.

102.verse: I haven’t turned away from your laws, because you yourself have taught me.

103.verse: Your words are very sweet to my taste! They are sweeter than honey to me.

104.verse: I gain understanding from your rules. So I hate every path that sinners take.

105.verse: נ Nun Your word is like a lamp that shows me the way. It is like a light that guides me.

106.verse: I have made a promise to follow your laws, because they are right.

107.verse: I have suffered very much. LORD, keep me alive as you have promised.

108.verse: LORD, accept the praise I freely give you. Teach me your laws.

109.verse: I keep putting my life in danger. But I won’t forget to obey your law.

110.verse: Evil people have set a trap for me. But I haven’t wandered away from your rules.

111.verse: Your covenant laws are your gift to me forever. They fill my heart with joy.

112.verse: I have decided to obey your orders to the very end.

113.verse: ס Samekh I hate people who can’t make up their minds. But I love your law.

114.verse: You are my place of safety. You are like a shield that keeps me safe. I have put my hope in your word.

115.verse: Get away from me, you who do evil! Then I can do what my God commands me to do.

116.verse: My God, keep me going as you have promised. Then I will live. Don’t let me lose all hope.

117.verse: Take good care of me, and I will be saved. I will always honor your orders.

118.verse: You turn your back on all those who wander away from your orders. Their wrong thoughts will be proved to be wrong.

119.verse: You throw away all the sinners on earth as if they were trash. So I love your covenant laws.

120.verse: My body trembles because I have respect for you. I have great respect for your laws.

121.verse: ע Ayin I have done what is right and fair. So don’t leave me to those who treat me badly.

122.verse: Make sure that everything goes well with me. Don’t let proud people treat me badly.

123.verse: My eyes grow tired as I look to you to save me. Please save me as you have promised.

124.verse: Be good to me, because you love me. Teach me your orders.

125.verse: I serve you, so help me to understand what is right. Then I will understand your covenant laws.

126.verse: LORD, it’s time for you to act. People are breaking your law.

127.verse: I love your commands more than gold. I love them more than pure gold.

128.verse: I consider all your rules to be right. So I hate every path that sinners take.

129.verse: פ Pe Your covenant laws are wonderful. So I obey them.

130.verse: When your words are made clear, they bring light. They bring understanding to childish people.

131.verse: I open my mouth and pant like a dog, because I long to know your commands.

132.verse: Turn to me and have mercy on me. That’s what you’ve always done for those who love you.

133.verse: Teach me how to live as you have promised. Don’t let any sin be my master.

134.verse: Set me free from people who treat me badly. Then I will obey your rules.

135.verse: Have mercy on me. Teach me your orders.

136.verse: Streams of tears flow from my eyes, because people don’t obey your law.

137.verse: צ Tsadhe LORD, you do what is fair. And your laws are right.

138.verse: The laws you have made are fair. They can be completely trusted.

139.verse: My anger is wearing me out, because my enemies don’t pay any attention to your words.

140.verse: Your promises have proved to be true. I love them.

141.verse: I’m not important. People look down on me. But I don’t forget to obey your rules.

142.verse: You always do what is right. And your law is true.

143.verse: I’ve had my share of trouble and suffering. But your commands give me delight.

144.verse: Your covenant laws are always right. Help me to understand them. Then I will live.

145.verse: ק Qoph LORD, I call out to you with all my heart. Answer me, and I will obey your orders.

146.verse: I call out to you. Save me, and I will keep your covenant laws.

147.verse: I get up before the sun rises. I cry out for help. I’ve put my hope in your word.

148.verse: My eyes stay open all night long. I spend my time thinking about your promises.

149.verse: Listen to me, because you love me. LORD, keep me alive as you have promised.

150.verse: Those who think up evil plans are near. They have wandered far away from your law.

151.verse: But LORD, you are near. All your commands are true.

152.verse: Long ago I learned from your covenant laws that you made them to last forever.

153.verse: ר Resh Look at how I’m suffering! Save me, because I haven’t forgotten to obey your law.

154.verse: Stand up for me and set me free. Keep me alive as you have promised.

155.verse: Those who are evil are far from being saved. They don’t want to obey your orders.

156.verse: LORD, you have deep concern for me. Keep me alive as you have promised.

157.verse: Many enemies attack me. But I haven’t turned away from your covenant laws.

158.verse: I get very angry when I see people who aren’t faithful to you. They don’t obey your word.

159.verse: See how I love your rules! LORD, keep me alive, because you love me.

160.verse: All your words are true. All your laws are right. They last forever.

161.verse: ש Sin and Shin Rulers attack me for no reason. But I tremble because of your word.

162.verse: I’m filled with joy because of your promise. It’s like finding a great fortune.

163.verse: I hate lies with a deep hatred. But I love your law.

164.verse: Seven times a day I praise you for your laws, because they are right.

165.verse: Those who love your law enjoy great peace. Nothing can make them trip and fall.

166.verse: LORD, I wait for you to save me. I follow your commands.

167.verse: I obey your covenant laws, because I love them greatly.

168.verse: I obey your rules and your covenant laws, because you know all about how I live.

169.verse: ת Taw LORD, may you hear my cry. Give me understanding, just as you said you would.

170.verse: May you hear my prayer. Save me, just as you promised.

171.verse: May my lips pour out praise to you, because you teach me your orders.

172.verse: May my tongue sing about your word, because all your commands are right.

173.verse: May your hand be ready to help me, because I have chosen to obey your rules.

174.verse: LORD, I long for you to save me. Your law gives me delight.

175.verse: Let me live so that I can praise you. May your laws keep me going.

176.verse: Like a lost sheep, I’ve gone down the wrong path. Come and look for me, because I haven’t forgotten to obey your commands.

1.verse: A song for those who go up to Jerusalem to worship the LORD. I call out to the LORD when I’m in trouble, and he answers me.

2.verse: LORD, save me from people whose lips tell lies. Save me from people whose tongues don’t tell the truth.

3.verse: What will the LORD do to you, you lying tongue? And what more will he do?

4.verse: He will punish you with the sharp arrows of a soldier. He will punish you with burning coals from a desert bush.

5.verse: How terrible it is for me to live in the tents of the people of Meshek! How terrible to live in the tents of the people of Kedar!

6.verse: I have lived too long among those who hate peace.

7.verse: I want peace. But when I speak, they want war.

1.verse: A song for those who go up to Jerusalem to worship the LORD. I look up to the mountains. Where does my help come from?

2.verse: My help comes from the LORD. He is the Maker of heaven and earth.

3.verse: He won’t let your foot slip. He who watches over you won’t get tired.

4.verse: In fact, he who watches over Israel won’t get tired or go to sleep.

5.verse: The LORD watches over you. The LORD is like a shade tree at your right hand.

6.verse: The sun won’t harm you during the day. The moon won’t harm you during the night.

7.verse: The LORD will keep you from every kind of harm. He will watch over your life.

8.verse: The LORD will watch over your life no matter where you go, both now and forever.

1.verse: A song for those who go up to Jerusalem to worship the LORD. A psalm of David. I was very glad when they said to me, “Let us go up to the house of the LORD.”

2.verse: Jerusalem, our feet are standing inside your gates.

3.verse: Jerusalem is built like a city where everything is close together.

4.verse: The tribes of the LORD go there to praise his name. They do it in keeping with the law he gave to Israel.

5.verse: The thrones of the family line of David are there. That’s where the people are judged.

6.verse: Pray for the peace of Jerusalem. Say, “May those who love you be secure.

7.verse: May there be peace inside your walls. May your people be kept safe.”

8.verse: I’m concerned for my family and friends. So I say to Jerusalem, “May you enjoy peace.”

9.verse: I’m concerned about the house of the LORD our God. So I pray that things will go well with Jerusalem.

1.verse: A song for those who go up to Jerusalem to worship the LORD. I look up and pray to you. Your throne is in heaven.

2.verse: Slaves depend on their masters. A female slave depends on the woman she works for. In the same way, we depend on the LORD our God. We wait for him to have mercy on us.

3.verse: LORD, have mercy on us. Have mercy on us, because people haven’t stopped making fun of us.

4.verse: We have had to put up with a lot from those who are proud. They were always laughing at us.

1.verse: A song for those who go up to Jerusalem to worship the LORD. A psalm of David. Here is what Israel should say. Suppose the LORD had not been on our side.

2.verse: Suppose the LORD had not been on our side when our enemies attacked us.

3.verse: Suppose he had not been on our side when their burning anger blazed out against us. Then they would have swallowed us alive.

4.verse: They would have been like a flood that drowned us. They would have swept over us like a rushing river.

5.verse: They would have washed us away like a swollen stream.

6.verse: Give praise to the LORD. He has not let our enemies chew us up.

7.verse: We have escaped like a bird from a hunter’s trap. The trap has been broken, and we have escaped.

8.verse: Our help comes from the LORD. He is the Maker of heaven and earth.

1.verse: A song for those who go up to Jerusalem to worship the LORD. Those who trust in the LORD are like Mount Zion. They will always be secure. They will last forever.

2.verse: Like the mountains around Jerusalem, the LORD is all around his people both now and forever.

3.verse: Evil people will not always rule the land the LORD gave to those who do right. If they did, those who do right might do what is evil.

4.verse: LORD, do good to those who are good. Do good to those whose hearts are honest.

5.verse: But the LORD will drive out those who have taken crooked paths. He will drive them out with those who do evil things. May Israel enjoy peace.
