1.verse: A song for those who go up to Jerusalem to worship the LORD. Our enemies took us away from Zion. But when the LORD brought us home, it seemed like a dream to us.

2.verse: Our mouths were filled with laughter. Our tongues sang with joy. Then the people of other nations said, “The LORD has done great things for them.”

3.verse: The LORD has done great things for us. And we are filled with joy.

4.verse: LORD, bless us with great success again, as rain makes streams flow in the Negev Desert.

5.verse: Those who cry as they plant their crops will sing with joy when they gather them in.

6.verse: Those who go out weeping as they carry seeds to plant will come back singing with joy. They will bring the new crop back with them.

1.verse: A song for those who go up to Jerusalem to worship the LORD. A psalm of Solomon. If the LORD doesn’t build a house, the work of the builders is useless. If the LORD doesn’t watch over a city, it’s useless for those on guard duty to stand watch over it.

2.verse: It’s useless for you to work from early morning until late at night just to get food to eat. God provides for those he loves even while they sleep.

3.verse: Children are a gift from the LORD. They are a reward from him.

4.verse: Children who are born to people when they are young are like arrows in the hands of a soldier.

5.verse: Blessed are those who have many children. They won’t be put to shame when they go up against their enemies in court.

1.verse: A song for those who go up to Jerusalem to worship the LORD. Blessed are all those who have respect for the LORD. They live as he wants them to live.

2.verse: Your work will give you what you need. Blessings and good things will come to you.

3.verse: As a vine bears a lot of fruit, so may your wife have many children by you. May they sit around your table like young olive trees.

4.verse: Only a man who has respect for the LORD will be blessed like that.

5.verse: May the LORD bless you from Zion. May you enjoy the good things that come to Jerusalem all the days of your life.

6.verse: May you live to see your grandchildren. May Israel enjoy peace.

1.verse: A song for those who go up to Jerusalem to worship the LORD. Here is what Israel should say. “My enemies have treated me badly ever since I was a young nation.

2.verse: My enemies have treated me badly ever since I was a young nation. But they haven’t won the battle.

3.verse: They have made deep wounds in my back. It looks like a field a farmer has plowed.

4.verse: The LORD does what is right. Sinners had tied me up with ropes. But the LORD has set me free.”

5.verse: May all those who hate Zion be driven back in shame.

6.verse: May they be like grass that grows on the roof of a house. It dries up before it can grow.

7.verse: There isn’t enough of it to fill a person’s hand. There isn’t enough to tie up and carry away.

8.verse: May no one who passes by say to those who hate Zion, “May the blessing of the LORD be on you. We bless you in the name of the LORD.”

1.verse: A song for those who go up to Jerusalem to worship the LORD. LORD, I cry out to you because I’m suffering so deeply.

2.verse: Lord, listen to me. Pay attention to my cry for your mercy.

3.verse: LORD, suppose you kept a close watch on sins. Lord, who then wouldn’t be found guilty?

4.verse: But you forgive. So we can serve you with respect.

5.verse: With all my heart I wait for the LORD to help me. I put my hope in his word.

6.verse: I wait for the Lord to help me. I want his help more than night watchmen want the morning to come. I’ll say it again. I want his help more than night watchmen want the morning to come.

7.verse: Israel, put your hope in the LORD, because the LORD’s love never fails. He sets his people completely free.

8.verse: He himself will set Israel free from all their sins.

1.verse: A song for those who go up to Jerusalem to worship the LORD. A psalm of David. LORD, my heart isn’t proud. My eyes aren’t proud either. I don’t concern myself with important matters. I don’t concern myself with things that are too wonderful for me.

2.verse: I have made myself calm and content like a young child in its mother’s arms. Deep down inside me, I am as content as a young child.

3.verse: Israel, put your hope in the LORD both now and forever.

1.verse: A song for those who go up to Jerusalem to worship the LORD. LORD, remember David and all the times he didn’t do what he wanted.

2.verse: LORD, he made a promise. Mighty One of Jacob, he made a promise to you.

3.verse: He said, “I won’t enter my house or go to bed.

4.verse: I won’t let my eyes sleep. I won’t close my eyelids

5.verse: until I find a place for the LORD. I want to build a house for the Mighty One of Jacob.”

6.verse: Here are the words we heard in Ephrathah. We heard them again in the fields of Kiriath Jearim.

7.verse: “Let us go to the LORD’s house. Let us worship at his feet. Let us say,

8.verse: ‘LORD, rise up and come to your resting place. Come in together with the ark. It’s the sign of your power.

9.verse: May your priests put on godliness as if it were their clothes. May your faithful people sing for joy.’ ”

10.verse: In honor of your servant David, don’t turn your back on your anointed king.

11.verse: The LORD made a promise to David. It is a firm promise that he will never break. He said, “After you die, I will place one of your own sons on your throne.

12.verse: If your sons keep my covenant and the laws I teach them, then their sons will sit on your throne for ever and ever.”

13.verse: The LORD has chosen Zion. That’s the place where he wants to live.

14.verse: He has said, “This will be my resting place for ever and ever. Here I will sit on my throne, because that’s what I want.

15.verse: I will greatly bless Zion with everything it needs. I will give plenty of food to the poor people living there.

16.verse: I will put salvation on its priests as if it were their clothes. God’s faithful people will always sing for joy.

17.verse: “Here in Jerusalem I will raise up a mighty king from the family of David. I will set up the lamp of David’s kingdom for my anointed king. Its flame will burn brightly forever.

18.verse: I will put shame on his enemies as if it were their clothes. But he will wear on his head a shining crown.”

1.verse: A song for those who go up to Jerusalem to worship the LORD. A psalm of David. How good and pleasant it is when God’s people live together in peace!

2.verse: It’s like the special olive oil that was poured on Aaron’s head. It ran down on his beard and on the collar of his robe.

3.verse: It’s as if the dew of Mount Hermon were falling on Mount Zion. There the LORD gives his blessing. He gives life that never ends.

1.verse: A song for those who go up to Jerusalem to worship the LORD. All you who serve the LORD, praise the LORD. All you who serve at night in the house of the LORD, praise him.

2.verse: Lift up your hands in the temple and praise the LORD.

3.verse: May the LORD bless you from Zion. He is the Maker of heaven and earth.

1.verse: Praise the LORD. Praise the name of the LORD. You who serve the LORD, praise him.

2.verse: You who serve in the house of the LORD, praise him. You who serve in the courtyards of the temple of our God, praise him.

3.verse: Praise the LORD, because he is good. Sing praise to his name, because that is pleasant.

4.verse: The LORD has chosen the people of Jacob to be his own. He has chosen Israel to be his special treasure.

5.verse: I know that the LORD is great. I know that our Lord is greater than all gods.

6.verse: The LORD does anything he wants to do in the heavens and on the earth. He does it even in the deepest parts of the oceans.

7.verse: He makes clouds rise from one end of the earth to the other. He sends lightning with the rain. He brings the wind out of his storerooms.

8.verse: He killed the oldest son of each family in Egypt. He struck down the oldest males that were born to people and animals.

9.verse: He did miraculous signs in Egypt. He did wonders against Pharaoh and everyone who served him.

10.verse: He destroyed many nations. He killed mighty kings.

11.verse: He killed Sihon, the king of the Amorites, and Og, the king of Bashan. He killed all the kings of Canaan.

12.verse: He gave their land as a gift to his people Israel.

13.verse: LORD, your name continues forever. LORD, your fame will last for all time to come.

14.verse: When the LORD hands down his sentence, it will be in his people’s favor. He will show deep concern for those who serve him.

15.verse: The statues of the nations’ gods are made out of silver and gold. They are made by human hands.

16.verse: They have mouths but can’t speak. They have eyes but can’t see.

17.verse: They have ears but can’t hear. They have mouths but can’t breathe.

18.verse: Those who make statues of gods will be like them. So will all those who trust in them.

19.verse: People of Israel, praise the LORD. Priests of Aaron, praise the LORD.

20.verse: Tribe of Levi, praise the LORD. You who have respect for the LORD, praise him.

21.verse: Give praise to the LORD in Zion. Give praise to the God who lives in Jerusalem. Praise the LORD.

1.verse: Give thanks to the LORD, because he is good. His faithful love continues forever.

2.verse: Give thanks to the greatest God of all. His faithful love continues forever.

3.verse: Give thanks to the most powerful Lord of all. His faithful love continues forever.

4.verse: Give thanks to the only one who can do great miracles. His faithful love continues forever.

5.verse: By his understanding he made the heavens. His faithful love continues forever.

6.verse: He spread out the earth on the waters. His faithful love continues forever.

7.verse: He made the great lights in the sky. His faithful love continues forever.

8.verse: He made the sun to rule over the day. His faithful love continues forever.

9.verse: He made the moon and stars to rule over the night. His faithful love continues forever.

10.verse: Give thanks to the God who killed the oldest son of each family in Egypt. His faithful love continues forever.

11.verse: He brought the people of Israel out of Egypt. His faithful love continues forever.

12.verse: He did it by reaching out his mighty hand and powerful arm. His faithful love continues forever.

13.verse: Give thanks to the God who parted the waters of the Red Sea. His faithful love continues forever.

14.verse: He brought Israel through the middle of it. His faithful love continues forever.

15.verse: But he swept Pharaoh and his army into the Red Sea. His faithful love continues forever.

16.verse: Give thanks to the God who led his people through the desert. His faithful love continues forever.

17.verse: He killed great kings. His faithful love continues forever.

18.verse: He struck down mighty kings. His faithful love continues forever.

19.verse: He killed Sihon, the king of the Amorites. His faithful love continues forever.

20.verse: He killed Og, the king of Bashan. His faithful love continues forever.

21.verse: He gave their land as a gift. His faithful love continues forever.

22.verse: He gave it as a gift to his servant Israel. His faithful love continues forever.

23.verse: Give thanks to the God who remembered us when things were going badly. His faithful love continues forever.

24.verse: He set us free from our enemies. His faithful love continues forever.

25.verse: He gives food to every creature. His faithful love continues forever.

26.verse: Give thanks to the God of heaven. His faithful love continues forever.

1.verse: We were sitting by the rivers of Babylon. We wept when we remembered what had happened to Zion.

2.verse: On the nearby poplar trees we hung up our harps.

3.verse: Those who held us as prisoners asked us to sing. Those who enjoyed hurting us ordered us to sing joyful songs. They said, “Sing one of the songs of Zion to us!”

4.verse: How can we sing the songs of the LORD while we are in another land?

5.verse: Jerusalem, if I forget you, may my right hand never be able to play the harp again.

6.verse: If I don’t remember you, may my tongue stick to the roof of my mouth so I can’t sing. May it happen if I don’t consider Jerusalem to be my greatest joy.

7.verse: LORD, remember what the people of Edom did on the day Jerusalem fell. “Tear it down!” they cried. “Tear it down to the ground!”

8.verse: People of Babylon, you are sentenced to be destroyed. Happy is the person who pays you back according to what you have done to us.

9.verse: Happy is the person who grabs your babies and smashes them against the rocks.

1.verse: A psalm of David. LORD, I will praise you with all my heart. In front of those who think they are gods I will sing praise to you.

2.verse: I will bow down facing your holy temple. I will praise your name, because you are always loving and faithful. You have honored your holy word even more than your own fame.

3.verse: When I called out to you, you answered me. You made me strong and brave.

4.verse: LORD, may all the kings on earth praise you when they hear about what you have decided.

5.verse: LORD, may they sing about what you have done, because your glory is great.

6.verse: Though the LORD is high above all, he cares for the lowly. Though he is in heaven above, he sees them on earth below.

7.verse: Trouble is all around me, but you keep me alive. You reach out your hand to put a stop to the anger of my enemies. With your powerful right hand you save me.

8.verse: LORD, you will show that I was right to trust you. LORD, your faithful love continues forever. You have done so much for us, so don’t stop now.

1.verse: For the director of music. A psalm of David. LORD, you have seen what is in my heart. You know all about me.

2.verse: You know when I sit down and when I get up. You know what I’m thinking even though you are far away.

3.verse: You know when I go out to work and when I come back home. You know exactly how I live.

4.verse: LORD, even before I speak a word, you know all about it.

5.verse: You are all around me, behind me and in front of me. You hold me safe in your hand.

6.verse: I’m amazed at how well you know me. It’s more than I can understand.

7.verse: How can I get away from your Spirit? Where can I go to escape from you?

8.verse: If I go up to the heavens, you are there. If I lie down in the deepest parts of the earth, you are also there.

9.verse: Suppose I were to rise with the sun in the east. Suppose I travel to the west where it sinks into the ocean.

10.verse: Your hand would always be there to guide me. Your right hand would still be holding me close.

11.verse: Suppose I were to say, “I’m sure the darkness will hide me. The light around me will become as dark as night.”

12.verse: Even that darkness would not be dark to you. The night would shine like the day, because darkness is like light to you.

13.verse: You created the deepest parts of my being. You put me together inside my mother’s body.

14.verse: How you made me is amazing and wonderful. I praise you for that. What you have done is wonderful. I know that very well.

15.verse: None of my bones was hidden from you when you made me inside my mother’s body. That place was as dark as the deepest parts of the earth. When you were putting me together there,

16.verse: your eyes saw my body even before it was formed. You planned how many days I would live. You wrote down the number of them in your book before I had lived through even one of them.

17.verse: God, your thoughts about me are priceless. No one can possibly add them all up.

18.verse: If I could count them, they would be more than the grains of sand. If I were to fall asleep counting and then wake up, you would still be there with me.

19.verse: God, I wish you would kill the people who are evil! I wish those murderers would get away from me!

20.verse: They are your enemies. They misuse your name. They misuse it for their own evil purposes.

21.verse: LORD, I really hate those who hate you! I really hate those who rise up against you!

22.verse: I have nothing but hatred for them. I consider them to be my enemies.

23.verse: God, see what is in my heart. Know what is there. Test me. Know what I’m thinking.

24.verse: See if there’s anything in my life you don’t like. Help me live in the way that is always right.

1.verse: For the director of music. A psalm of David. LORD, save me from sinful people. Keep me safe from those who want to hurt me.

2.verse: They make evil plans in their hearts. They are always starting fights.

3.verse: Their tongues are as deadly as the tongue of a serpent. The words from their lips are like the poison of a snake.

4.verse: LORD, keep me safe from the hands of sinful people. Protect me from those who want to hurt me. They plan ways to trip me up and make me fall.

5.verse: Proud people have hidden their traps to catch me. They have spread out their nets. They have set traps for me along my path.

6.verse: I say to the LORD, “You are my God.” LORD, hear my cry for mercy.

7.verse: LORD and King, you save me because you are strong. You are like a shield that keeps me safe in the day of battle.

8.verse: LORD, don’t give sinners what they want. Don’t let their plans succeed.

9.verse: Those who are all around me proudly raise their heads. May the trouble they planned for me happen to them.

10.verse: May burning coals fall on people like that. May they be thrown into the fire. May they be thrown into muddy pits and never get out.

11.verse: Don’t let people who lie about me be secure in the land. May trouble hunt down those who want to hurt me.

12.verse: I know that the LORD makes sure that poor people are treated fairly. He stands up for those who are in need.

13.verse: I’m sure that those who do right will praise your name. Those who are honest will live with you.

1.verse: A psalm of David. I call out to you, LORD. Come quickly to help me. Listen to me when I call out to you.

2.verse: May my prayer come to you like the sweet smell of incense. When I lift up my hands in prayer, may it be like the evening sacrifice.

3.verse: LORD, guard my mouth. Keep watch over the door of my lips.

4.verse: Don’t let my heart be drawn to what is evil. Don’t let me join with people who do evil. Don’t let me eat their fancy food.

5.verse: If a godly person hit me, it would be an act of kindness. If they would correct me, it would be like pouring olive oil on my head. I wouldn’t say no to it. I will always pray against the things that sinful people do.

6.verse: When their rulers are thrown down from the rocky cliffs, those evil people will realize that my words were true.

7.verse: They will say, “As clumps of dirt are left from plowing up the ground, so our bones will be scattered near an open grave.”

8.verse: But LORD and King, I keep looking to you for help. I go to you for safety. Don’t let me die.

9.verse: Keep me from the traps of those who do evil. Save me from the traps they have set for me.

10.verse: Let evil people fall into their own nets. But let me go safely on my way.

1.verse: A prayer of David when he was in the cave. A maskil. I call out to the LORD. I pray to him for mercy.

2.verse: I pour out my problem to him. I tell him about my trouble.

3.verse: When I grow weak, you are watching over my life. In the path where I walk, people have hidden a trap to catch me.

4.verse: Look and see that no one is on my right side to help me. No one is concerned about me. I have no place of safety. No one cares whether I live or die.

5.verse: LORD, I cry out to you. I say, “You are my place of safety. You are everything I need in this life.”

6.verse: Listen to my cry. I am in great need. Save me from those who are chasing me. They are too strong for me.

7.verse: My troubles are like a prison. Set me free so I can praise your name. Then those who do what is right will gather around me because you have been good to me.

1.verse: A psalm of David. LORD, hear my prayer. Listen to my cry for mercy. You are faithful and right. Come and help me.

2.verse: Don’t take me to court and judge me, because in your eyes no living person does what is right.

3.verse: My enemies chase me. They crush me down to the ground. They make me live in the darkness like those who died long ago.

4.verse: So I grow weak. Deep down inside me, I’m afraid.

5.verse: I remember what happened long ago. I spend time thinking about all your acts. I consider what your hands have done.

6.verse: I spread out my hands to you in prayer. I’m thirsty for you, just as dry ground is thirsty for rain.

7.verse: LORD, answer me quickly. I’m growing weak. Don’t turn your face away from me, or I will be like those who go down into the grave.

8.verse: In the morning let me hear about your faithful love, because I’ve put my trust in you. Show me the way I should live, because I trust you with my life.

9.verse: LORD, save me from my enemies, because I go to you for safety.

10.verse: Teach me to do what you want, because you are my God. May your good Spirit lead me on a level path.

11.verse: LORD, bring yourself honor by keeping me alive. Because you do what is right, get me out of trouble.

12.verse: Because your love is faithful, put an end to my enemies. Destroy all of them, because I serve you.

1.verse: A psalm of David. Give praise to the LORD, my Rock. He trains my hands for war. He trains my fingers for battle.

2.verse: He is my loving God and is like a fort to me. He is my place of safety and the God who saves me. He is like a shield that keeps me safe. He brings nations under my control.

3.verse: LORD, what are human beings that you take care of them? What are mere people that you think about them?

4.verse: Their lives don’t last any longer than a breath. Their days are like a shadow that quickly disappears.

5.verse: LORD, open up your heavens and come down. Touch the mountains, and they will pour out smoke.

6.verse: Send flashes of lightning and scatter my enemies. Shoot your arrows and chase them away.

7.verse: My enemies are like a mighty flood. Reach down from heaven and save me. Save me from outsiders who attack me.

8.verse: They tell all kinds of lies with their mouths. Even when they make a promise by raising their right hands, they don’t mean it.

9.verse: My God, I will sing a new song to you. I will make music to you on a lyre that has ten strings.

10.verse: You are the God who helps kings win battles. You save your servant David. From death by the sword

11.verse: save me. Set me free from outsiders who attack me. They tell all kinds of lies with their mouths. Even when they make a promise by raising their right hands, they don’t mean it.

12.verse: While our sons are young, they will be like healthy plants. Our daughters will be like pillars that have been made to decorate a palace.

13.verse: Our storerooms will be filled with every kind of food. The sheep in our fields will increase by thousands. They will increase by tens of thousands.

14.verse: Our oxen will pull heavy loads. None of our city walls will be broken down. No one will be carried off as a prisoner. No cries of pain will be heard in our streets.

15.verse: Blessed is the nation about whom all these things are true. Blessed is the nation whose God is the LORD.

1.verse: A psalm of praise. A psalm of David. I will honor you, my God the King. I will praise your name for ever and ever.

2.verse: Every day I will praise you. I will praise your name for ever and ever.

3.verse: LORD, you are great. You are really worthy of praise. No one can completely understand how great you are.

4.verse: Parents praise your works to their children. They tell about your mighty acts.

5.verse: They speak about your glorious majesty. I will spend time thinking about your wonderful deeds.

6.verse: They speak about the powerful and wonderful things you do. I will talk about the great things you have done.

7.verse: They celebrate your great goodness. They sing for joy about your holy acts.

8.verse: The LORD is gracious, kind and tender. He is slow to get angry and full of love.

9.verse: The LORD is good to all. He shows deep concern for everything he has made.

10.verse: LORD, all your works praise you. Your faithful people praise you.

11.verse: They tell about your glorious kingdom. They speak about your power.

12.verse: Then all people will know about the mighty things you have done. They will know about the glorious majesty of your kingdom.

13.verse: Your kingdom is a kingdom that will last forever. Your rule will continue for all time to come. The LORD will keep all his promises. He is faithful in everything he does.

14.verse: The LORD takes good care of all those who fall. He lifts up all those who feel helpless.

15.verse: Every living thing looks to you for food. You give it to them exactly when they need it.

16.verse: You open your hand and satisfy the needs of every living creature.

17.verse: The LORD is right in everything he does. He is faithful in everything he does.

18.verse: The LORD is ready to help all those who call out to him. He helps those who really mean it when they call out to him.

19.verse: He satisfies the needs of those who have respect for him. He hears their cry and saves them.

20.verse: The LORD watches over all those who love him. But he will destroy all sinful people.

21.verse: I will praise the LORD with my mouth. Let every creature praise his holy name for ever and ever.

1.verse: Praise the LORD. I will praise the LORD.

2.verse: I will praise the LORD all my life. I will sing praise to my God as long as I live.

3.verse: Don’t put your trust in human leaders. Don’t trust in people who can’t save you.

4.verse: When they die, they return to the ground. On that day their plans come to nothing.

5.verse: Blessed are those who depend on the God of Jacob for help. Blessed are those who put their hope in the LORD their God.

6.verse: He is the Maker of heaven and earth and the ocean. He made everything in them. He remains faithful forever.

7.verse: He stands up for those who are treated badly. He gives food to hungry people. The LORD sets prisoners free.

8.verse: The LORD gives sight to those who are blind. The LORD lifts up those who feel helpless. The LORD loves those who do what is right.

9.verse: The LORD watches over the outsiders who live in our land. He takes good care of children whose fathers have died. He also takes good care of widows. But he causes evil people to fail in everything they do.

10.verse: The LORD rules forever. The God of Zion will rule for all time to come. Praise the LORD.

1.verse: Praise the LORD. How good it is to sing praises to our God! How pleasant and right it is to praise him!

2.verse: The LORD builds up Jerusalem. He gathers the scattered people of Israel.

3.verse: He heals those who have broken hearts. He takes care of their wounds.

4.verse: He decides how many stars there should be. He gives each one of them a name.

5.verse: Great is our Lord. His power is mighty. There is no limit to his understanding.

6.verse: The LORD gives strength to those who aren’t proud. But he throws evil people down to the ground.

7.verse: Sing to the LORD and give him grateful praise. Make music to our God on the harp.

8.verse: He covers the sky with clouds. He supplies the earth with rain. He makes grass grow on the hills.

9.verse: He provides food for the cattle. He provides for the young ravens when they cry out.

10.verse: He doesn’t take pleasure in the strength of horses. He doesn’t take delight in the strong legs of warriors.

11.verse: The LORD takes delight in those who have respect for him. They put their hope in his faithful love.

12.verse: Jerusalem, praise the LORD. Zion, praise your God.

13.verse: He makes the metal bars of your gates stronger. He blesses the people who live inside you.

14.verse: He keeps your borders safe and secure. He satisfies you with the finest wheat.

15.verse: He sends his command to the earth. His word arrives there quickly.

16.verse: He spreads the snow like wool. He scatters the frost like ashes.

17.verse: He throws down his hail like pebbles. No one can stand his icy blast.

18.verse: He gives his command, and the ice melts. He stirs up his winds, and the waters flow.

19.verse: He has made his word known to the people of Jacob. He has made his laws and rules known to Israel.

20.verse: He hasn’t done that for any other nation. They don’t know his laws. Praise the LORD.

1.verse: Praise the LORD. Praise the LORD from the heavens. Praise him in the heavens above.

2.verse: Praise him, all his angels. Praise him, all his angels in heaven.

3.verse: Praise him, sun and moon. Praise him, all you shining stars.

4.verse: Praise him, you highest heavens. Praise him, you waters above the skies.

5.verse: Let all of them praise the name of the LORD, because at his command they were created.

6.verse: He established them for ever and ever. He gave them laws they will always have to obey.

7.verse: Praise the LORD from the earth, you great sea creatures and all the deepest parts of the ocean.

8.verse: Praise him, lightning and hail, snow and clouds. Praise him, you stormy winds that obey him.

9.verse: Praise him, all you mountains and hills. Praise him, all you fruit trees and cedar trees.

10.verse: Praise him, all you wild animals and cattle. Praise him, you small creatures and flying birds.

11.verse: Praise him, you kings of the earth and all nations. Praise him, all you princes and rulers on earth.

12.verse: Praise him, young men and women. Praise him, old men and children.

13.verse: Let them praise the name of the LORD. His name alone is honored. His glory is higher than the earth and the heavens.

14.verse: He has given his people a strong king. All his faithful people praise him for that gift. All the people of Israel are close to his heart. Praise the LORD.

1.verse: Praise the LORD. Sing a new song to the LORD. Sing praise to him in the assembly of his faithful people.

2.verse: Let Israel be filled with joy because God is their Maker. Let the people of Zion be glad because he is their King.

3.verse: Let them praise his name with dancing. Let them make music to him with harps and tambourines.

4.verse: The LORD takes delight in his people. He awards with victory those who are humble.

5.verse: Let his faithful people be filled with joy because of that honor. Let them sing for joy even when they are lying in bed.

6.verse: May they praise God with their mouths. May they hold in their hands a sword that has two edges.

7.verse: Let them pay the nations back. Let them punish the people of the earth.

8.verse: Let them put the kings of those nations in chains. Let them put their nobles in iron chains.

9.verse: Let them carry out God’s sentence against those nations. This will bring glory to all his faithful people. Praise the LORD.

1.verse: Praise the LORD. Praise God in his holy temple. Praise him in his mighty heavens.

2.verse: Praise him for his powerful acts. Praise him because he is greater than anything else.

3.verse: Praise him by blowing trumpets. Praise him with harps and lyres.

4.verse: Praise him with tambourines and dancing. Praise him with stringed instruments and flutes.

5.verse: Praise him with clashing cymbals. Praise him with clanging cymbals.

6.verse: Let everything that has breath praise the LORD. Praise the LORD.
